description:
We are looking for a technically strong Project Manager who enjoys working at the intersection of technology, people, and delivery and guides guide challenging computer vision projects from concept to deployment.

You lead a team of engineers and act as the main point of contact for customers. You combine technical understanding with structured project leadership and ensure that solutions are robust, scalable, and ready for real-world use.

This role requires a broad technical foundation with depth where it matters. You understand how the different layers of a vision system connect — from optical design and hardware integration to software architecture, algorithms, AI models, and testing methodology.

What You Will Do
Lead End-to-End Vision Projects
Guide the development of advanced computer vision systems.
Oversee the full stack: optical setup, hardware design, embedded/software components, algorithms, AI models, and validation.
Ensure solutions are architecturally sound and future-proof.
Balance innovation with reliable delivery.
Own Customer Collaboration
Translate customer needs into structured technical roadmaps.
Act as the primary contact throughout the project lifecycle.
Align technical decisions with business objectives.
Communicate progress, risks, and trade-offs clearly.
Drive Engineering Excellence
Contribute to system architecture decisions.
Safeguard software quality and maintainability.
Ensure strong development processes across projects.
Embed DevOps practices (CI/CD, automation, deployment) and MLOps principles (model lifecycle, monitoring, reproducibility).
Ensure Structured Delivery
Manage planning, resources, budgets, and reporting.
Coordinate internal teams and external partners.
Contribute to improving internal project methodology and tools together with the COO.

Requirements

What You Bring
Technical Breadth with Depth
Experience in Computer Vision, Image Processing, AI, or Machine Learning.
A broad understanding of complete vision systems — not just isolated algorithms.
Awareness of system architecture, integration challenges, and validation strategies.
Experience where R&D meets industrial deployment.

Software & Process Mindset
Strong understanding of modern software development practices.
Experience with DevOps workflows and CI/CD environments.
Familiarity with MLOps and productionizing machine learning systems.
Structured approach to testing, validation, and quality assurance.

Project & Communication Skills
Experience managing complex technical projects.
Strong prioritization and ownership mindset.
Clear communicator, comfortable with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Fluent in Dutch and English.
Project management training or certification is a plus.

Benefits

Apart from a competitive salary package (including company car or equivalent mobility solutions), Apixa offers a fun and exciting work environment where you will be part of a team that is at the forefront of computer vision and machine learning technologies.

We also provide extensive training and educational paths so you can continuously grow your knowledge and sharpen your skills.

description:
Locations: London | Brussels | Amsterdam

Who We Are

Boston Consulting Group partners with leaders in business and society to tackle their most important challenges and capture their greatest opportunities. BCG was the pioneer in business strategy when it was founded in 1963. Today, we help clients with total transformation-inspiring complex change, enabling organizations to grow, building competitive advantage, and driving bottom-line impact.

To succeed, organizations must blend digital and human capabilities. Our diverse, global teams bring deep industry and functional expertise and a range of perspectives to spark change. BCG delivers solutions through leading-edge management consulting along with technology and design, corporate and digital ventures—and business purpose. We work in a uniquely collaborative model across the firm and throughout all levels of the client organization, generating results that allow our clients to thrive.

What You'll Do

The Finance Director for the LAB system (UK, Netherlands, Belgium) is a senior finance leadership role with full accountability for financial stewardship, regulatory compliance, governance, and finance transformation across three complex markets.

The role combines deep technical finance leadership with strategic business partnership, ensuring robust controls, regulatory confidence, and high-quality decision support, while leading a geographically distributed team through ongoing SAP-enabled transformation.

The Finance Director acts as a trusted advisor to system leadership, global finance, and external stakeholders, balancing commercial ambition with prudence, integrity, and long-term sustainability. The role plays a critical part in the overall success of the LAB system, acting as the senior finance authority across markets and contributing directly to system-wide strategic, commercial, and investment decisions.

Key Responsibilities

Financial Leadership & Stewardship

Provide end-to-end financial leadership across the LAB system, with full accountability for financial stewardship, performance management, and decision support.
Ensure accurate, timely, and transparent financial reporting in line with local GAAP, IFRS, and global policies.
Lead budgeting, forecasting, long-range planning, and performance management for the LAB system, including ownership of the annual planning cycle and coordination with global finance timelines.
Translate complex financial information into clear, actionable insights for senior leadership and partners.
Provide strong commercial finance leadership to system and market leadership, supporting decision-making on pricing, client economics, investment prioritisation, and portfolio performance.
Partner closely with Managing Directors and Partners on financial topics with direct client impact, including payment terms, invoicing structures, collections, and transparency on client profitability.
Maintain overall accountability for end-to-end finance operations, ensuring effective and compliant execution of core finance processes across the system.

Regulatory, Tax & External Authority Engagement

Act as the senior finance lead for direct engagement with HMRC (UK), Dutch Tax Authorities, and Belgian regulators.
Oversee statutory compliance across all three markets, including Netherlands SAPIN II anti-corruption compliance and Belgian regulatory requirements.
Serve as the primary senior interface with external auditors (PwC), ensuring audit quality, timely closure, and issue resolution.
Lead responses to tax audits, regulatory reviews, and compliance enquiries with confidence and credibility.
Ensure ongoing compliance with evolving regulatory, tax, and governance frameworks.

Governance, Risk & Internal Controls

Establish and maintain strong internal control environments across all entities.
Ensure compliance with global finance policies while tailoring controls to local regulatory and operational realities.
Oversee risk management, internal audit coordination, pensions governance, insurance, and company secretarial matters.
Proactively identify and mitigate financial, operational, and compliance risks.
Promote consistent application of BCG Finance risk management principles and minimum standards across the system, supporting awareness and disciplined execution.

SAP & Digital Finance Enablement

Act as senior sponsor for SAP-enabled finance operations, ensuring stability post-implementation and continuous optimisation.
Ensure effective embedding of SAP across Record-to-Report, Source-to-Pay, Order-to-Cash, and compliance reporting processes.
Partner with Global Finance and Technology teams to improve data integrity, reporting quality, and automation.
Champion AI literacy and digital adoption within the finance function to enhance efficiency and insight.

Team Leadership (Onshore & Offshore)

Lead and develop a distributed finance organisation, including onshore country teams and offshore/shared service teams.
Manage and mentor senior finance professionals (Controllers, Heads of Finance, senior managers), ensuring depth, succession planning, and capability building.
Create clear accountability models across geographies, balancing centralisation with local statutory needs.
Foster a high-performance, inclusive culture grounded in trust, coaching, and continuous development.

Strategic Business Partnership

Operate as a trusted advisor to the System Leader, Managing Partners, and Global Finance leadership.
Support strategic decisions on pricing, investments, cost optimisation, client contracting, and resource deployment.
Balance short-term performance with long-term value creation, compliance, and reputational integrity.
Contribute to system-wide and global finance initiatives as a senior thought partner.
Collaborate closely with Partner Services and Treasury teams to support effective execution of partner-related financial processes in line with global policies.

What You'll Bring

Essential

Fully qualified accountant (ACA, ACCA, CIMA, CPA or equivalent), with strong academic foundations and a university degree in Finance, Accounting, Economics, or Business Administration.
Extensive (typically 15–20+ years) senior finance leadership experience, including operating as part of a leadership team within professional services, partnership-based, or similarly matrixed environments.
Proven track record of influencing change and driving outcomes within complex, matrixed, international organisations.
Strong hands-on and technical expertise across financial reporting (including US GAAP and local GAAP), tax, audit, compliance, and internal controls.
Proven experience engaging directly with regulators and tax authorities.
Demonstrated ability to lead senior finance professionals across geographies.
Strong SAP literacy and experience operating within ERP-enabled finance environments.
Exceptional stakeholder management and communication skills, with credibility at senior leadership and external authority level.

Desirable

Experience operating in professional services or partnership-based environments.
Exposure to large-scale finance transformation and shared service models.
Experience navigating matrixed global organisations.
Coaching or people development credentials.

Leadership Attributes

Calm, grounded, and values-led leadership style, with high integrity and strong professional judgement.
Coaching-oriented people leader who develops talent, builds trust, and supports long-term capability building.
Comfortable operating in ambiguity and complexity while maintaining clarity and focus.
Strategic thinker with the discipline to execute.

Who You'll Work With

The System Leadership Team and the Regional Teams; other leaders within the Regional Finance Teams as well as the respective teams in the systems; BST, SBUs and global leadership teams, the group of Managing Directors & (Senior) Partners of BCG.

Boston Consulting Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity / expression, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected under national, provincial, or local law, where applicable, and those with criminal histories will be considered in a manner consistent with applicable state and local laws.
BCG is an E - Verify Employer. Click here for more information on E-Verify.

description:
We’re now hiring a Regional Sales Manager, a high-impact role responsible for acquiring new logos in the BLX region. This is a Hybrid role within Belgium.

WHO ARE WE

Alpega Group is a European leader in end-to-end transportation management solutions, bringing together modular SaaS products that enable shippers, carriers, and logistics partners to operate more efficiently and sustainably. Our portfolio includes cutting-edge Transport Management Systems and Europe’s leading Freight Exchange platforms. With 35+ years of industry expertise and over 40 nationalities working with us to drive success, we are committed to transforming logistics while contributing to a greener, more connected supply chain.

As we continue to expand our footprint across Europe and support customers with increasingly complex logistics ecosystems, our ability to deeply understand customer needs, influence executive stakeholders, and deliver measurable business outcomes is essential to our expansion.

ABOUT THE ROLE

This role combines strategic thinking, commercial acumen, and executive-level relationship management. You will be responsible for developing and executing tailored account strategies that maximise customer value, deepen long-term partnerships, and drive revenue growth across complex logistics organisations.

What your responsibilities look like:

You'll apply proven and structured sales methodologies tailored to the target companies and industries, ensuring your success in closing lucrative SaaS deals.
Surpass sales targets by crafting and executing a dynamic and results-driven sales strategy, focused on capturing new clients.
Create a strong sales pipeline by skillfully prospecting, generating high-quality leads, and expertly qualifying them within your designated industries within the DACH region. Our dedicated Marketing and Business Development Teams will provide unwavering support.
Uncover and analyse customer business needs, transforming them into golden opportunities.
Conduct ROI exercises that demonstrate undeniable value and articulate our proposition at every stage of the sales cycle.
With the backing of our Pre-Sales team, deliver captivating product demonstrations, craft compelling proposals, and successfully close contracts.

WHAT WE LOOK FOR IN YOU

Fluency in Dutch and English, at a native or near-native level, is mandatory.

French Fluency is a plus.
Your track record speaks for itself, consistently excelling in B2B SaaS Enterprise Software sales.
Your expertise lies in implementing structured value selling methodologies.
Having deep knowledge of a variety of industries, particularly with logistics/Supply Chain processes, is a significant advantage (If you're not familiar with Logistics/Supply Chain processes, don't worry. We will provide thorough onboarding and immerse you in the world of logistics).
Networking, hunting for new customer relationships, and confidently engaging with senior managers and executives (C-level) is where you shine.
You thrive in an ever-changing, fast-paced environment, where adaptability is key. Embracing dynamic challenges is what fuels your drive for success.
An entrepreneurial mindset sets you apart. You are self-driven, dynamic, resilient, and relentlessly focused on achieving results. Your passion for making an impact fuels your motivation.

WHAT WE OFFER YOU

A competitive salary package with an incentivised ramp-up period at the beginning of your experience.
An international work environment that champions autonomy, innovation, and proactivity.
International working environment, with over 45 nationalities in the Alpega Team.
A high-impact role at the centre of growth strategy across the whole territory.
Your efforts will result in substantial financial rewards (with accelerators defined to recognise deal structures and overperformance) and contribute to a more sustainable planet.

Learn more about Life at Alpega & Alpega | Career

Our commitment to you

The Alpega Group has 500 collaborators with over 45 nationalities, based in our different locations. We are a global team, with different backgrounds, races, faiths and genders. We commit to ensuring that everyone feels included, has opportunities to learn and grow and is happy at work.

If you require any additional support with your application, contact the Talent Acquisition specialist for this position so we can make arrangements for you.

Good luck with your application! We look forward to hearing from you.

description:
Bedrijf

Brady Corporation is an international manufacturer and marketer of complete solutions that identify and protect people, products and places. Brady’s products help customers increase safety, security, productivity and performance and include high-performance labels, signs, safety devices, printing systems, barcode & RFID solutions and software. Founded in 1914, Brady has a diverse customer base in electronics, telecommunications, manufacturing, electrical, construction, medical, aerospace and a variety of other industries. Brady stock trades on the New York Stock Exchange under the symbol BRC. More information is available on the Internet at www.brady.be.

Wat je doet

We are looking for a sales professional to drive our customer engagement to a new level!

As a Territory Sales Manager, you will be responsible for a customer base and defined markets in Belgium & Luxemburg. You will work from home and spend most of your time (80%) visiting customers and distributors in Belgium.

Your role is to identify potential new customers and find new opportunities within existing accounts. To reach sales targets you create opportunities and follow up on leads acquired through marketing efforts, social media and distributors. You will coach the distributors’ sales teams and introduce them to new solutions. You will also map and explore new defined markets and create a sales plan to drive sales growth.

Brady provides a training program to help you succeed and become an industry expert.

You will report to the Sales Director Benelux and you will be part of a team including 12 motivated sales colleagues active in the Benelux.

If you enjoy consultative selling, if you like to engage with interesting companies from a wide variety of industries and if you have an unwavering drive to reach your goals, then this is a great opportunity for you!

Your Responsibilities:

You will become the expert in our product- and cable & wire assortment for the BeLux region.
Maintain and strengthen existing customer and distributor relationships through regular contact and timely follow up.
Develop target accounts, within defined target markets, together with distributors to gain new, long-term customers.
Present, demonstrate and cross sell a wide range of Brady products/services to each of your customers and distributors.
Train distribution partners on new Brady products, and on how to prospect for future opportunities.
Forecast and report incoming business activity on a weekly and monthly basis.
Work closely with technical support, customer service, and inside sales to provide a great customer experience to both end-users and distributors.
Plan all sales activities and log related opportunities in Salesforce.com.
Identify, track, and report on regional market information, end-users, distributors, and competitors.

Wie je bent

Bachelor’s degree or equivalent commercial experience.
Minimum 5-7 years of sales experience (preferably with distributor networks).
Fluent in Dutch, French and English.
You are curious, have a genuine appetite for learning and are open to coaching and on-the-job learning.
You are a patient negotiator and you have strong verbal communication and diplomacy skills.
You are organized and you can comfortably manage multiple tasks.
You are able to sell a broad range of technical solutions.
You can work independently.

Wij bieden

At Brady, we offer more than just a job; we provide an inspiring environment where you can grow. Here is what you can expect:

A Brand New, Modern Workspace: Work from our state-of-the-art, brand-new office building designed to foster creativity, collaboration, and comfort.

A Vibrant & Fun Atmosphere: Join a workplace where the energy is high, the environment is welcoming, and we celebrate our successes together.

Enthusiastic & Supportive Colleagues: Become part of a professional team of driven colleagues who are passionate about what they do and always ready to support one another.

Comprehensive Benefits Package: We value your contribution and offer a competitive and extensive salary benefits package

Innovation & Growth: Be part of a global leader that values innovation and provides opportunities to develop your skills and career.

Permanent function, home-office based.

Contact

You can easily apply via our career page

  • You are a patient negotiator and you have strong verbal communication and diplomacy skills.
  • You are organized and you can comfortably manage multiple tasks.
  • You are able to sell a broad range of technical solutions.
  • You can work independently.

Wij bieden

At Brady, we offer more than just a job; we provide an inspiring environment where you can grow. Here is what you can expect:

  • A Brand New, Modern Workspace: Work from our state-of-the-art, brand-new office building designed to foster creativity, collaboration, and comfort.

  • A Vibrant & Fun Atmosphere: Join a workplace where the energy is high, the environment is welcoming, and we celebrate our successes together.

  • Enthusiastic & Supportive Colleagues: Become part of a professional team of driven colleagues who are passionate about what they do and always ready to support one another.

  • Comprehensive Benefits Package: We value your contribution and offer a competitive and extensive salary benefits package

  • Innovation & Growth: Be part of a global leader that values innovation and provides opportunities to develop your skills and career.

  • Permanent function, home-office based.

Contact

You can easily apply via our career page

description:
Do you dream of bringing iconic pralines to life?
Are you ready to drive the development and optimization of our range of irresistible treats, in collaboration with the marketing department and our Master Chocolatiers?
If your answer is yes, this opportunity is for you!

Your Mission

As a Product Manager, you will be the driving force behind our product strategy.
You will manage our entire assortment, from analysis to innovation, while coordinating internal teams and external partners. You will be at the heart of the development process, working closely with our Master Chocolatiers to create products that delight our customers worldwide.

Your Responsibilities
Analyze our current range and propose optimizations to maximize its impact.
Design and manage the product development pipeline, in line with seasonal calendars, with the support of the Marketing Manager.
Lead projects from A to Z, ensuring fluid coordination with all stakeholders.
Serve as the product reference for all questions related to chocolate management and development.
Develop and maintain strong relationships with our external partners.
Your Profile
Higher education or university degree in marketing.
Minimum 5 years of experience in product marketing in the food industry.
Sharp analytical mind and proven experience in project management.
Natural talent for building constructive relationships, based on mutual respect and collaboration.
Curiosity for the technical aspects and production process of chocolate.
Perfect command of Dutch, French, and English.
Why Join Our Team?
Work on products that delight palates worldwide.
Showcase your creativity and expertise in a collaborative environment.
Join a company where craftsmanship and innovation meet to create excellence.

description:
BELGIUM, BRUGGE

Join the Subdued adventure!

Our identity

At Subdued, our mission is simple: to offer our customers that small touch of originality that turns every outfit into a true personal signature and allows them to be unique.

Each collection draws inspiration from the everyday life and world of our customers: their desires, their style, and their energy. Our Italian designers create pieces that embody the boldness, creativity, and authenticity of those who wear them.

Today, Subdued is present with more than 130 stores across Europe, Asia, and America, with flagships in Paris, Dubai, London, Barcelona, Madrid, Amsterdam, Shanghai, and New York.

Subdued is more than a brand it’s a mindset.

A creative, free, and authentic energy.

Together, we grow, evolve, and shape a style that truly fits us.

Working at Subdued means being part of an international and creative environment, where everyone who joins helps write our story and brings our universe to life.

Your responsibilities

As a Store Manager, you are part of the big Subdued family and, thanks to your leadership, energy, and professionalism, you are responsible for the smooth running of the store and the development of your team. Being a Store Manager at Subdued means more than managing a store: you motivate the team, drive commercial results, and guarantee an outstanding customer experience every day.

Store Manager

Monitor the store’s commercial results (turnover, KPIs, targets).
Structure and prioritize daily tasks so the store is always organized, attractive, and fully operational.
Ensure internal procedures and service standards are correctly applied.
Handle complex situations (after-sales, complaints, disputes) and find appropriate solutions.

Team Manager

Lead, coach, and support the team on a daily basis.
Create schedules and monthly planning, and organize the onboarding of new colleagues.
Identify training needs, develop skills, and encourage growth.
Promote a positive team atmosphere, open communication, and a constructive feedback culture.

Brand Ambassador

Represent the Subdued universe and brand values to both customers and the team.
Guarantee a personal and memorable customer experience with every visit.
Ensure the store’s image and presentation (merchandising, display, order, atmosphere).
Keep the Subdued culture alive and strengthen it within the boutique.

Your profile

Do you love customer contact and fashion? Then you’re already well on your way.

You are curious, proactive, and passionate about style. You enjoy working in a team, take initiative, and look for ways every day to improve yourself and your store.

Working at Subdued

At Subdued, we don’t just look for talent — we build a real community.

Our values guide you in your daily work: teamwork, inclusion, curiosity, intuition, loyalty, and reliability. They are the foundation of everything we do and create an environment where everyone can be themselves, express themselves, and grow.

What we offer :

A dynamic, creative environment where initiative is encouraged.
Real growth opportunities, including internationally.
Continuous training opportunities to further develop your skills.
A team that is always ready to support you.
Exclusive benefits and discounts.

Do you recognize yourself in this? Send us your CV and experience the Subdued adventure with us!

Our recruitment process

At Subdued, every application matters. We review every profile carefully and aim to respond within a week.

If your profile is selected, you will first have an initial video call with our HR team, followed by an interview with the Area Manager to get to know you better and discuss the role in detail.

Our offer
Workplace: Zuidzandstraat 40, 8000 Bruges
Contract type: Full-time fixed-term contract (38 hours/week)
#LI-DNI

REQUIREMENTS
Initiative spirit
Problem solving
Communication skills
Team spirit
JOB OFFER DETAILS
Job description Retail
Position type Full time
Career area Store Manager
Geographical position Belgium, Brugge

Posted Date: Feb 13 2026

Product Quality Strategy Leader Senior Director

The posting period will end on the 20th of February in 2026

The role can be done from any location that is close to a GSK location in Europe or in the US
Business Introduction:

We manufacture and supply reliable, high-quality medicines and vaccines to meet patients’ needs and drive our performance.

Our network of 37 medicines and vaccines manufacturing sites delivered 1.7 billion packs of medicines and 409 million vaccine doses in 2024 to help make a positive impact on the health of millions of people. Our supply chain is not just core to our operations; it’s vital to bringing our innovations to patients as quickly, efficiently and effectively as possible. Technology is transforming how we manufacture medicines and vaccines, enabling us to increase the speed, quality and scale of product supply.

We need the very best minds and capability to help us on our journey to make more complex products, harnessing the power of smart manufacturing technologies including robotics, digital solutions and artificial intelligence to deliver for patients.

Position summary:

You will lead the Vaccines Product Quality Strategy organization and shape how quality supports our global supply and patient impact. You will work with leaders across Quality, R&D, Supply and Commercial to set strategy, drive risk-based decisions and embed practical improvements. We value strategic thinking, strong influencing skills, and a hands-on approach to improve quality outcomes. This role offers growth, visible impact on global quality plans, and alignment with our mission of uniting science, technology and talent to get ahead of disease together.

Key responsibilities:

This role will provide YOU the opportunity to lead key activities to progress YOUR career. These responsibilities include some of the following:

Define and deploy a clear product quality strategy for Vaccines that aligns with global quality objectives
Lead enterprise-level product quality risk management and governance, including escalations and strategic reviews
Partner with cross-functional leaders to prioritise quality investments, deliverables and continuous improvement programmes
Oversee critical quality metrics, audits and regulatory readiness to maintain supply and compliance
Sponsor digital and data initiatives that simplify quality processes and improve decision making
Build capability and coach teams to embed a proactive, predict-and-prevent quality mindset
Set and translate product quality priorities into clear, measurable plans with timelines and owners
Manage quality governance forums and deliver regular, transparent updates to senior stakeholders
Lead root cause investigations and ensure robust corrective and preventive actions are implemented
Support regulatory inspections and responses, working with operational teams and external authorities when needed
Develop talent, succession plans and inclusive leadership within the quality community

Basic Qualifications:
We are seeking professionals with the following required skills and qualifications to help us achieve our goals:
Bachelor’s degree in scientific, engineering or related discipline, or equivalent experience
Minimum 10 years’ experience in quality, regulatory or manufacturing roles within a regulated healthcare environment
Proven experience in product quality strategy, risk management and governance
Strong experience working with cross-functional and senior stakeholders
Demonstrated record of delivering continuous improvement and change programmes
Fluent in English; good working knowledge of local languages is an advantage

Preferred Qualifications:

If you have the following characteristics, it would be a plus:

Advanced degree (MSc, MBA, PhD) in a relevant field
Experience leading quality strategy in biologics, sterile manufacturing, or complex supply networks
Practical experience with regulatory inspections and interactions with major health authorities
Familiarity with digital quality systems, data integrity and automation initiatives
Strong people leadership in a matrix environment, with coaching and talent development experience
Track record of implementing risk-based quality frameworks and measurable KPIs

*LI-GSK

• If you are based in Cambridge, MA; Waltham, MA; Rockville, MD; or San Francisco, CA, the annual base salary for new hires in this position ranges $207.075 to $345.125.

• If you are based in another US location, the annual base salary range is $188.250 to $313.750.

The US salary ranges take into account a number of factors including work location within the US market, the candidate’s skills, experience, education level and the market rate for the role. In addition, this position offers an annual bonus and eligibility to participate in our share based long term incentive program which is dependent on the level of the role. Available benefits include health care and other insurance benefits (for employee and family), retirement benefits, paid holidays, vacation, and paid caregiver/parental and medical leave.

If salary ranges are not displayed in the job posting for a specific country, the relevant compensation will be discussed during the recruitment process.

If you have a disability and require assistance during the course of the selection process, you will have the opportunity to let us know what specific assistance you require in order to make suitable arrangements.

Why GSK?

Uniting science, technology and talent to get ahead of disease together.

GSK is a global biopharma company with a purpose to unite science, technology and talent to get ahead of disease together. We aim to positively impact the health of 2.5 billion people by the end of the decade, as a successful, growing company where people can thrive. We get ahead of disease by preventing and treating it with innovation in specialty medicines and vaccines. We focus on four therapeutic areas: respiratory, immunology and inflammation; oncology; HIV; and infectious diseases – to impact health at scale.

People and patients around the world count on the medicines and vaccines we make, so we’re committed to creating an environment where our people can thrive and focus on what matters most. Our culture of being ambitious for patients, accountable for impact and doing the right thing is the foundation for how, together, we deliver for patients, shareholders and our people.

Important notice to Employment businesses/ Agencies

GSK does not accept referrals from employment businesses and/or employment agencies in respect of the vacancies posted on this site. All employment businesses/agencies are required to contact GSK's commercial and general procurement/human resources department to obtain prior written authorization before referring any candidates to GSK. The obtaining of prior written authorization is a condition precedent to any agreement (verbal or written) between the employment business/ agency and GSK. In the absence of such written authorization being obtained any actions undertaken by the employment business/agency shall be deemed to have been performed without the consent or contractual agreement of GSK. GSK shall therefore not be liable for any fees arising from such actions or any fees arising from any referrals by employment businesses/agencies in respect of the vacancies posted on this site.

positionName: Product Quality Strategy Leader Senior Director

description:
John Cockerill, enablers of opportunities

Driven since 1817 by the entrepreneurial spirit and thirst for innovation of its founder, the John Cockerill Group develops large-scale technological solutions to meet the needs of its time: facilitating access to low carbon energies, enabling sustainable industrial production, preserving natural resources, contributing to greener mobility, enhancing security and installing essential infrastructures.

Its offer to businesses, governments and communities consists of services and associated equipment for the sectors of energy, defence, industry, the environment, transports, and infrastructures. With more than 8,000 employees, John Cockerill achieved a turnover of € 1.417 billion in 2024 in 28 countries, on 5 continents.

Head of Accounting - BE – John Cockerill Corporate

Êtes-vous prêt à contribuer à un groupe industriel mondial qui façonne les solutions durables de demain ?

Animé depuis 1817 par l'esprit d'entreprise et la soif d'innovation de son fondateur, le groupe John Cockerill développe des solutions technologiques à grande échelle pour répondre aux besoins de son époque : faciliter l'accès aux énergies à faible émission de carbone, permettre une production industrielle durable, préserver les ressources naturelles, contribuer à une mobilité plus verte, renforcer la sécurité et installer des infrastructures critiques.

Son offre aux entreprises, aux États et aux collectivités comprend des services et des équipements associés pour les secteurs de l'énergie, de la défense, de l'industrie, de l'environnement, des transports et des infrastructures.

Avec plus de 8 000 employés, John Cockerill a réalisé un chiffre d'affaires de 1,417 milliard d'euros en 2024, opérant dans 28 pays sur 5 continents.

En tant que groupe international diversifié, John Cockerill s'appuie sur des fonctions corporate solides pour soutenir ses activités, stimuler la performance, assurer la gouvernance et favoriser une croissance durable dans toutes ses activités.

Pourquoi rejoindre John Cockerill ?

• Impact au niveau du groupe : contribuez à des fonctions stratégiques, transversales ou de soutien ayant un impact direct sur les performances commerciales.

• Portée internationale : collaborez avec des équipes et des parties prenantes issues de différentes régions, entreprises et cultures.

 Découvrez nos talents internationaux : https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CvUiEakGcsQ&t=72s

• Environnement axé sur les objectifs : faites partie d'un groupe engagé dans le développement durable, l'innovation et la création de valeur à long terme.

• Autonomie et confiance : évoluez dans une culture qui valorise la responsabilité, l'initiative et l'équilibre entre vie professionnelle et vie privée.

Pour soutenir sa croissance et sa transformation continues, John Cockerill investit dans une solide expertise d'entreprise, alliant vision stratégique, excellence opérationnelle et valeurs humaines.

Votre rôle

En tant que Head of Accounting - BE, vous contribuerez au bon fonctionnement et au développement du groupe en soutenant les activités transversales, la gouvernance, la performance et les initiatives stratégiques.

Selon le poste, vous serez amené à interagir avec plusieurs secteurs d'activité, régions et fonctions, afin d'assurer la cohérence, l'harmonisation et la création de valeur au niveau du groupe.

Ce poste combine réflexion analytique, coordination et interaction avec les parties prenantes, souvent dans un contexte international.

Vos responsabilités principales

Leadership, RH et Stratégie

Manager et animer les équipes du périmètre
Planifier les ressources nécessaires afin de pouvoir établir le budget du service partagé et sa refacturation vers les différentes Business Units et sociétés gérées. Création et gestion du budget du service partagé
Maintenir des relations fortes avec le business dans un partenariat équilibré
Harmoniser les processus et implémenter les meilleures pratiques, en collaboration avec les autres services partagés du groupe.
Etre un véritable acteur du changement, y compris les projets de digitalisation.
Participer à la mise en place de nouvelles organisations en fonction de l’évolution d’un Groupe en croissance

Comptabilités

Etre le référent technique du périmètre (norme locale et IFRS), analyser l’impact des évolutions législatives et proposer leur interprétation pour les sociétés du périmètre, gérer les changements de périmètres (fusion/acquisition/scission/vente de sociétés, etc.)
Esprit analytique et critique - Être capable d’analyser de grandes masses d’informations, sans perdre l’attention au détail.
Maitriser les processus de comptabilisation de toutes les transactions nécessaires (fournisseurs, clients, comptabilité générale, analytique / projets) conformément aux règles d’évaluation en vigueur localement et dans le Groupe.
Participer et coordonner la clôture, en liaison avec les différents interlocuteurs des entités, notamment le contrôle de gestion. Etablir et faire respecter l’échéancier des clôtures mensuelles, trimestrielles et annuelles.
Mettre en place les contrôles nécessaires pour assurer la fiabilité et la justification des comptes, en ce compris les réconciliations intercompagnies et les réconciliations entre normes comptables.
Produire les résultats statutaires et IFRS des entités du périmètre dans le timing adéquat.
Etablir les reportings et les publications légales liés à la fonction
Respecter les exigences statutaires légales. Coordonner les aspects juridiques
Coordonner et planifier l’audit externe, y compris la résolution des points d’audit

Trésorerie

Utiliser les prévisions de cash pour assurer au mieux le suivi des paiements fournisseurs ;
Coordonner les batchs de paiements et mettre en place les contrôles nécessaires ainsi que le suivi du respect des instructions liées à la position bancaire journalière (emprunts – placements)
Refléter dans les comptes la stratégie bancaire de placements et d’emprunts définie par le Groupe
Assurer la comptabilisation adéquate des contrats de change et réaliser les suivis nécessaires

Fiscalité

Assurer la mise à disposition des déclarations fiscales du périmètre au Département Fiscal du Groupe. Vérifier l’établissement des dossiers justificatifs pour toutes les annexes fiscales.
Assurer un suivi mensuel de la charge d’impôts des sociétés du périmètre.
Coordonner l’émission des déclarations fiscales du pays (TVA, …) ainsi que toutes les statistiques légales
Participer à la gestion des outils informatiques nécessaires

Votre équipe Finance

Vous intégrerez une équipe collaborative et transversale, travaillant en étroite collaboration avec des experts comptables, des représentants commerciaux et des parties prenantes de haut niveau.

La culture d'entreprise favorise le partage des connaissances, le travail d'équipe et l'amélioration continue, soutenus par un style de management basé sur la confiance, l'autonomie et une communication claire.

Votre profil

Experience & Compétences Techniques

Minimum 10 ans d’expérience en comptabilité ou audit, dont 3 à 5 ans en management
Solide expertise des normes belges et IFRS
Expérience confirmée en production comptable et clôtures multi-entités
Maîtrise d’un ERP (SAP, Oracle, etc.)
Excellente capacité d’analyse et de rigueur
Français courant / anglais (Niveau B2)

Compétences Personnelles & Soft Skills

Leadership naturel, sens du service et communication claire
Esprit critique et capacité à naviguer dans la complexité
Forte orientation solution, amélioration continue
Agilité en environnement matriciel et multiculturel

Ce que nous offrons Chez John Cockerill, Nous Valorisons Votre Contribution

Un package salarial compétitif avec :

Voiture de société
Chèques-repas
Frais forfaitaires nets
Assurances (hospitalisation, décès, revenu garanti, etc.)
Bonus variable (jusqu’à 25 % du salaire annuel brut)
Plan d’intéressement lié aux résultats
Mode de travail flexible (1 à 2 jours de télétravail par semaine)
Parcours d’intégration structuré sur 6 mois
Formation continue et mobilité interne
31 jours de congés légaux et extralégaux

Le processus de recrutement

Prêt à relever ce défi passionnant et à contribuer à l'avenir du Groupe ?

Quelles sont les prochaines étapes ?

• Premier entretien avec Julien Reijmen

• Rencontre sur place ou virtuelle avec Marie Franz, Claude Theunissen et Laurence Maitrejean

• Entretien final avec la direction

Êtes-vous compatible avec John Cockerill ? Que cette collaboration commence ! Découvrez les temps forts de notre année 2024 et le parcours du Groupe :
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jw1eUarVzoQ

Ce n'est pas l'opportunité que vous recherchez ?

Découvrez toutes les opportunités et rejoignez notre vivier de talents via le site Carrières du Groupe : www.johncockerill.com/jobs

John Cockerill offers you career and development opportunities within its various sectors in a friendly working environment.
Do you want to work for an innovative company that will allow you to take up technical challenges on a daily basis?
We look forward to receiving your application and to meeting you!

Discover our job opportunities in details on Career - John Cockerill
descriptionHTML:
John Cockerill, enablers of opportunities


Driven since 1817 by the entrepreneurial spirit and thirst for innovation of its founder, the John Cockerill Group develops large-scale technological solutions to meet the needs of its time: facilitating access to low carbon energies, enabling sustainable industrial production, preserving natural resources, contributing to greener mobility, enhancing security and installing essential infrastructures.


Its offer to businesses, governments and communities consists of services and associated equipment for the sectors of energy, defence, industry, the environment, transports, and infrastructures. With more than 8,000 employees, John Cockerill achieved a turnover of € 1.417 billion in 2024 in 28 countries, on 5 continents.


Head of Accounting - BE – John Cockerill Corporate

Êtes-vous prêt à contribuer à un groupe industriel mondial qui façonne les solutions durables de demain ?

Animé depuis 1817 par l'esprit d'entreprise et la soif d'innovation de son fondateur, le groupe John Cockerill développe des solutions technologiques à grande échelle pour répondre aux besoins de son époque : faciliter l'accès aux énergies à faible émission de carbone, permettre une production industrielle durable, préserver les ressources naturelles, contribuer à une mobilité plus verte, renforcer la sécurité et installer des infrastructures critiques.

Son offre aux entreprises, aux États et aux collectivités comprend des services et des équipements associés pour les secteurs de l'énergie, de la défense, de l'industrie, de l'environnement, des transports et des infrastructures.

Avec plus de 8 000 employés, John Cockerill a réalisé un chiffre d'affaires de 1,417 milliard d'euros en 2024, opérant dans 28 pays sur 5 continents.

En tant que groupe international diversifié, John Cockerill s'appuie sur des fonctions corporate solides pour soutenir ses activités, stimuler la performance, assurer la gouvernance et favoriser une croissance durable dans toutes ses activités.

Pourquoi rejoindre John Cockerill ?

  • Impact au niveau du groupe : contribuez à des fonctions stratégiques, transversales ou de soutien ayant un impact direct sur les performances commerciales.
  • Portée internationale : collaborez avec des équipes et des parties prenantes issues de différentes régions, entreprises et cultures.

Découvrez nos talents internationaux : https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CvUiEakGcsQ&t=72s

  • Environnement axé sur les objectifs : faites partie d'un groupe engagé dans le développement durable, l'innovation et la création de valeur à long terme.
  • Autonomie et confiance : évoluez dans une culture qui valorise la responsabilité, l'initiative et l'équilibre entre vie professionnelle et vie privée.

Pour soutenir sa croissance et sa transformation continues, John Cockerill investit dans une solide expertise d'entreprise, alliant vision stratégique, excellence opérationnelle et valeurs humaines.

Votre rôle

En tant que Head of Accounting - BE, vous contribuerez au bon fonctionnement et au développement du groupe en soutenant les activités transversales, la gouvernance, la performance et les initiatives stratégiques.

Selon le poste, vous serez amené à interagir avec plusieurs secteurs d'activité, régions et fonctions, afin d'assurer la cohérence, l'harmonisation et la création de valeur au niveau du groupe.

Ce poste combine réflexion analytique, coordination et interaction avec les parties prenantes, souvent dans un contexte international.

Vos responsabilités principales

Leadership, RH et Stratégie

  • Manager et animer les équipes du périmètre
  • Planifier les ressources nécessaires afin de pouvoir établir le budget du service partagé et sa refacturation vers les différentes Business Units et sociétés gérées. Création et gestion du budget du service partagé
  • Maintenir des relations fortes avec le business dans un partenariat équilibré
  • Harmoniser les processus et implémenter les meilleures pratiques, en collaboration avec les autres services partagés du groupe.
  • Etre un véritable acteur du changement, y compris les projets de digitalisation.
  • Participer à la mise en place de nouvelles organisations en fonction de l’évolution d’un Groupe en croissance

Comptabilités

  • Etre le référent technique du périmètre (norme locale et IFRS), analyser l’impact des évolutions législatives et proposer leur interprétation pour les sociétés du périmètre, gérer les changements de périmètres (fusion/acquisition/scission/vente de sociétés, etc.)
  • Esprit analytique et critique - Être capable d’analyser de grandes masses d’informations, sans perdre l’attention au détail.
  • Maitriser les processus de comptabilisation de toutes les transactions nécessaires (fournisseurs, clients, comptabilité générale, analytique / projets) conformément aux règles d’évaluation en vigueur localement et dans le Groupe.
  • Participer et coordonner la clôture, en liaison avec les différents interlocuteurs des entités, notamment le contrôle de gestion. Etablir et faire respecter l’échéancier des clôtures mensuelles, trimestrielles et annuelles.
  • Mettre en place les contrôles nécessaires pour assurer la fiabilité et la justification des comptes, en ce compris les réconciliations intercompagnies et les réconciliations entre normes comptables.
  • Produire les résultats statutaires et IFRS des entités du périmètre dans le timing adéquat.
  • Etablir les reportings et les publications légales liés à la fonction
  • Respecter les exigences statutaires légales. Coordonner les aspects juridiques
  • Coordonner et planifier l’audit externe, y compris la résolution des points d’audit

Trésorerie

  • Utiliser les prévisions de cash pour assurer au mieux le suivi des paiements fournisseurs ;
  • Coordonner les batchs de paiements et mettre en place les contrôles nécessaires ainsi que le suivi du respect des instructions liées à la position bancaire journalière (emprunts – placements)
  • Refléter dans les comptes la stratégie bancaire de placements et d’emprunts définie par le Groupe
  • Assurer la comptabilisation adéquate des contrats de change et réaliser les suivis nécessaires

Fiscalité

  • Assurer la mise à disposition des déclarations fiscales du périmètre au Département Fiscal du Groupe. Vérifier l’établissement des dossiers justificatifs pour toutes les annexes fiscales.
  • Assurer un suivi mensuel de la charge d’impôts des sociétés du périmètre.
  • Coordonner l’émission des déclarations fiscales du pays (TVA, …) ainsi que toutes les statistiques légales
  • Participer à la gestion des outils informatiques nécessaires

Votre équipe Finance

Vous intégrerez une équipe collaborative et transversale, travaillant en étroite collaboration avec des experts comptables, des représentants commerciaux et des parties prenantes de haut niveau.

La culture d'entreprise favorise le partage des connaissances, le travail d'équipe et l'amélioration continue, soutenus par un style de management basé sur la confiance, l'autonomie et une communication claire.

Votre profil

Experience & Compétences Techniques

  • Minimum 10 ans d’expérience en comptabilité ou audit, dont 3 à 5 ans en management
  • Solide expertise des normes belges et IFRS
  • Expérience confirmée en production comptable et clôtures multi-entités
  • Maîtrise d’un ERP (SAP, Oracle, etc.)
  • Excellente capacité d’analyse et de rigueur
  • Français courant / anglais (Niveau B2)

Compétences Personnelles & Soft Skills

  • Leadership naturel, sens du service et communication claire
  • Esprit critique et capacité à naviguer dans la complexité
  • Forte orientation solution, amélioration continue
  • Agilité en environnement matriciel et multiculturel

Ce que nous offrons Chez John Cockerill, Nous Valorisons Votre Contribution

Un package salarial compétitif avec :

  • Voiture de société
  • Chèques-repas
  • Frais forfaitaires nets
  • Assurances (hospitalisation, décès, revenu garanti, etc.)
  • Bonus variable (jusqu’à 25 % du salaire annuel brut)
  • Plan d’intéressement lié aux résultats
  • Mode de travail flexible (1 à 2 jours de télétravail par semaine)
  • Parcours d’intégration structuré sur 6 mois
  • Formation continue et mobilité interne
  • 31 jours de congés légaux et extralégaux

Le processus de recrutement

Prêt à relever ce défi passionnant et à contribuer à l'avenir du Groupe ?

Quelles sont les prochaines étapes ?

  • Premier entretien avec Julien Reijmen
  • Rencontre sur place ou virtuelle avec Marie Franz, Claude Theunissen et Laurence Maitrejean
  • Entretien final avec la direction

Êtes-vous compatible avec John Cockerill ? Que cette collaboration commence ! Découvrez les temps forts de notre année 2024 et le parcours du Groupe :
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jw1eUarVzoQ

Ce n'est pas l'opportunité que vous recherchez ?

Découvrez toutes les opportunités et rejoignez notre vivier de talents via le site Carrières du Groupe : www.johncockerill.com/jobs

description:
JLL supports the Whole You, personally and professionally.

Our people at JLL are shaping the future of real estate for a better world by combining world class services, advisory and technology to our clients. We are committed to hiring the best, most talented people in our industry; and we support them through professional growth, flexibility, and personalized benefits to manage life in and outside of work. Whether you’ve got deep experience in commercial real estate, skilled trades, and technology, or you’re looking to apply your relevant experience to a new industry, we empower you to shape a brighter way forward so you can thrive professionally and personally.

Location : Louvain

Position Overview

Lead and manage comprehensive facility operations, ensuring operational excellence, regulatory compliance, and exceptional client service delivery. This senior leadership role requires strong technical expertise combined with team management capabilities to oversee complex facility operations in a manufacturing environment.

Key Responsibilities

Team Leadership & Management
Manage and direct on-site teams including JLL staff and external suppliers to deliver exceptional customer service and operational excellence.

Develop and maintain a high-performing, motivated team while fostering an environment of collaboration, trust, and performance excellence.

Provide mentoring and facilitate training and development opportunities for team members.

Client & Stakeholder Relations

Serve as the primary on-site point of contact for all facilities matters, proactively engaging with stakeholders across multiple organizational levels to exceed expectations and build strong, effective relationships.

Ensure consistent delivery of services that align with client objectives and organizational standards.

Vendor & Procurement Management
Oversee vendor performance to ensure timely, budget-compliant service delivery.

Manage procurement processes in accordance with client guidelines and JLL best practices.

Monitor contract performance, initiate re-procurement processes as needed, and continuously assess contracts to deliver optimal value.

Financial Management & Cost Control
Drive site financial operations to meet or exceed targets while maintaining strict adherence to JLL's Code of Ethics.

Monitor and report budget expenditure, manage purchase order processes and invoice approvals, and identify cost-saving opportunities without compromising service quality or output.

Health, Safety & Compliance
Maintain a safe working environment through compliance with JLL EH&S policies, local statutory regulations, and industry safety standards.

Implement and manage RAMS and permit-to-work systems, participate in required safety meetings and training, and ensure full compliance with fire safety and occupational health requirements.

Operations & Performance Management
Recommend and implement continuous improvement practices and industry best practices.

Maintain building procedures and performance standards, meet Critical Environment Management requirements where applicable, and provide 24/7 emergency response support as part of a team approach.

Regularly review operations to optimize costs while improving service standards.

Risk Management & Business Continuity
Implement and maintain comprehensive property risk management programs including regular audits.

Develop and maintain disaster recovery and business continuity plans.

Serve as the primary contact for facilities, project management, and crisis response activities, ensuring prompt resolution and proactive identification of potential issues.

Sustainability & Performance
Achieve key performance indicators and service level agreements while promoting sustainable service delivery methods.

Stay current with environmental, sustainability, and ecological developments, actively incorporating these into service activities where appropriate.

Required Qualifications & Experience:

5-10 years of experience in facilities management, property management, hard/soft services, or hospitality

Excellent written and verbal communication skills in local language and English

Proven experience leading and managing teams in complex operational environments

Demonstrated ability in vendor management for specialized services

Strong technical knowledge of building systems (HVAC, electrical, mechanical, BMS)

Experience with Health & Safety protocols, risk assessment, method statements, and permit-to-work systems

Understanding of occupational safety requirements and local regulations

Proficiency with CAFM systems or similar facility management software

Budget management and financial analysis capabilities

Experience with quality management and KPI measurement systems

Preferred Qualifications
Engineering degree or relevant technical certifications (BIFM, CAFM, or local equivalents)

Experience in manufacturing or laboratory environments

Knowledge of semiconductor facility requirements

Experience with continuous improvement initiatives

Additional language skills (German/Flemish/French as applicable)

Working Conditions

This role requires flexibility for 24/7 emergency response support and may involve travel between sites. The position demands both strategic thinking and hands-on operational involvement in a fast-paced technical environment.

If this job description resonates with you, we encourage you to apply even if you don’t meet all of the requirements below. We’re interested in getting to know you and what you bring to the table!

Personalized benefits that support personal well-being and growth:

JLL recognizes the impact that the workplace can have on your wellness, so we offer a supportive culture and comprehensive benefits package that prioritizes mental, physical and emotional health.

About JLL –

We’re JLL—a leading professional services and investment management firm specializing in real estate. We have operations in over 80 countries and a workforce of over 102,000 individuals around the world who help real estate owners, occupiers and investors achieve their business ambitions. As a global Fortune 500 company, we also have an inherent responsibility to drive sustainability and corporate social responsibility. That’s why we’re committed to our purpose to shape the future of real estate for a better world. We’re using the most advanced technology to create rewarding opportunities, amazing spaces and sustainable real estate solutions for our clients, our people, and our communities.

Our core values of teamwork, ethics and excellence are also fundamental to everything we do and we’re honored to be recognized with awards for our success by organizations both globally and locally.

Creating a diverse and inclusive culture where we all feel welcomed, valued and empowered to achieve our full potential is important to who we are today and where we’re headed in the future. And we know that unique backgrounds, experiences and perspectives help us think bigger, spark innovation and succeed together.

JLL recognizes the impact that the workplace can have on your wellness, so we offer a supportive culture and comprehensive benefits package that prioritizes mental, physical and emotional health.

About JLL –

We’re JLL—a leading professional services and investment management firm specializing in real estate. We have operations in over 80 countries and a workforce of over 102,000 individuals around the world who help real estate owners, occupiers and investors achieve their business ambitions. As a global Fortune 500 company, we also have an inherent responsibility to drive sustainability and corporate social responsibility. That’s why we’re committed to our purpose to shape the future of real estate for a better world. We’re using the most advanced technology to create rewarding opportunities, amazing spaces and sustainable real estate solutions for our clients, our people, and our communities.

Our core values of teamwork, ethics and excellence are also fundamental to everything we do and we’re honored to be recognized with awards for our success by organizations both globally and locally.

Creating a diverse and inclusive culture where we all feel welcomed, valued and empowered to achieve our full potential is important to who we are today and where we’re headed in the future. description:
Blending Manager – Tobacco Manufacturing

Would you like to work in an international Fortune 500 company (Top Employer 2025 award winner) where individual development is of paramount importance? Do you believe in our vision of a smoke-free future? Apply now for the position of Blending Manager – Tobacco Manufacturing (Official title: Manager Leaf Blending).

THE ORGANISATION
Philip Morris is one of the world’s largest international tobacco companies, with more than 82,700 employees worldwide. Our employees speak more than 80 languages and come from all regions of the world. We have 50 production facilities worldwide and our products are sold in more than 180 countries.

At Philip Morris, we strive for a future where smoking is a thing of the past and we are all committed to make this reality as soon as possible. Our vision is clear: to lead the transformation of our industry by fully focusing our efforts, energy and resources to offering better, smoke-free alternatives for adults who otherwise continue to smoke. We are determined to change the world for the better and change to the benefit of all adult smokers and society at large.

We believe in the following values.

Innovation | Integrity | Excellent Execution | Collaboration | Responsibility

THE OPPORTUNITY
In this role, you are accountable for the end-to-end management of leaf blending operations, ensuring consistent product quality, cost efficiency, and operational reliability across affiliate and manufacturing environments. You translate blend strategies, formulas, and material plans into executable, compliant outcomes while managing complexity across multiple products, markets, and supply scenarios.

You operate as the operational owner of blending performance, using data, analytics, and KPIs to drive decision-making, risk mitigation, and continuous improvement. Acting as a key interface between affiliates, manufacturing centers, and global stakeholders, you ensure alignment, transparency, and execution excellence.

As a people manager, you lead and develop a team of blending professionals, embedding a culture of accountability, collaboration, and continuous improvement in line with PMI standards and values.

Responsibilities of the role:

Own and manage leaf blending operations for conventional and combustible products across affiliates
Ensure accurate execution of blend formulas, bills of material, and tobacco material codes
Lead blend maintenance activities, including stock positioning, inventory optimization, and waste reduction
Monitor blending performance through KPIs and dashboards, enabling data-driven decisions and predictive risk management
Utilize Excel and Power BI to analyze trends, forecast impacts, and improve operational efficiency
Coordinate closely with PMI Manufacturing Centers, maintaining structured communication and oversight of ongoing and new initiatives
Drive cross-functional collaboration with supply chain, quality, planning, and global stakeholders
Ensure compliance with PMI specifications, quality standards, and regulatory requirements
Lead, coach, and develop a team of blending professionals, setting clear objectives and performance expectations
Promote a culture of continuous improvement, integrity, and operational excellence across affiliate operations

KEY REQUIREMENTS

Proven experience in leaf blending, tobacco operations, or supply chain environments within a regulated manufacturing context
5+ years of relevant experience in tobacco, blending, inventory management, or related operational roles
Demonstrated people management experience, including direct reports
Strong understanding of blend formulas, bills of material, stock management, and inventory optimization
Advanced Excel skills; experience with Power BI or similar analytics tools is a strong plus
Experience working in multinational, cross-functional environments
Solid background in quality, compliance, and process improvement
Structured, analytical, and hands-on leadership style with strong stakeholder management skills

RISE TO THE CHALLENGE
You will join a dynamic, international and fast-paced work environment in a rapidly evolving industry and will interact with different levels of experience and expertise across the Company. We offer a contract with a competitive salary commensurate to the professional experience.

Our company offers you a fresh perspective. Here, you will never stop exploring and discovering. We take on-the-job learning to another level, giving you every opportunity to develop your career and reach your full potential. This position will advance your experience with innovative technologies, services, and processes. Backed by a competitive salary and compensation package, you will work in a professional setting with clients and team members from all over the world.

  • Advanced Excel skills; experience with Power BI or similar analytics tools is a strong plus
  • Experience working in multinational, cross-functional environments
  • Solid background in quality, compliance, and process improvement
  • Structured, analytical, and hands-on leadership style with strong stakeholder management skills

RISE TO THE CHALLENGE
You will join a dynamic, international and fast-paced work environment in a rapidly evolving industry and will interact with different levels of experience and expertise across the Company. We offer a contract with a competitive salary commensurate to the professional experience.

Our company offers you a fresh perspective. Here, you will never stop exploring and discovering. We take on-the-job learning to another level, giving you every opportunity to develop your career and reach your full potential. This position will advance your experience with innovative technologies, services, and processes. Backed by a competitive salary and compensation package, you will work in a professional setting with clients and team members from all over the world.

description:
Du bringst bereits fundierte Erfahrung im HR-Bereich mit und möchtest deine Expertise in einem internationalen, zukunftsorientierten Unternehmen einbringen? Dann bietet dir Hydro die perfekte Plattform, um Verantwortung zu übernehmen, HR-Prozesse aktiv zu gestalten und die Weiterentwicklung unserer HR-Strategie am Standort Raeren maßgeblich voranzutreiben. Werde Teil unseres Teams und gestalte die Zukunft mit uns!

Was wir Dir bieten
Ein internationales Arbeitsumfeld mit Fokus auf Nachhaltigkeit, Innovation und Zusammenarbeit
Kollegiale Unternehmenskultur mit flachen Hierarchien und kurzen Entscheidungswegen
Vielfältige Weiterbildungs- und Entwicklungsmöglichkeiten, abgestimmt auf deine beruflichen Ziele
Attraktive Vergütung, Sozialleistungen
Deine Aufgaben - vielseitig und verantwortungsvoll
Strategie & Prozesse

Mit deinem Know-how trägst du zur Weiterentwicklung effizienter und qualitätsgerechter HR-Prozesse bei. Du sorgst für die Aktualisierung und Pflege von Stellenbeschreibungen sowie der Arbeitsordnung und bringst dabei deine Erfahrung in strukturierter Prozessgestaltung ein.

Recruiting & Employer Branding

Du verantwortest die Erstellung von Stellenangeboten und steuerst den gesamten Rekrutierungsprozess – von der Auswahl bis zur Einstellung. Die strukturierte Auswahl von Interim-Personal sowie die strategische Weiterentwicklung unseres Employer-Brandings gehören ebenfalls zu deinem Aufgabenbereich.

Mitarbeiterbetreuung & Entwicklung

Du gestaltest den Onboarding-Prozess für neue Mitarbeitende und entwickelst Maßnahmen zur Senkung der Krankenrate. Mit einem klaren Blick für nachhaltige Beschäftigungsfähigkeit erarbeitest du entsprechende Konzepte und setzt diese um. Die Organisation und Auswertung von Engagement Surveys sowie die Ableitung konkreter Maßnahmen runden diesen Bereich ab.

Zusammenarbeit & Kommunikation

In der Zusammenarbeit mit Sozialpartnern übernimmst du das Konfliktmanagement und führst Verhandlungen souverän. Du bringst dich aktiv in den Betriebsrat ein und unterstützt Talententwicklungsprogramme. Auch die Organisation und Durchführung der Sozialwahlen liegt in deinem Verantwortungsbereich.

HR-Support & Spezialprojekte

Du unterstützt im Bereich Payroll als Backup und bist verantwortlich für ad-hoc Analysen. Personalangelegenheiten bearbeitest du gemäß den Vorgaben von Hydro und bringst dich bei Spezialprojekten aktiv ein.

Das bringst Du mit
Ein abgeschlossenes Studium im Bereich Human Resources
Mehrjährige Berufserfahrung im HR-Bereich, idealerweise in einem industriellen Umfeld
Fundierte Kenntnisse im belgischen Arbeitsrecht und in der Zusammenarbeit mit Sozialpartnern
Kommunikationsstärke, Organisationstalent und ein hohes Maß an Eigenverantwortung
Fließendes Deutsch und Französisch, sowie gute Englischkenntnisse
Klingt nach Dir ?

Dann bewirb dich jetzt mit Lebenslauf und Zeugnissen via dem Link hierunter bis spätestens 27.02.2026

Fragen? Wir sind für dich da: HR_Raeren@hydro.com

description:
Tu disposes d’une solide expérience dans le domaine des ressources humaines et tu souhaites mettre ton expertise au service d’une entreprise internationale tournée vers l’avenir ? Hydro t’offre une plateforme idéale pour assumer des responsabilités, façonner activement les processus RH et contribuer au développement de la stratégie RH sur notre site de Raeren.

Ce que nous t'offrons
Un environnement international axé sur la durabilité, l’innovation et la collaboration
Un rôle stratégique avec une vraie liberté d’action
Des possibilités de formation et d’évolution professionnelle
Une rémunération attractive et des avantages sociaux intéressants
Tes missions – variées et porteuses de responsabilités

Stratégie & Processus

Grâce à ton savoir-faire, tu participes à l’amélioration continue de processus RH efficaces et conformes aux standards de qualité. Tu assures la mise à jour et la gestion des descriptions de poste ainsi que du règlement de travail, en t’appuyant sur ton expérience en structuration des processus.

Recrutement & Marque Employeur

Tu es responsable de la rédaction des offres d’emploi et de la gestion complète du processus de recrutement – de la sélection à l’embauche. La sélection structurée du personnel intérimaire et le développement stratégique de notre marque employeur font également partie de ton périmètre.

Accompagnement & Développement des collaborateurs

Tu organises le processus d’intégration des nouveaux collaborateurs et mets en place des actions pour réduire le taux d’absentéisme. Avec une vision claire de l’employabilité durable, tu conçois et mets en œuvre des plans adaptés. Tu coordonnes les enquêtes d’engagement et en assures le suivi par des actions concrètes.

Collaboration & Communication

Tu gères les conflits et mènes les négociations avec les partenaires sociaux. Tu participes activement au comité d’entreprise et soutiens les programmes de développement des talents. L’organisation et la conduite des élections sociales relèvent également de ta responsabilité.

Support RH & Projets spécifiques

Tu assures le rôle de backup pour le service de la paie et es responsable d’analyses ponctuelles. Tu traites les dossiers RH conformément aux directives de Hydro et contribues à des projets spécifiques, tels que l’introduction de nouveaux systèmes de rémunération.

Ton profil
Diplôme en ressources humaines ou domaine équivalent
Expérience confirmée dans une fonction RH, idéalement en environnement industriel
Excellentes connaissances du droit du travail belge et en collaboration avec les partenaires sociaux
Solides compétences en communication, sens de l’organisation et autonomie
Maîtrise du français et de l’allemand, un bon niveau d’anglais
Prêt(e) à franchir une nouvelle étape dans ta carrière ?

Alors, envoie-nous ta candidature avec ton CV et tes certificats via le lien ci-dessous, au plus tard le 27/02/2026.

Pour toute question, n’hésite pas à nous contacter à l’adresse suivante: HR_Raeren@hydro.com.

description:
Position

Directeur Magasin (F/H) - Belgique - CDI

Profile

Chez Sephora, la beauté c'est se sentir reconnu, valorisé et épanoui, individuellement et collectivement. C'est tisser des liens profonds avec les autres. C'est aussi célébrer la diversité et l'inclusion, révéler son propre potentiel et se donner les moyens d'avoir un impact positif chaque jour.

Vous êtes garant du développement des équipes, du chiffre d’affaires et assurez la rentabilité du centre de profit, dans le respect de la politique et de la culture de l’enseigne.

Missions principales:

Management de l’équipe

- Recruter une équipe

- Former et développer les collaborateurs par le biais d’un suivi individuel et collectif

- Evaluer et accompagner les collaborateurs

- Détecter les potentiels évolutifs

- Animer les managers en communiquant les priorités quotidiennes

Animation du magasin

- Mettre en œuvre des plans d’action dans les standards de la Sephora Attitude, à partir de l’analyse des indicateurs commerciaux et économiques

- Appliquer les recommandations du siège (merchandising, parcours client, offres, etc)

- Animer les opérations commerciales

- Animer les relations marques

Gestion du compte d’exploitation

- Participer à la construction du budget annuel CA / frais de personnel / gardiennage

- Analyser, diagnostiquer les écarts et mettre en place les actions nécessaires

Rituel de communications équipes

- Briefer et débriefer chaque semaine les équipes et la hiérarchie

- Réaliser des comptes-rendus de visite

- Participer aux réunions Teams hebdomadaires et réunions régionales

- Organiser et animer les réunions d’encadrement avec vos managers

- Représenter Sephora auprès des interlocuteurs internes et externes (association de commerçants, école, siège…)

Procédures internes

- Appliquer, faire respecter et maintenir à niveau les procédures internes (Trésorerie, procédures sécurité, audit, inventaire…)

- Garantir la sécurité des personnes et des biens

Profil :

Manager confirmé, vous êtes orienté(e) business et satisfaction client.
Vous aimez particulièrement transformer le conseil client en vente et êtes animé(e) par la réussite collective.
Votre goût du terrain et du commerce, vos qualités relationnelles, votre exigence managériale et enfin, votre capacité d’analyse et de réflexion seront des atouts indispensables pour votre réussir dans votre mission de Directeur de magasin.

Maitrise de l’anglais souhaitée et du néerlandais impérative.

Statut cadre.

En nous rejoignant, vous découvrirez :

Une communauté où l'authenticité est une force, et où notre esprit d'équipe se nourrit de nos différences.
Une culture qui favorise le développement personnel et le leadership, avec des ressources et des opportunités pour apprendre, innover et évoluer.
Un métier qui a du sens où chaque action compte : qu'il s'agisse de créer des expériences uniques pour nos clients ou d'inspirer l'univers de la beauté, nous évoluons dans un environnement où chacun contribue à faire la différence.

Ensemble, partageons quelque chose de beau.

SEPHORA
MAISON

Sephora’s stores offer passionate beauty fans across the world a privileged freedom to touch and test products since 1969.
The House provides a superior selection of quality products and always keeps pace with the latest trends.
The house is built upon the exceptional talents of its beauty professionals who create a perfect environment for adventurous clients who want to experiment and learn.
With the innovative range of products in the Sephora Collection, its distinctive stores and bold commitment to new ideas, the House is always able to surprise and delight its clients.
At every touch point with its clients, in store and online, Sephora provides an unconventional approach which has made it the most loved beauty community in the world.
