description:
Site Name: USA - Pennsylvania - Upper Providence, Belgium-Wavre, Durham Blackwell Street, Italy - Siena, UK – London – New Oxford Street
Posted Date: Feb 12 2026

Business Introduction
At GSK, we have bold ambitions for patients, aiming to positively impact the health of 2.5 billion people by the end of the decade. Our R&D focuses on discovering and delivering vaccines and medicines, combining our understanding of the immune system with cutting-edge technology to transform people’s lives. GSK fosters a culture ambitious for patients, accountable for impact, and committed to doing the right thing, making sure that we focus our efforts on accelerating significant assets that meet patients’ needs and have the highest probability of success. We’re uniting science, technology, and talent to get ahead of disease together.

Find out more:
Our approach to R&D

Position Summary
As a therapeutic head within Labelling Strategy and Governance, you will lead a global labelling team for oncology products. You will engage with key stakeholders across R&D to ensure effective development of GSK oncology labels. You will shape labelling that is clear, compliant, and supports patient care and product success. We value collaborative leaders who communicate clearly, build trust with stakeholders, and deliver practical regulatory solutions. This role offers visible impact, professional growth, and the chance to help GSK unite science, technology and talent to get ahead of disease together.

Responsibilities
This role will provide YOU the opportunity to lead key activities to progress YOUR career. These responsibilities include some of the following:

Manage, train, and motivate a team of global labelling professionals for the oncology portfolio.
Accountable for management of the GSK labelling process for the development portfolio from early development through to early lifecycle management.
Ensure compliance with regulatory requirements (e.g., related to product information, submission strategy) and work with matrix teams to resolve issues in a proactive manner.
Provide strategic direction for labelling governance issues for assigned therapeutic area and serve on Global Labelling Committee.
Advise Regulatory and senior management on issues relating to product labelling, interfacing with senior leaders across R&D, Safety, Regulatory and Commercial to develop, implement, and maintain policies and standards.
Engage with Regulatory Authorities in areas impacting labelling standards and policies directly or collectively through professional organizations to drive innovative labelling approaches.

Why You?

Basic Qualifications
We are seeking professionals with the following required skills and qualifications to help us achieve our goals:

Bachelor’s degree in life sciences, pharmacy, medicine, or related field.
At least 5 years of regulatory affairs or labelling experience in the pharmaceutical or biotech industry with line and matrix leadership experience
3+ years of experience leading global labelling development, submissions, or regulatory interactions.

Preferred Qualifications

Advanced degree (MS, PharmD, MD, or PhD) in a relevant scientific discipline.
Experience in oncology therapeutic areas and familiarity with oncology clinical data and endpoints.
Prior direct experience interacting with regulatory reviewers.
Experience aligning labelling strategy with commercial and medical affairs objectives.
Track record of developing patient-focused labeling and plain-language content.
Experience mentoring colleagues and building capability within a labelling or regulatory team.
Strong knowledge of regulatory requirements for prescription product labelling and safety reporting.
Proven ability to lead cross-functional teams and manage complex review processes and timelines.
Clear written and verbal communication skills, with experience drafting regulatory documents and communicating with regulators.

Work Arrangement
This role is hybrid with regular on-site collaboration expected. Typical schedule will be 2 to 3 days on-site per week.

What we value in you
We seek candidates who are collaborative, curious, and accountable. You should enjoy solving regulatory challenges and building trusted relationships. You should be comfortable making clear recommendations and balancing scientific, regulatory, and commercial considerations. We welcome people who bring different perspectives and life experiences, and who will help us create an inclusive environment where everyone can do their best work.

Apply Now
If this role aligns with your experience and career goals, we encourage you to apply. Tell us how you will contribute to labelling excellence and help improve outcomes for people with cancer.

Please visit GSK US Benefits Summary to learn more about the comprehensive benefits program GSK offers US employees.

Why GSK?

Uniting science, technology and talent to get ahead of disease together.

GSK is a global biopharma company with a purpose to unite science, technology and talent to get ahead of disease together. We aim to positively impact the health of 2.5 billion people by the end of the decade, as a successful, growing company where people can thrive. We get ahead of disease by preventing and treating it with innovation in specialty medicines and vaccines. We focus on four therapeutic areas: respiratory, immunology and inflammation; oncology; HIV; and infectious diseases – to impact health at scale.

People and patients around the world count on the medicines and vaccines we make, so we’re committed to creating an environment where our people can thrive and focus on what matters most. Our culture of being ambitious for patients, accountable for impact and doing the right thing is the foundation for how, together, we deliver for patients, shareholders and our people.

Should you require any adjustments to our process to assist you in demonstrating your strengths and capabilities contact us at HR.AmericasSC-CS@gsk.com where you can also request a call.

Please note should your inquiry not relate to adjustments, we will not be able to support you through these channels. However, we have created a Recruitment FAQ guide. Click the link where you will find answers to multiple questions we receive

GSK is an Equal Opportunity Employer. This ensures that all qualified applicants will receive equal consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, gender identity, and sexual orientation), parental status, national origin, age, disability, genetic information (including family medical history), military service or any basis prohibited under federal, state or local law.

Important notice to Employment businesses/ Agencies

GSK does not accept referrals from employment businesses and/or employment agencies in respect of the vacancies posted on this site. All employment businesses/agencies are required to contact GSK's commercial and general procurement/human resources department to obtain prior written authorization before referring any candidates to GSK. The obtaining of prior written authorization is a condition precedent to any agreement (verbal or written) between the employment business/ agency and GSK. In the absence of such written authorization being obtained any actions undertaken by the employment business/agency shall be deemed to have been performed without the consent or contractual agreement of GSK. GSK shall therefore not be liable for any fees arising from such actions or any fees arising from any referrals by employment businesses/agencies in respect of the vacancies posted on this site.

Please note that if you are a US Licensed Healthcare Professional or Healthcare Professional as defined by the laws of the state issuing your license, GSK may be required to capture and report expenses GSK incurs, on your behalf, in the event you are afforded an interview for employment. This capture of applicable transfers of value is necessary to ensure GSK’s compliance to all federal and state US Transparency requirements. For more information, please visit the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services (CMS) website at https://openpaymentsdata.cms.gov/

description:
Ben jij een planningstalent en heb je administratieve superkrachten?
Verleg grenzen als management assistant

De dienst fysische geneeskunde en revalidatie bevindt zich in een fase van continue groei en ontwikkeling. Een dynamisch en deskundig secretariaatsteam moet de nodige ondersteuning kunnen bieden bij de verdere groei en uitbouw van de activiteiten. De activiteiten zijn verspreid over zowel campus Gasthuisberg als campus Pellenberg. Voor deze vacature ligt de focus op campus Pellenberg.

Het betreft een contract van onbepaalde duur met een tewerkstellingspercentage van 80-100%.
Solliciteren kan tot en met 27/02/2026.
Hoe verleg je grenzen?
Je wordt ingeschakeld in de courante secretariële en administratieve ondersteuning van de dienst.
Het opmaken van weekplanningen schrikt jou niet af.
Je staat mee in voor de telefonische permanentie op het dienstsecretariaat.
Je verzorgt de patiëntenadministratie in overleg met de artsen.
Je beantwoordt diverse vragen van patiënten.
Je zorgt voor de nodige dossiervoorbereiding in functie van interne en externe vergaderingen.
Je zorgt mee voor de briefwisseling en het agendabeheer van de stafleden en je kan hierbij correct inschatten wat de prioriteiten zijn.
Je staat mee in voor het verwerken en opvolgen van verslagen en attesten in nauw overleg met de artsen.
Je bent vaardig in het registreren, classificeren en opvolgen van gegevens.
Je notuleert in vergaderingen van de dienst.
Wat heb je daarvoor nodig?
Je bezit een bachelordiploma (medical) management assistant en hebt bij voorkeur een eerste relevante ervaring.
Je bezit een goede kennis van MS office pakketten en je leert vlot nieuwe software pakketten aan.
Je bent vlot drietalig (N-F-E), zowel mondeling als schriftelijk.
Je bent proactief en je draagt bij tot een vlotte collegiale samenwerking.
Je onderhoudt goede contacten met het medisch en paramedisch personeel van de dienst.
Je kan goed werken onder tijdsdruk en bent stressbestendig.
Je bent communicatief, discreet en vriendelijk.
Je bent nauwkeurig en stipt in je opdrachten.
Je hebt een goed organisatievermogen, je neemt initiatieven en werkt resultaatgericht.
Wat krijg je terug?

UZ Leuven biedt een professionele, multidisciplinaire werkomgeving die de evoluties op de voet volgt en waar volop ruimte is voor opleiding, begeleiding en persoonlijke groei. Ook gaan we al meer dan 20 jaar samen voor duurzame zorg.

Onze voordelen omvatten:
Motiverend loonpakket (loonschaal IFIC 12_75) en talrijke extralegale voordelen zoals maaltijdcheques, fietslease, groeps- en hospitalisatieverzekering, tussenkomst vervoersonkosten, bijkomende verlof- en feestdagen, eigen bedrijfsrestaurant,...
Een volledig overzicht van alle voordelen van werken in UZ Leuven vind je op onze jobsite.
Klaar om grenzen te verleggen?
Solliciteer vandaag nog op deze vacature door het online sollicitatieformulier in te vullen en jouw CV toe te voegen.
Voor meer informatie kan je terecht bij de dienst werving en selectie van UZ Leuven: 016 34 49 78.

De dienst fysische geneeskunde en revalidatie bevindt zich in een fase van continue groei en ontwikkeling. Een dynamisch en deskundig secretariaatsteam moet de nodige ondersteuning kunnen bieden bij de verdere groei en uitbouw van de activiteiten. De activiteiten zijn verspreid over zowel campus Gasthuisberg als campus Pellenberg. Voor deze vacature ligt de focus op campus Pellenberg.

Het betreft een contract van onbepaalde duur met een tewerkstellingspercentage van 80-100%.

Solliciteren kan tot en met 27/02/2026.

Hoe verleg je grenzen?

  • Je wordt ingeschakeld in de courante secretariële en administratieve ondersteuning van de dienst.
  • Het opmaken van weekplanningen schrikt jou niet af.
  • Je staat mee in voor de telefonische permanentie op het dienstsecretariaat.
  • Je verzorgt de patiëntenadministratie in overleg met de artsen.
  • Je beantwoordt diverse vragen van patiënten.
  • Je zorgt voor de nodige dossiervoorbereiding in functie van interne en externe vergaderingen.
  • Je zorgt mee voor de briefwisseling en het agendabeheer van de stafleden en je kan hierbij correct inschatten wat de prioriteiten zijn.
  • Je staat mee in voor het verwerken en opvolgen van verslagen en attesten in nauw overleg met de artsen.
  • Je bent vaardig in het registreren, classificeren en opvolgen van gegevens.
  • Je notuleert in vergaderingen van de dienst.

Wat heb je daarvoor nodig?

  • Je bezit een bachelordiploma (medical) management assistant en hebt bij voorkeur een eerste relevante ervaring.
  • Je bezit een goede kennis van MS office pakketten en je leert vlot nieuwe software pakketten aan.
  • Je bent vlot drietalig (N-F-E), zowel mondeling als schriftelijk.
  • Je bent proactief en je draagt bij tot een vlotte collegiale samenwerking.
  • Je onderhoudt goede contacten met het medisch en paramedisch personeel van de dienst.
  • Je kan goed werken onder tijdsdruk en bent stressbestendig.
  • Je bent communicatief, discreet en vriendelijk.
  • Je bent nauwkeurig en stipt in je opdrachten.
  • Je hebt een goed organisatievermogen, je neemt initiatieven en werkt resultaatgericht.

Wat krijg je terug?

UZ Leuven biedt een professionele, multidisciplinaire werkomgeving die de evoluties op de voet volgt en waar volop ruimte is voor opleiding, begeleiding en persoonlijke groei. Ook gaan we al meer dan 20 jaar samen voor duurzame zorg.

Onze voordelen omvatten:

  • Motiverend loonpakket (loonschaal IFIC 12_75) en talrijke extralegale voordelen zoals maaltijdcheques, fietslease, groeps- en hospitalisatieverzekering, tussenkomst vervoersonkosten, bijkomende verlof- en feestdagen, eigen bedrijfsrestaurant,...
  • Een volledig overzicht van alle voordelen van werken in UZ Leuven vind je op onze jobsite.

Klaar om grenzen te verleggen?

  • Solliciteer vandaag nog op deze vacature door het online sollicitatieformulier in te vullen en jouw CV toe te voegen.
  • Voor meer informatie kan je terecht bij de dienst werving en selectie van UZ Leuven: 016 34 49 78.

description:
Be part of our beating heart

Brussels Airport wil bekend staan als een van de beste luchthavens ter wereld, een volledig verbonden economische hub voor mensen en bedrijven, het kloppende hart van Europa, waar klanten, innovatie en duurzaamheid centraal staan. Wil jij de luchthaven van vandaag en morgen helpen vormgeven?

Stop met dromen en kom ons team versterken!

Om ons departement Cargo & Logistics te versterken, zijn we op zoek naar een Cargo Business & Network Development Manager.

Wat je bij ons zal realiseren:

• Je bent verantwoordelijk voor Ontwikkelen van een netwerk van vrachtluchtvaartmaatschappijen (Uitvoeren van onderzoek, analyse & monitoring…)
• Je geeft commerciële ondersteuning & advies en neemt deel aan de uitbouw van marketing en promotionele activiteiten.
• Je bent verantwoordelijk voor voeren van regulier overleg met externe contacten (politiek, luchtvaartauthoriteiten,..)

• Je bent ook verantwoordelijk voor het bijdragen aan de strategie voor de uitbouw en optimalisatie van BRUcargo en ook betrokken bij het uitwerken en implementeren van de projecten en andere actieplannen

Wat jou onderscheidt:

• Minimum 5 à 10 jaar ervaring in de luchtvaart of logistiek, een grote troef is ervaring met perishables markt.
• Diepgaande en brede kennis van de concepten en principes in de luchtvaart in het algemeen en de commerciële luchtvaart (luchtvaartmaatschappijen en luchthavens) in het bijzonder
• Brede en in voorkomende gevallen ook diepgaande kennis van gerelateerde disciplines; zoals logistiek, luchthavenmanagement, financieel beheer, marketing & sales, market research, statistiek, forecasting.

 • Je hebt uitstekende sociale en communicatieve vaardigheden naar de interne organisatie, en naar externe klanten en stakeholders
• Je voelt je als een vis in het water in een commerciële setting en hebt sterke onderhandelingsvaardigheden.
• Je beheerst het Nederlands, het Frans en je spreekt vloeiend Engels.

Gaat je hart al sneller slaan?

Bij Brussels Airport werk je in een wereld op zich, vol nieuwe kansen en spannende uitdagingen. Je komt terecht in een unieke en inspirerende omgeving die je talenten vleugels geeft.

Wat je ervaring helemaal bijzonder maakt? Een uitstekende balans tussen werk en privé dankzij een flexibele werkplanning, een ruim aanbod van opleidingen (technische, persoonlijke & leiderschapsvaardigheden), tijdelijke projecten en interne doorgroeimogelijkheden. Of je nu graag buiten op het terrein werkt, of liever binnen inspiratie haalt uit de energieke sfeer … je vindt het allemaal bij ons. Sowieso kan je rekenen op een sterke teamspirit, de juiste tools en een stimulerende bedrijfscultuur. Wat wil je nog meer?

Volg het ritme van ons hart

Kan je niet wachten om jezelf te overstijgen bij Brussels Airport Company? Stuur snel jouw CV en motivatiebrief via de daarvoor bestemde link. En wie weet, misschien verwelkomen we jou heel binnenkort op onze bruisende luchthaven in het hart van Europa!

description:
Your tasks

Represent ALDI Nord in Brussels in close cooperation with the Director Public Affairs
Lead political communication on European and German policy developments in the areas of: Environment (PPWR incl. delegated acts), Supply chain (CSRD, CSDDD, EUDR), Labour & Social Affairs, Non-food policy and Economic policy
Develop strategic concepts and policy approaches
Monitor, analyse and assess information from industry associations as well as political and societal developments relevant to the retail sector
Prepare internal position papers, strategy documents, statements, presentations, briefings and background materials
Provide information and strategic advice to internal departments
Prepare, coordinate and participate in internal meetings, association committee meetings, stakeholder dialogues and external events
Build and maintain a strong network of internal and external stakeholders

Your profile

University degree in political science, social sciences, environmental studies, communications or a comparable field
Minimum of 5-8 years of professional experience in a political environment (EU or German institutions, political parties, companies, associations, consultancies)
Proven experience in engaging with political stakeholders and understanding political processes
Strong knowledge of legislative procedures at EU and German federal level
Ability to quickly familiarise yourself with new topics; ideally experience with environmental (PPWR) and/or supply chain topics (CSRD, CSDDD, EUDR)
Strong networking skills and the ability to build sustainable relationships
Structured, analytical, independent and results‑oriented working style
Willingness to travel to Essen, Berlin and, where relevant, to parliamentary constituencies

Your benefits

Work-Life Balance: Flexible working hours and a hybrid working model with the possibility of partial remote work (up to 40%) as well as 30 vacation days (full-time)
Mobility: Free electric charging at the ALDI Nord campus, coverage for the Deutschlandticket, or a travel allowance
Onboarding & Training: Structured onboarding and a variety of opportunities for personal and professional development (e.g., ALDI Academy, eLearning, etc.)
Impact & Team Power: High degree of creative freedom and unbeatable team power in a high-performance work environment
Salary & Employee Discounts: Secure job with the pioneer of discounts offering an attractive salary and corporate benefits

Contact

ALDI Einkauf SE & Co. oHG

Eckenbergstraße 16b

45307 Essen

About us

The ALDI Nord group is one of the leading food retailers. For over 110 years, ALDI has stood for the creation of the discount principle. Our mission is to provide people everywhere and anytime with their daily essentials: quality products at low prices – simply and quickly. This also includes making shopping as easy as possible for our customers. That’s why we give our best every day and reinvent ourselves time and again. Combined talent and commitment - that is the POWER behind our success stories. Across Europe in 8 countries with around 5,400 stores and more than 91,000 employees. We are: Simply ALDI. Powered by people.

description:
Your Work Context

For this position good knowledge of the Dutch language is a prerequisite.

As a Site Manager at Jan De Nul, you will be at in charge of ambitious and imaginative construction projects: from Oosterweel to the first offshore energy island to the opening of the Ring in Zaventem. You are in charge of operational management at your site.

Your Role

A job at the crossroads of engineering, coordination and communication. As an early riser, you like to be one of the first on site. With a strong coffee in your hand, you go over the daily schedule, and then you are ready to make sure the site day runs smoothly.The site manager is the central contact point on the site: you are in contact with workers, foremen, architects, suppliers... You keep all the balls in the air and know where the site's priorities lie. You usually do this from the site itself, of course. We therefore aim for your workplace to be no more than an hour's drive from where you live.

Your tasks

You take operational control of the site: you start with the necessary preparation and, using the project plan, coordinate the work so that everyone knows what to do.
You communicate regularly with the project manager and external parties (architects, suppliers, etc.).
You ensure compliance with quality, safety and environmental regulations.
You manage budgets for the purchase of materials.
You draw up schedules and progress reports.
You lead the site meetings.

You do not do this alone, of course. You can count on the support of (experienced) colleagues around you. You learn “on the job”, and the project leader and Buildings Manager are there to answer your questions.

Your profile

A bachelor's or master's degree in civil engineering construction, civil engineer-architect or industrial engineer construction.
The technical knowledge to talk smoothly with workers and foremen and give them clear instructions.
The mindset of a communicative and coordinating go-getter who keeps everyone involved informed and motivated.
Flexibility and eagerness to learn so that you can switch smoothly between the different dimensions of your job.
Working at Jan De Nul

Working at Jan De Nul means contributing to solutions to some of the biggest challenges of our time: from the energy transition to rising sea levels to smart mobility. It means learning and working together every day to preserve the global quality of life for generations to come.

What we offer

A permanent training path via our JDN Academy
The opportunity to practice sports at work via our FIT programme
An open-ended permanent contract
Competitive wages with thirteenth month and double holiday pay
When you work in Belgium:
Luncheon vouchers and eco-vouchers
Possibility to take part in the Flex Reward programme, including bike leasing
Company card with fuel card
Group and hospital care insurance
Optional iPhone with subscription
Miscellaneous staff discounts

The world is what you make it

Jan De Nul Group shapes water and land around the world, addressing some of the most important challenges of our time. We boost the energy transition with infrastructure for renewable offshore energy. We focus on nature-inclusive dredging solutions to build harbours and protect our coastlines from the rising sea. We develop innovative construction projects for smart mobility and durable buildings. And we invest in planet redevelopment, giving new purpose to polluted sites. At Jan De Nul, the world is what you make it.

Jan De Nul Group promotes diversity and inclusion in the workplace. We are an equal opportunities and anti-discrimination employer.

Construction
Engineering
Young professionals
Working at Jan De Nul
On projects in Belgium
Education
Bachelor's degree

description:
Dit zoeken we
Klaar om mee te bouwen aan interne communicatie met impact?

Voor het academiejaar 2026-2027 zoeken we een stagiair Interne communicatie (2de of 3de bachelor) met een innovatief communicatieprofiel. Je werkt mee aan interne communicatieprojecten en events zodat iedereen bij CM weet waarvoor we staan en welke richting we uitgaan. Je krijgt de ruimte om afhankelijk van jouw interesses je stage zelf mee vorm te geven.
Dit ben jij
Ben jij de student die:

zelfstandig kan werken en initiatief durft te nemen;
creatief is en dit graag omzet in concrete acties en communicaties naar personeel;
een eerste ervaring heeft met een van volgende zaken: maken van video's, podcasts, verhalen vertellen of community building (dit alles is ruim te interpreteren: dus ervaring uit privé, op school of in een vereniging);
houdt van afwisseling tussen doen en denken;
flexibel is en bereid zich te verplaatsen naar andere regio’s;
samen met ons wil groeien - en ja, dat zien we in twee richtingen.
Dit bieden we je
We hebben een stageplaats ter beschikking, de exacte periode kan in onderling overleg afgesproken worden.
Je werkplaats is afhankelijk van je woonplaats. In kader van overleg en samenwerking verplaats je je soms ook naar andere hoofdzetels.
Dit is je kans
Ben je klaar om je kennis in de praktijk te brengen en deel uit te maken van een boeiende organisatie? Dan maken we graag kennis met jou.

Stuur jouw gegevens en een korte motivatie door via de sollicitatieknop of vul het formulier in op onze website: Stages bij CM | CM

description:
Seasonal Position in Greece

Cooking in a holiday resort in Greece is not the same as cooking at home. It’s faster. It’s structured. It’s teamwork under pressure.

When guests walk into the restaurant, they don’t see the organisation behind the scenes. They see presentation. They see timing. They expect consistency. That consistency starts in the kitchen.

This is a seasonal leadership role in Greece. You relocate for the season — but without the usual relocation stress. Your accommodation is organised before arrival. Meals are included. Your contract and insurance are prepared. You live and work directly in the resort in Greece.

Your responsibility goes beyond preparing dishes. You coordinate kitchen processes, support food production, maintain hygiene standards and ensure service runs smoothly. You stay calm during peak hours. You understand timing. You guide less experienced kitchen staff when needed.

This is not a relaxed hobby kitchen. It is structured hospitality work with clear standards and responsibility.
That said — you will spend your season in Greece, working in an international environment, finishing service while the sun sets over the resort. The atmosphere is different from a typical city kitchen.

You will work 5–6 days per week. You will live on-site. You will represent the culinary standards of the hotel.

If you are experienced, organised and ready to relocate for a structured seasonal role in Greece, this could be your next professional step.

Apply and become part of the kitchen leadership team in Greece.

Requirements

Professional kitchen experience is essential. You should be confident working independently and within a structured team. You understand food safety regulations and can handle the pace of buffet or à la carte service. English is required to communicate within the international team.

Benefits

In return, you avoid housing costs and daily expenses. Accommodation and meals are included. Your employment is legal and insured. Many chefs use the season to gain international experience while maintaining financial stability during their time in Greece.

description:
OFFRE D’EMPLOI

CHARGE D’ENSEIGNEMENT PRINCIPAL EN NEERLANDAIS
POUR LE MANAGEMENT (H/F/X)
HEC LIEGE – ECOLE DE GESTION
NIVEAU MASTER – TITULAIRE D’UN DOCTORAT
Appel interne

Ce poste comprend des activités d’enseignement, d’innovation pédagogique, de coordination de l'équipe
de néerlandais, et de service à la Communauté.

FONCTION

Activités d’enseignement :
La personne retenue sera titulaire de cours dans les programmes de bachelier et de master. Elle se verra
également confier des cours spécialisés en fonction de son profil et de son expérience.

Activités de recherche :
La personne retenue pourrait exercer des activités de recherche en lien avec la pratique des langues dans le
milieu des affaires.

Activités de service à la Communauté :
Le poste implique une participation à la vie académique de l’UER Langues et de HEC Liège.

En outre, il est attendu du·de la candidat·e de :

„ animer une équipe comportant 4 membres ;
„ dispenser un enseignement de haute qualité ;
„ guider les étudiant·e·s dans leur apprentissage et les évaluer ;
„ participer à la vie de l’UER Langues et de l’École en général (projets transdisciplinaires, jurys de TFE,

implication dans les organes de l’École etc.) ;
„ développer des méthodes d'apprentissage de la langue nouvelles et actives ;
„ participer, en fonction des opportunités, à des activités de recherche scientifique, d’Executive

Education, ou toute autre mission en lien avec les activités de l’école.

PROFIL

„ Titulaire d’un doctorat ;
„ Titulaire d’un Master en Langues modernes (à finalité didactique), Master en Langues et Littératures

germaniques, Master en linguistique ou Master en traduction / interprétation, ou équivalent, avec
l’option « langue néerlandaise » ;

„ Diplôme d’agrégé·e de l’enseignement secondaire supérieur, CAPAES ou expérience dans
l’enseignement des langues ;

„ Connaissance et pratique régulière de la langue néerlandaise (min. C1) ;
„ Niveau de français exigé : min. B2 ;
„ Capacité à animer une équipe et à lancer des projets ;
„ Capacité à travailler en réseau et en interdisciplinaire ;
„ Esprit d’initiative.

RESSOURCES HUMAINES | Organisation, recrutement et formation

OFFRE D’EMPLOI

Sont considérés comme des atouts :
„ Native speaker ;
„ Formation complémentaire dans le domaine de la gestion (ou intérêt pour) ;
„ Expérience d’enseignant·e dans l’enseignement supérieur ;
„ Expérience internationale ;
„ Connaissance de l’anglais.

CONDITIONS D’ENGAGEMENT

„ Date d’entrée en fonction : au plus tôt le 1er mars 2026
„ Contrat à temps plein, à durée déterminée jusqu’au 30 septembre 2027, pouvant aboutir à un CDI

après évaluation positive ;
„ Grade : chargé d’enseignement principal.

RENSEIGNEMENTS COMPLÉMENTAIRES

„ Sur la nature des tâches : Madame Madeleine-Marie Hubin, présidente de l’UER Langues
(mmhubin@uliege.be)

„ Sur la procédure : Madame Sylvie Borras, Secrétaire générale (sylvie.borras@uliege.be)

COMMENT POSTULER ?

Les dossiers de candidature comprenant une lettre de motivation assortie d’un curriculum vitae complet
démontrant une expertise pertinente en enseignement ainsi qu’un aperçu des innovations pédagogiques
déjà réalisées ou à développer à l’avenir, doivent parvenir, par voie électronique, à Monsieur Wilfried Niessen,
Doyen de HEC Liège (dean.hecliege@uliege.be) pour le lundi 23 février 2026 au plus tard.

RESSOURCES HUMAINES | Organisation, recrutement et formation

positionName: Senior Lecturer in Dutch for Management (M/F/X)

description:
Date de publication : 12/02/2026

Référence : BASH_82FD42

Département : Responsable / Adjoint.e de vente

Type de contrat : CDI

full-time

Date de début : Immédiatement

Expérience : 5 à 10 ans

Lieu de travail : Uccle, Belgique

Uccle Belgique
Join the adventure
store manager - full time - uccle

store manager - full time - uccle

In 2003, Barbara Boccara and Sharon Krief, entrepreneurs and creatives, took on the challenge of creating ba&sh and its ideal wardrobe where all women could express themselves with modernity, simplicity, and chic.

ba&sh has always been driven by a bold spirit of sisterhood. With nearly 300 points of sale worldwide and present in over 40 countries across all continents, ba&sh is experiencing rapid international expansion.

In May 2022, the brand welcomed the investment of the French fund HLD alongside the historical shareholders, continuing its ambitious development. As a reference in "smart-fashion," ba&sh is at the forefront of innovation and is multiplying its responsible commitments. More than just a brand, ba&sh is a dynamic house that aims to cover the social, environmental, and societal issues of tomorrow.

Through its "Walk on the Bright Side" program, ba&sh is a certified B Corp™ with a total score of 98 points. Discover our commitments: https://www.ba-sh.com/sustainability.html

Joining ba&sh means embarking on a fashion and human adventure, taking on global challenges, becoming global, affirming your uniqueness, and participating in entrepreneurial success.

Descriptif du poste

As a Store Manager, you lead, supervise, and develop a dynamic sales team.

You embody the brand, with the following key missions :

• Managing the store

• Leading the team

• Driving sales growth and performance indicators

• Delivering excellent service to our customers

• Sharing your knowledge and expertise with the team

• Mastering our history, codes, product range, and collection silhouettes

• Overseeing all “non-sales” activities related to the organization and smooth running of the store

• Promoting the brand image

On a day-to-day basis, your role involves :

• Exemplary use of sales techniques such as spontaneous customer engagement, cross-selling and/or upselling, and customer loyalty building

• Maintaining the store’s excellent appearance and merchandising

• Driving overall momentum to achieve commercial objectives

• Overseeing the store’s administrative and HR processes, as well as the team’s

• Organizing the store in line with ba&sh’s strategy and guidelines

• Adhering to ba&sh’s commercial and managerial methods

Profil recherché

At ba&sh, we believe in the power of a smile, passion for the craft, and genuine motivation to create a memorable shopping experience.

Expert in personalized sales, bring us your :

• Warm and caring personality

• Excellent presentation and interpersonal skills

• Exemplary conduct (both in know-how and soft skills)

• Leadership

• Teaching ability and ease in building relationships

• Rigor and organizational skills

• Proactivity, tenacity, and dynamism

• Authenticity and operational excellence

Join us and enjoy :

• A permanent contract offering professional stability

• Career development and internal mobility opportunities

ba&sh is waiting for you!

At ba&sh, we believe diversity is a strength, and we are committed to cultivating it. Diversity in all its forms (gender, age, nationality, culture, religion, sexual orientation, etc.) enriches our interactions and work environment, fostering both individual and collective growth.

As an equal opportunity employer, we welcome and value applications from all qualified candidates.

We are committed to building an ever more inclusive ba&sh, where every employee feels a strong sense of belonging.

If you’re ready to join a fast-growing brand with a true philosophy, we look forward to receiving your application

description:
Lotus Cars builds world-class, high-performance and lightweight sports cars that are sold all around the world.

Lotus Cars Europe is responsible for the Marketing, Sales and After Sales of the Lotus Cars products in the European region. To bring the company to the level we want it to be, we are looking for a Sales & Network Area Manager BeneLux in the Sales Department to join us in our Office in Brussels, Belgium.

Summary:
As the Sales & Network Area Manager BeNeLux you will define, develop and deliver the retail partner network strategy for the growth of the Lotus Cars brand in the BeNeLux region, the Lotus retail strategy and Lotus Cars Product Strategy. This role also includes support for the delivery of regional sales performance KPI’s and targets.

What you'll do:
• Support the recruitment of retail partners and authorized repairers to contribute to Lotus growth in the BeNeLux region
• Agree with Dealer Network on annual targets and achievement of Sales plan
• Identify Sales opportunities in local dealer area and support Marketing department to exploit potential
• Continuously monitor actual sales performance vs. targets and develop action plans to recover if needed
• Coach Dealers on internal sales processes and support the professionalisation of the Lotus Dealer network
• Support the implementation of the Lotus CI and Sales and Aftersales Standards across all markets to ensure compliance.
• Achieve defined Sales KPI with Dealer network and constantly work on improvements
• Support rollout of new Lotus IT systems and processes to ensure Dealers get familiar with systems and processes
• Manage relationship with Dealer network, driving Sales, customer satisfaction, and ensuring adherence to brands standard.
• Continuously monitor network performance considering sales funnel management, compliance of standards, training and customer experience

What you'll bring:

Essentials:

• At least 5 years of relevant experience in dealer network development
• Excellent communication and presentation skills in Dutch, French and English
• Relevant automotive experience in the development of dealer/distributor networks.
• Self-starter with entrepreneurial mindset.
• Written and spoken Dutch & French languages skills at native level.

Desirable:
• Bachelor or Master study of Economics, Automotive Management, Finance & Controlling, Business Management or similar

What we offer:
• We provide access to a company car scheme or mobility to make your commute smoother than a freshly waxed sports car.
• Enjoy your 25 holiday days, giving you ample opportunity to unwind, explore, or binge-watch your favourite shows.
• We work hybrid, meaning you will be in the office when necessary and you can work from home when you're needed there.
• We believe in taking care of ourselves, both inside and out. Our Employee Assistance Program (EAP) and our 250,- wellness allowance, you can invest in activities that make you feel good.
• Work with an international crew and experience a delightful blend of cultures, languages, and perspectives.

Additional Information:
• This role will be working from our Brussels office within our flexible working policy - to come in the office 1-2 days per week.
• Frequent travel will be required. Applicants must therefore possess the ability to travel freely without restrictions
• Candidates must be eligible to work in Belgium without VISA sponsorship.

Our Company:

Group Lotus is a leading sports car manufacturer with a 75-year long history of iconic designs, groundbreaking engineering and legendary victories on the F1 track. Today we are transforming into a truly global performance car brand focused on the electrical future. In 2022 we launched the Eletre, the world’s first all-electric hyper-SUV, and in 2023 Emeya, our fully-electric Hyper-GT.

As part of the Lotus team, you push boundaries. Those of the car industry and of your own. Every member of the Lotus family has some of the pioneering mindset of founder Colin Chapman in them.

We're not just a car company; we're a diverse mix of talent from all walks of life. At Lotus, we firmly believe that diversity and inclusion are not just buzzwords but essential pillars of a thriving and successful organization. We welcome applications from individuals of all backgrounds and are dedicated to providing reasonable adjustments during the interview process. If you require any special assistance or adjustments, please let us know in advance so we can ensure a fair and accessible interview experience. Our goal is to create an environment where everyone can thrive.

Do you want to know what Sophisticated, Rebellious and Pioneering mean for Lotus? Come and take a look at our career site and join the incredible adventure:

STEP OUTSIDE THE ORDINARY - Lotus Cars

description:
The Kardex Group is one of the world's leading manufacturers of dynamic storage, retrieval and distribution systems. Our more than 3,000 employees worldwide develop and manufacture logistics solutions that are used in many different sectors such as industrial manufacturing, retail and administration.

As part of the Kardex Group, AutoStore is a global leader in high-speed Automatic Storage and Retrieval Systems (ASRS) — boosting storage capacity by up to four times. Trusted worldwide, our cutting-edge technology strengthens Kardex’s portfolio of advanced intralogistics solutions, helping businesses achieve smarter, faster, and more efficient order fulfillment.

We are growing and will fill the new position as Director (m/f/d) Autostore Business Development EMEA.

You can be located and home-office based in EMEA.

Your tasks

Lead, develop, and manage the EMEA Business Development team

Driving business development strategies to identify and capture new opportunities as well as set and monitor ambitious sales targets and KPIs for the region

Responsible for regional sales growth and market expansion by strategic stearing of sales funnel development and conversion rates including EBIT contribution and revenue generation

Build and maintain strong customer relationships at all levels

Collaborate with marketing and solution design to deliver compelling value propositions

Ensure accurate sales forecasting, pipeline management, and CRM usage

Your profile

Relevant experience in business development or sales within intralogistics automation or related industries

Proven experience in leading and developing distributed teams with different cultural backgrounds

Track record of achieving sales targets and developing new markets

Experience in a multicultural, matrixed business environment

Strong understanding of logistics, sales processes, and CRM as well as WMS systems

Experience with project and team management across regions

Leadership responsability:

Performance Management – driving accountability and results through feedback and coaching

Intent-Based Leadership – empowering teams to fully engage and deliver their best

Cultural Diversity – building strong, collaborative, and diverse global teams

Strategic Agility & Vision – anticipating trends and aligning business priorities

Innovative Thinking – fostering fresh ideas and continuous improvement.

Business Results Orientation – understanding customers, markets, and competition

You like to learn more about the Kardex leadership model? See on youtube: David Marquet Inno-Versity Presents: Greatness by David Marquet - YouTube

We offer:

Long-term prospects: A secure job in a fast-growing, international company with exciting development opportunities and interesting and varied tasks in a future-oriented environment

Valuable support: Great team spirit, elaborate onboarding and a wide range of training opportunities in our own academy at the Bellheim site as well as an Employee Assistance Program (Lyra)

Tangible added value: Flexible working hours, annual vacation on behalf of the respective country regulations

Visible benefits: Attractive salary, company pension plan and capital-forming benefits - depending on location

Attractive extras: Corporate benefits, company and team events,

Ready to join? Apply now and start your journey with us!

If you’re a visionary leader who thrives on building, leading, and delivering results at scale — we’d love to hear from you.

Please send us your application with a possible start date via our career page. If you have any questions, please contact Veronika Wieland-Kolumban by phone +49 (8283) 999216 .

positionName: Director (m/w/d) Autostore Business Development Management EMEA

description:
Are you ready to embark on an exciting journey with Coreso, a dynamic and fast-paced company at the forefront of the European energy landscape? As a Regional Coordination Center (RCC), Coreso plays a crucial role in coordinating high-voltage electricity flows for European Transmission System Operators (TSOs), ensuring the security of electricity supply on a regional basis.

Your new career in Coreso

Coreso is a dynamic and fast-paced company situated in the heart of the European district in Brussels. We are currently seeking a Procurement Manager with strong expertise in IT sourcing and public procurement.

In this role, you will support and guide the organisation in its procurement initiatives: evaluating needs and risks, designing procurement strategies, and ensuring compliant and efficient procedures. You will own the procurement framework, drive strategic sourcing decisions, and ensure transparent, consistent procurement practices aligned with Coreso’s strategic objectives.

Let us give you a preview of your future mission!

As our Procurement Manager, you are a hands-on buyer with strong knowledge of public procurement activities and demonstrated experience in IT-related sourcing.

Your responsibilities will include:

PROCUREMENT GOVERNANCE & FRAMEWORK Own and steer Coreso’s procurement framework, including policies, templates, and procedures. Ensure alignment with public procurement regulation and internal governance. Drive consistent application of procurement processes across teams.
STRATEGIC SOURCING & ADVISORY Advising the business on markets, sourcing options, tender approaches, and preferred outcomes. Translate business needs into suitable procurement strategies and procedures. Ensure early involvement of procurement in high-impact initiatives.
PROCUREMENT OVERSIGHT & EXECUTION (IT & CORPORATE SERVICES) Manage and oversee public and private procurement procedures for IT and corporate services. Validate tender strategies, evaluation methodologies, and award rationales. Ensure documentation quality and compliance throughout procurement activities.
CONTRACT & SUPPLIER GOVERNANCE Contribute to contract structuring, negotiation principles, and lifecycle management. Monitor supplier performance and ensure contractual compliance. Anticipate contract renewals, extensions, and optimisation opportunities.
STAKEHOLDER ENABLEMENT & ALIGNMENT Act as the organisational reference point for procurement practices. Reinforce stakeholder understanding of procurement roles, constraints, and processes. Support teams in navigating procurement complexity while maintaining compliance.
REPORTING & CONTINUOUS IMPROVEMENT Provide structured procurement insights and reporting to management. Identify maturity gaps and drive targeted improvement initiatives. Contribute to Coreso’s Quality Management System (ISO 9001).

What are we looking for?

University degree (Master) or equivalent through experience.
8+ years of experience in a procurement role with strong knowledge of indirect categories, specifically IT.
5+ years of experience in public procurement.
Strong analytical and problem‑solving skills.
Excellent communication skills, both assertive and structured.
Empathy and maturity to build trust at all levels.
Oral and written proficiency in English.

Why Join us ?

A full-time permanent contract in a stable, multilingual, and international environment.
We provide competitive salary package complemented by extra-legal benefits e.g., insurance, mobility solutions, pension plan, 35 holidays/year...
We offer remote work policy to support a healthy work-life balance (60-40% office – home)
Our offices are in the heart of the European district of Brussels, easily accessible by public transport.
Fun activities throughout the year like after-works, teambuilding's and more

If you are excited about becoming an integral part of our team and driving positive change in the energy industry, we look forward to welcoming you to Coreso. Join us on this thrilling journey and seize the opportunity to grow both professionally and personally.

Curious to learn more about our services? Check out our Youtube page!

https://youtube.com/@coreso1635?si=LQxeuI53xYsZUrOI

The role requires adherence to internal information security policies and procedures, in line with the organisation’s ISO standards.
descriptionHTML:
Are you ready to embark on an exciting journey with Coreso, a dynamic and fast-paced company at the forefront of the European energy landscape? As a Regional Coordination Center (RCC), Coreso plays a crucial role in coordinating high-voltage electricity flows for European Transmission System Operators (TSOs), ensuring the security of electricity supply on a regional basis.


Your new career in Coreso

Coreso is a dynamic and fast-paced company situated in the heart of the European district in Brussels. We are currently seeking a Procurement Manager with strong expertise in IT sourcing and public procurement.

In this role, you will support and guide the organisation in its procurement initiatives: evaluating needs and risks, designing procurement strategies, and ensuring compliant and efficient procedures. You will own the procurement framework, drive strategic sourcing decisions, and ensure transparent, consistent procurement practices aligned with Coreso’s strategic objectives.


Let us give you a preview of your future mission!

As our Procurement Manager, you are a hands-on buyer with strong knowledge of public procurement activities and demonstrated experience in IT-related sourcing.

Your responsibilities will include:

  • PROCUREMENT GOVERNANCE & FRAMEWORK Own and steer Coreso’s procurement framework, including policies, templates, and procedures. Ensure alignment with public procurement regulation and internal governance. Drive consistent application of procurement processes across teams.
  • STRATEGIC SOURCING & ADVISORY Advising the business on markets, sourcing options, tender approaches, and preferred outcomes. Translate business needs into suitable procurement strategies and procedures. Ensure early involvement of procurement in high-impact initiatives.
  • PROCUREMENT OVERSIGHT & EXECUTION (IT & CORPORATE SERVICES) Manage and oversee public and private procurement procedures for IT and corporate services. Validate tender strategies, evaluation methodologies, and award rationales. Ensure documentation quality and compliance throughout procurement activities.
  • CONTRACT & SUPPLIER GOVERNANCE Contribute to contract structuring, negotiation principles, and lifecycle management. Monitor supplier performance and ensure contractual compliance. Anticipate contract renewals, extensions, and optimisation opportunities.
  • STAKEHOLDER ENABLEMENT & ALIGNMENT Act as the organisational reference point for procurement practices. Reinforce stakeholder understanding of procurement roles, constraints, and processes. Support teams in navigating procurement complexity while maintaining compliance.
  • REPORTING & CONTINUOUS IMPROVEMENT Provide structured procurement insights and reporting to management. Identify maturity gaps and drive targeted improvement initiatives. Contribute to Coreso’s Quality Management System (ISO 9001).


What are we looking for?

  • University degree (Master) or equivalent through experience.
  • 8+ years of experience in a procurement role with strong knowledge of indirect categories, specifically IT.
  • 5+ years of experience in public procurement.
  • Strong analytical and problem‑solving skills.
  • Excellent communication skills, both assertive and structured.
  • Empathy and maturity to build trust at all levels.
  • Oral and written proficiency in English.


Why Join us ?

  • A full-time permanent contract in a stable, multilingual, and international environment.
  • We provide competitive salary package complemented by extra-legal benefits e.g., insurance, mobility solutions, pension plan, 35 holidays/year...
  • We offer remote work policy to support a healthy work-life balance (60-40% office – home)
  • Our offices are in the heart of the European district of Brussels, easily accessible by public transport.
  • Fun activities throughout the year like after-works, teambuilding's and more

If you are excited about becoming an integral part of our team and driving positive change in the energy industry, we look forward to welcoming you to Coreso. Join us on this thrilling journey and seize the opportunity to grow both professionally and personally.

Curious to learn more about our services? Check out our Youtube page!

https://youtube.com/@coreso1635?si=LQxeuI53xYsZUrOI

description:
Minimum qualifications:
Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
10 years of experience working on competition policy issues at a company, law firm, think tank, public interest group, regulatory agency, or a relevant industry participant.

Preferred qualifications:
Experience engaging with government stakeholders, regulators, and competition policy thought leaders.
Experience working with international teams, variety of stakeholders, and executing strategies to deliver exceptional solutions.
Knowledge of competition policy and related legal and economic subjects.
Ability to lead and evaluate issues in a changing environment, and successfully manage cross-functional projects.
Ability to act as a collaborative team player and exercise sound judgment within a rapidly changing environment.
Excellent personal, political, analytical, communication, writing and public speaking skills with high attention to detail.
About the job

As a member of Google’s Government Affairs and Public Policy team, you'll be part of a global government affairs team, working across regions, product areas, and functions. You’ll combine creativity and intellectual excellence with the organizational skills to manage various campaigns, projects and initiatives. In this role, you’ll advocate for Google to bring external perspectives back into the company to inform our perception and direction. You're passionate about the opportunity to shape the future of how we use and build technology for everyone.

The Centers of Excellence (COE) within Government Affairs and Public Policy (GAPP) is a vital hub for strategy and expertise, ensuring Google maintains a truly global perspective on public policy. We are subject matter experts who transcend boundaries to inform, protect, and advance the goals of the company, users, and society. The Competition Policy COE specifically manages issues related to antitrust and competition policy globally.

As a member of this global Government Affairs team, your primary function is to identify, evaluate, and advise on major global competition trends and their critical importance to Google. You will lead cross-functional teams, thinking globally and advising internal stakeholders across all products. You will advocate for Google externally while bringing external perspectives back into the company.

Google takes its responsibilities seriously, including engaging with government and other stakeholders on important public policy challenges. The Government Affairs and Public Policy (GAPP) team leads the company’s engagement with executive branch officials, legislators, regulators and third-parties in the formation of public policy. Working closely with Google leaders, GAPP seeks to identify key policy issues, listen carefully to others’ views and opinions, and distill and share the company’s perspective on those issues with external stakeholders. While we focus on challenges affecting the internet, our issue areas are increasingly broad and encompass many areas where public policy, business, and technology intersect.
Responsibilities
Develop and implement Google's global competition policy strategy, including drafting and presenting policy positions, submissions, and white papers to regulatory bodies and key internal stakeholders.
Coordinate proactive external engagement and advocacy with government officials, regulatory authorities, and industry associations on critical competition matters.
Provide expert, risk-focused advice on competition law and policy issues to product, legal, and public relations teams, ensuring compliance across new and existing Google services.
Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form.

description:
Solidaris-Assurances recrute plusieurs managers opérationnels adjoints (H,F, X)

 L’usage du masculin comme norme grammaticale dans cette offre d’emploi est une convention visant la lisibilité de son contenu. Ceci n’appelle aucune discrimination de genre dans le traitement des candidatures

Prêt-e à jouer un rôle clé dans notre staff d’encadrement des équipes opérationnelles ?

Votre mission :

En collaboration avec les responsables de service, vous assurez la coordination des activités opérationnelles et administratives tout en veillant à la dynamique collective des équipes. Votre objectif : fluidifier les processus de production, optimiser la performance collective et atteindre les standards de qualité, de délais et de productivité, afin d’offrir le meilleur service/ la meilleure expérience à nos assurés.

Ces défis vous motivent :

En appui aux responsables d’équipe, assurer la gestion quotidienne des équipes:

Gestion des horaires et des présences
Suivi et contrôle des tâches réalisées
 Favoriser un climat de travail positif et des relations constructives au sein des équipes.
Préparation des évaluations du personnel
Gestion logistique liée aux engagements et mouvements du personnel (entrée en fonction, fin de contrat, etc..)
Organisation et conduite des réunions hebdomadaires
En l’absence du responsable d’équipe, endosser le rôle de back up, assurer le suivi des affaires en cours et solutionner les problèmes urgents

Planifier, coordonner et distribuer les tâches quotidiennes proactivement auprès des équipes pour optimiser les flux de travail, en veillant à une répartition optimale des ressources. (techniques, humaines, etc..)

Suivre, analyser et contrôler les indicateurs de performance liés aux activités de production (haute qualité, délais, productivité) via les outils mis à disposition et intervenir en cas d’anomalies en identifiant les points de blocage et en y apportant des solutions d’amélioration.

Vous vous reconnaissez dans le profil suivant :

Vous disposez d’un diplôme de type bachelier ou d’une expérience professionnelle équivalente ( minimum 2 ans)
Une expérience en gestion opérationnelle et/ou managériale est souhaitée
Vous faites preuve d’aisance à prendre des décisions et à formuler des directives quotidiennes en toute autonomie tout en étant conscient des situations dans lesquelles le responsable d’équipe doit être consulté.
Vous êtes capable d’adaptabilité; vous vous montrez flexible face aux exigences fluctuantes de l’environnement de travail.
Vous faites preuve de proactivité ; il est aisé pour vous d’être force de proposition et d’être orienté solution.
Vous présentez une capacité d’analyse solide des données et d’un jugement critique constructif pour évaluer les options, les risques, les avantages en cas de problématique à résoudre.
Vous disposez d’une gestion du temps, du sens des priorités et d’une organisation méthodique pour planifier et structurer votre temps et celui des équipes afin d’améliorer la productivité.
Vous savez collaborer, communiquer et formuler un feedback tant positif que constructif avec aisance pour faciliter les échanges et l’avancement du travail.
Vous êtes prêt à développer rapidement des connaissances tant sur la législation et sur les matières d’assurances mutualistes que sur les outils de gestion de production.
Vous partagez notre conviction à agir systématiquement pour l’assuré et la satisfaction de ses attentes et ses besoins.
Vous savez faire preuve de confidentialité et d’exemplarité au travail.
Vous trouvez votre motivation en relevant des défis et en intervenant dans des projets pilotes
Vous maîtrisez les programmes de la suite MS Office.(Word, Excel, Outlook, etc..)

Vos avantages à nous rejoindre :

Vous travaillerez au sein d'un environnement de travail convivial où l’humain et l’innovation ont vraiment leur place et où nous respectons l’équilibre vie privée/vie professionnelle;
Vous pourrez compter sur des opportunités de formation riches et épanouissantes pour accompagner au mieux votre intégration et votre évolution dans l’entreprise.
Nous vous proposons un contrat à durée indéterminée à temps plein (35h/semaine), sur Bruxelles .
Un salaire en lien avec votre expérience, assorti de divers avantages. (chèques-repas, assurance groupe, assurance hospitalisation, télétravail)

Intéressé.e ? Nous vous attendons!

Posez votre candidature (Cv et lettre de motivation) par mail uniquement à l’adresse auprès de jobs@solidaris-assurances.be pour le 27 février 2026 au plus tard.

 Les candidatures seront traitées au fur et à mesure de leur réception. Nous nous réservons le droit de clôturer l’offre une fois que le nombre suffisant de cv qualitatif est atteint.

  • Vous partagez notre conviction à agir systématiquement pour l’assuré et la satisfaction de ses attentes et ses besoins.

  • Vous pourrez compter sur des opportunités de formation riches et épanouissantes pour accompagner au mieux votre intégration et votre évolution dans l’entreprise.
  • Nous vous proposons un contrat à durée indéterminée à temps plein (35h/semaine), sur Bruxelles .
  • Un salaire en lien avec votre expérience, assorti de divers avantages. (chèques-repas, assurance groupe, assurance hospitalisation, télétravail)

Intéressé.e ? Nous vous attendons!

  • Posez votre candidature (Cv et lettre de motivation) par mail uniquement à l’adresse auprès de jobs@solidaris-assurances.be pour le 27 février 2026 au plus tard.

Les candidatures seront traitées au fur et à mesure de leur réception. Nous nous réservons le droit de clôturer l’offre une fois que le nombre suffisant de cv qualitatif est atteint.

description:
Build with us

Businesses deserve better from finance. Less friction, more freedom. Since 2004, Mollie has been on a mission to make payments and money management effortless for every business in Europe.

Today, more than 250,000 companies trust our all-in-one platform to get paid, manage money and grow on their terms. Simple, scalable and built with real businesses in mind.

We're one of Europe's fastest-growing fintechs, with 900+ Mollies across 12+ locations. Our people make this growth possible. We move fast, build with purpose and care deeply about our customers. Whether you're solving problems, building market-leading products or exploring how AI can make work smarter, you'll have the freedom to create and the trust to deliver.

If you're ready to grow, shape the future of fintech and join an ambitious, high-performing team, this is the place for you.

Your impact

Our SaaS partners are critical to Mollie's growth, and this role puts you right at the heart of it. You'll own a portfolio of 30-40 strategic accounts—diverse businesses across food, theme parks, parking, ticketing and more—and your job is simple: help them grow, and grow with them.

This isn't about ticking boxes or managing contracts. It's about building real relationships, understanding what makes each partner tick and finding ways to expand what they do with Mollie. You'll work closely with Solution Engineers to improve integrations, drive adoption of products like Mollie Capital and in-person payments, and ultimately increase the revenue these accounts generate.

You're joining a team of 8 Partner Managers in one of Mollie's fastest-growing areas. It's a dynamic role where you'll shape strategy for SaaS partnerships, not just execute it. If you're someone who gets energized by growth, loves solving problems and wants to make a tangible impact, this is your chance.

What you'll ship

Drive new net revenue from your portfolio by identifying upsell and cross-sell opportunities across Mollie's product suite

Reduce churn by building strong relationships, understanding partner needs and proactively solving issues before they escalate

Increase product adoption - get partners using more of what Mollie offers, from Mollie Capital to in-person payment solutions

Expand account footprints by working with Solution Engineers to improve integrations and unlock new use cases

Own your accounts end-to-end - from strategy and relationship building to negotiating contracts and closing deals

Shape the future of SaaS partnerships at Mollie by contributing insights and ideas that influence how we grow this channel

What you'll bring

3-5 years in Partner Management, Account Management or Customer Success—you know how to manage relationships and drive growth

Business development skills—you're comfortable spotting opportunities, having commercial conversations and closing deals

Experience working with Product teams—you know how to collaborate cross-functionally, not just pass things over the fence

Strong networking and relationship-building skills—you're the kind of person people want to work with

Proven ability to negotiate contracts and upsell (ideally hitting a 40%+ upsell rate)

Bonus: experience managing SaaS companies or working in a SaaS environment

Becoming a Mollie: What's in it for you?

We believe our success is your success. That’s why on top of a competitive salary, we offer a bonus to ensure we celebrate our achievements together.

But becoming a Mollie is about more than just the money. We've built a culture that invests in your growth, well-being, and genuine work-life balance. It's about the complete experience. Here’s a glimpse of what that looks like:

Time to disconnect: Enjoy generous time off (your birthday included!) and the flexibility to work from abroad so you can truly recharge.

Focus on your wellbeing: With a monthly wellbeing budget, comprehensive health insurance (Alan), and mental health support, we've got your back.

Fuel your growth: Stay curious and develop your skills with our learning programs, mentorship, and masterclasses.

The best setup for success: We’ll get you started with a MacBook Pro, a home office budget, and allowances for your internet, lunch vouchers and a company car.

Grow your way

At Mollie, growth is personal. We believe everyone should have the chance to develop their skills, explore new challenges and shape their career on their own terms.

You'll get regular feedback and performance reviews to support your development, with fair and transparent salary reviews along the way. Many Mollies move into new roles or take on new projects to stretch themselves, and we actively hire from within to help you take the next step.

No matter if you're aiming for promotion, exploring a different career path or building new skills, you'll be supported with the tools, trust and opportunities to grow your way.

Unlock your full potential and join us to eliminate financial bureaucracy

If you're excited by the idea of building what's next, for yourself and for thousands of businesses across Europe, we'd love to hear from you. Apply with your CV (in English) using the form below.

Want a peek behind the scenes? Check out what life at Mollie is really like.

AI at Mollie

We believe in Always Be Shipping, and AI brings that philosophy to life across every team, every role, every day.

AI is core to how we build. It helps us move faster, simplify work and make smarter decisions, creating real impact for the businesses we serve. We're looking for people who are excited to use AI to shape the future of finance with us.

  • Time to disconnect: Enjoy generous time off (your birthday included!) and the flexibility to work from abroad so you can truly recharge.

  • Focus on your wellbeing: With a monthly wellbeing budget, comprehensive health insurance (Alan), and mental health support, we've got your back.

  • Fuel your growth: Stay curious and develop your skills with our learning programs, mentorship, and masterclasses.

  • The best setup for success: We’ll get you started with a MacBook Pro, a home office budget, and allowances for your internet, lunch vouchers and a company car.

Grow your way

At Mollie, growth is personal. We believe everyone should have the chance to develop their skills, explore new challenges and shape their career on their own terms.

You'll get regular feedback and performance reviews to support your development, with fair and transparent salary reviews along the way. Many Mollies move into new roles or take on new projects to stretch themselves, and we actively hire from within to help you take the next step.

No matter if you're aiming for promotion, exploring a different career path or building new skills, you'll be supported with the tools, trust and opportunities to grow your way.

Unlock your full potential and join us to eliminate financial bureaucracy

If you're excited by the idea of building what's next, for yourself and for thousands of businesses across Europe, we'd love to hear from you. Apply with your CV (in English) using the form below.

Want a peek behind the scenes? Check out what life at Mollie is really like.

AI at Mollie

We believe in Always Be Shipping, and AI brings that philosophy to life across every team, every role, every day.

AI is core to how we build. It helps us move faster, simplify work and make smarter decisions, creating real impact for the businesses we serve. We're looking for people who are excited to use AI to shape the future of finance with us.

description:
What You’ll Do for Us:

KEY WORKING PARAMETERS

Scope & Impact

Lead the top and bottom-line growth agenda for multiple fast growing highly segmented and complex ARTD global categories and brands. This role is responsible for building and strongly drive a robust 3–5-year innovation pipeline of global and regional reach in partnership with the GDI Category network, Innovation and Technology Strategy, Global Equipment Platform, Global Marketing Category Lead, OU Innovation Hubs, OU Marketing Innovation Leaders, Strategy, Human Insights, Global Supply Chain, and Research-to-Experimentation.

Global Category Pipelines are expected to deliver sufficiency to drive +$306M Incremental KO GP impact from innovation. This leader will be accountable for category product in the TOP 15/40 markets, ensuring Global ARTD portfolio remain highly competitive.

Orchestrator of multiple TI&SC function subject matter experts and leaders, such as Flavor and Ingredient Research, Process Development, TCR, Packaging, SRA, QSE, SC, FM, CPS, etc., to identify fit-for-purpose concepts, which could be deployed through viable scalable solutions into the markets by the Innovation Center peers or Innovation Hub teams, ensuring we deliver against Innovation metrics.

This role is a member of the EMEA Innovation Center Leadership Team.

Focus Areas

Key areas of focus of this role can be summarized as follows

Global Scope

Develop product innovation strategies to deliver 3–5-year pipeline for growth plans for Global ARTD category

Collaborate closely with Research to Experimentation and Global Supply Chain teams to design and develop scalable solutions for next generation of category products.

Responsible for identifying and enabling the execution of the next RtE pipeline that can help step change of the growth of the categories.

Collaborate deeply with global and regional SRA teams to get ahead of novel ingredients approval through appropriate agencies (FDA, EFSA etc.) and unlocking the use of new breakthrough ingredients in ARTD Category.

Deliver impactful programs to deliver against Category Strategy in long range plans and beyond.

Partner with GDI Innovation Center peers to leverage project management routines to deliver global innovations with local consumer relevance.

Ensure technical efforts on category are informed by consumer insights, business models and important technology trends to deliver advantaged solutions.

Establish and maintain process and routines for cross functional inclusion in technical innovation strategy development, planning and project execution.

Monitor external environment to identify and action on threats and opportunities for the category.

Define and orchestrate the network for optimal people resourcing to deliver global pipelines.

Lead and direct a multi-functional technical team (6-8 people) focused on the Global pipeline for the Global ARTD category.

Regional Scope (EMEA)

Partner with HI and Global Marketing and GDI category to fill category pipeline with new initiatives aligned with consumer insights

Align on the short and long term prioritized initiatives for the category in EMEA with

Global Marketing and GDI category

OU Marketing, TI&SC and TCR

Prioritize and manage resources to deliver committed R&D plans through the stage gate process

Leverage transformative thinking to devise solutions within unconventional business processes, models, and capabilities, while maintaining an end-to-end systemic perspective

Develop products for consumer test with the best ingredients and process to enable superiority, scalability and profitability

Co-lead scale up with TI&SC, CPS and the bottler

Capture and document learning for each project to ensure continuous improvement

FUNCTION RELATED ACTIVITIES/KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:

Category Leadership:

Drive Category Big Bets to deliver against innovation metrics.

Lead the design and front-end development of global Big Bets and partner with GDI Innovation Center peers for regional solutions as appropriate, to ensure full value of initiatives is captured across the enterprise.

Provide inspirational thought leadership and enable implementation of Category providing 3–5-year pipelines for competitive advantage.

Leverage routines to ensure early engagement and inclusion of other TI&SC functions.

Ensure organizational alignment in the design and execution of Big Bets.

Maintain value added relationships with multiple constituencies including Coca-Cola system leaders and associates; bottlers; customers; suppliers; external stakeholders at multiple levels and on a global basis.

Partnering with the R&D peers, ensuring external connection with Bottlers and suppliers to understand needs and share plans, to fully leverage their capability and support internal stakeholders in trade associations to address industry challenges.

Active contributor to Present forward/Shape the Future Innovation Hubs together with the EMEA Innovation center leader to deliver against Innovation Hub metrics.

People Leadership:

Build and develop a highly engaged Category GDI network as well as leading a direct team (team size estimate 6-8 employees).

Manage resources effectively, including leading the allocation and prioritization of activities, budget requirements, performance management and assessing development needs.

Lead development of clear case for change, desired outcomes, accurate scope, clear roles and decision-making, and effective communication of the change supporting EMEA Innovation Center leader on change managing and new ways of working.

Stakeholder Management:

Build relationships and networks with key stakeholders across the organization.

Facilitate the identification of timelines, dashboards, and financial scorecards for each initiative to keep Global Category Leadership current on progress and potential red flags.

Ensure effective and efficient information flow between Global Category Leaders and the R&D peers.

Technical Leadership:

As a key member of EMEA GDI LT, develop and implement long-term and annual business plans and ensure successful achievement of them.

Play a key role as a leadership member to ensure the Technical Community provides optimal thought leadership, strong business value and deliver on our commitments to the business from our functional responsibilities.

Partner in the ownership of key technical talent progress and their development.

Control and deploy resources appropriately, making sure the category budget is well managed and we deliver against the objectives.

Communication Focus:

This role communicates internally with the GDI network, Global Category Marketing, OU teams, and Global TI&SC teams. External communication with Bottlers, suppliers and trade associations.

Communication and engagement with multiple key stakeholders to gain agreement on the short- and long-term category strategies for TCCC.

Proactive and clear communication and engagement with all key stakeholders connected with Category R&D agenda.

Advanced influence and negotiation skills to ensure clear articulation and alignment with stakeholders at senior levels internally and externally for the company category innovation agenda across the globe.

Qualifications & Requirements:

BS/MS in Food Science/Engineering - 15+ years

Product Design Thinking certificate a plus

Business and/or Finance certificate/experience a plus

Related Work Experience:

Mastery of (required):

Leadership experience in leading large-scale global and regional R&D programs to deliver growth, continuity, or productivity. Product and Process Development Experience.

Strategic thinking and leadership in consumer-centric R&D, leveraging technical and competitive insights to deliver consumer value, IP strategy and robust business cases.

Portfolio management to help focus on areas of greatest opportunity

Experience interacting with, influencing, and providing guidance to senior executives on substantive issues in a complex portfolio / matrixed business

Deep expertise in organization design, planning, network design and manufacturing operations

Orchestrator and integrator – ability to orchestrate and integrate across the organization lines, regardless of reporting relationships. Proven track record of leading teams and projects, particularly in situations lacking the back-up of direct line management authority

Stakeholder management, with ability to drive strategic agreements with internal and external system partners around the world.

Ability to manage multiple time horizons to establish robust multi-year plans.

Broad expertise in (good to have):

Alcohol industry/area expertise

Strong program management skills, including experience of multidisciplinary/stakeholder projects, and ability to deliver project objectives with tight deadlines

Operating Unit Experience

Financial modeling

Global or International experience

Strong insights generation and external capability

Consumer/Human Insights

Supply Chain experience

What We’ll Do For You:

Experiences: The opportunity to learn and grow with a global organization and through multiple different category business development.

Innovation & Technology: The ability to work with an award-winning team that is on the cutting edge of innovation.

Agile Work Environment: We embrace agile with management that believes in removing barriers, so you are empowered to experiment, iterate, and innovate.

Annual Incentive Reference Value Percentage:30
Annual Incentive reference value is a market-based competitive value for your role. It falls in the middle of the range for your role, indicating performance at target.
