positionName: Senior Director, ARTD, Global Development & Innovation

description:
Job Description

GE Vernova is facing a momentum of hypergrowth, and we are currently scaling up our teams, creating others from scratch, and bringing our industry to the next level. Join us on this mission!

At GE Vernova Grid Solutions we are electrifying the world with advanced grid technologies. As leaders in the energy space our goal is to accelerate the transition for a more energy efficient grid to full fill the needs of tomorrow. With a focus on growth and sustainability GE Vernova Grid Solutions plays a pivotable role in integrating Renewables onto the grid to drive to carbon neutral.

Due to the growth of our Grid Systems Integration portfolio (HVDC, FACTS, ACIS and associated systems), we are currently looking for our next Service Segment Leader (m/f/d) to help us define market strategy and drive a robust services opportunity pipeline across all regions globally.

Your Mission: YOU will lead global commercial growth for the Services business across the full GSI portfolio by defining market strategy. Proactively identify emerging industry and installed-base trends, drive new execution strategies to capture growth opportunities. Supports critical negotiations to secure orders and achieve volume, margin, and cash targets.

This is an IC (individual contributor) role directly reporting to the GSI Chief Commercial Officer based in the US. Functional global leadership will be a key requirement.

Main Tasks/Responsibilities:

1. Shape the Global Services Strategy

Build a long‑term view of the GSI Services market and installed base.
Analyse trends, competition, customer needs, and technology evolution across HVDC, FACTS, and ACIS (Alternating Current Integrated Solutions).
Translate insights into commercial priorities and contribute to the Long‑Term Strategy.
Collaborate with Marketing, Solutions Line, and regional leaders to identify and develop growth opportunities.

2. Drive Pipeline Creation and Opportunity Quality

Ensure regions systematically build and maintain a transparent, high‑quality Services pipeline.
Standardize tools, processes, and criteria for pipeline management.
Support prioritization of opportunities based on win probability, profitability, risk, and strategic value.
Guide bid/no‑bid decisions and help balance short‑term wins with long‑term contracts.

3. Accelerate Services Growth Across the Portfolio

Support regions in capturing profitable installed‑base opportunities (upgrades, modernization, digital, remote services).
Strengthen value propositions with Services sales, Solutions Line, and execution teams.
Promote cross‑selling in both new equipment projects and existing accounts.
Participate in key customer negotiations to secure favourable terms and mitigate risks.

4. Build Strong Customer Relationships and Account Alignment

Lead engagement with global key accounts to deepen trust and understand long‑term asset strategies.
Capture VOC feedback and ensure rapid follow‑up with Solutions Line teams.
Align account planning and messaging with regional teams and the Global Accounts organization.

5. Lead Performance Reviews, Reporting, and Continuous Improvement

Run structured monthly opportunity reviews, challenging assumptions and driving action plans.
Deliver weekly and monthly commercial performance reports and support annual budget preparation.
Share best practices, conduct win/loss analyses, and drive continuous improvement in competitiveness, proposal quality, and hit rate.

Your Profile:

Bachelor’s degree in business, Engineering, Finance, Economics or related field. MBA Engineering or Economics
Over 10 years in the global T&D services market, with proven ability to drive Services across different industry segments
Demonstrated experience in designing and implementing global or multi‑regional commercial and sales campaigns and operating rhythms
Solid financial and analytical skills, with experience in forecasting, pipeline management, and contract profitability
Experience working cross‑functionally with Sales, Services Operations, Marketing, Finance, Legal, Risk, and Project Management, and influencing senior stakeholders without direct authority
Ability to lead change, drive process improvements, and deliver measurable performance gains in complex, matrixed organizations
Excellent communication and executive‑level presentation skills; ability to synthesize complex information into clear insights and recommendations
Fluency in English; French & Spanish languages are a plus
Experience in both on-shore and off-shore systems (desired)

Why we come to work:

At GE Vernova, our employees are always up for the challenge - and we’re always driven to find the best solution. Our projects are unique and interesting, and you’ll need to bring a solution-focused, positive approach to each one to do your best. Surrounded by committed, loyal colleagues, if you can dare to bring your ingenuity and desire to make an impact, you’ll be exposed to game-changing, diverse projects that truly allow you to play your part in the energy transition.

What we offer:

Professional Growth: Dynamic team, extensive resources, and training for skill development
A Booming industry with Cutting-Edge Projects: Involvement in high-profile, innovative projects
Global Exposure: Collaboration with a diverse, global network of industry experts
Collaborative Environment: Supportive culture fostering creativity and teamwork
A macro-management culture with flexible working hours and a stable career
Competitive compensation package plus corporate benefits

Additional Information

Relocation Assistance Provided: No

#LI-Remote - This is a remote position

description:
Location:

Kortrijk, BE

Function

To support our future growth of the training and simulation segment within the Immersive Experience business unit, we are looking for a Product Manager Simulation. You will be responsible for the projector line-up for various training & simulation markets: flight, drive, and ship and assist in defining the strategic direction of the product line and portfolio.

As a Product Manager you are the end-to-end owner, expert and integrator of your product(s) throughout the full lifecycle. You define product innovations aligned with segment value propositions and based on a deep understanding of the customer needs.

Key responsibilities

You define, document and communicate the roadmap and product strategy in coordination with the different stakeholders.
You develop the business case & define business models - prepare, organize & lead the Business Case Review, in strong collaboration with Segment Marketing.
You define winning product requirements, based on market needs, product/technical insights, market trends and customer personas.
You focus on the customer experience, driving differentiation through a deep understanding of customer needs and best-in-class user experience thinking. You represent the customer and end-user internally and externally.
You conduct market, customer and internal research to gather product insights, supported by on-going visits to customers and non-customers.
You gather competitive intelligence and perform competitive analysis.
You create pricing models/architecture and get input from Segment Marketing for final pricing decisions.
You own and manage the end-to-end lifecycle of product.
You act as an integrator and collaborate with a wide variety of functional areas (such as segment marketing, sales, engineering, manufacturing, product owners and operations) to define product requirements, customer needs and market opportunities. You ensure effective product development progress, take the necessary decisions on MVP/feature prioritization, and manage possible roadblocks
You collaborate with Product Marketing and Sales on new product launches

Your profile

You hold a higher degree combined with a minimum of 5 years professional experience in a simulation or defense-oriented context.
You have a proven track record in defining the winning product & portfolio strategy across a global market
Experience in the flight simulation market is a strong asset.
You have a customer experience mindset in all you do and you put customer success first. You enjoy spending time in the market to understand customer needs and translate them to new products, functionalities and solutions.
You are technically savvy, a team player and you have the ability to coordinate with product development, engineering and other areas throughout the organization. You are confident in prioritization tasks and are a clear communicator.
You like to present to an audience, are good at interacting with people and are curious for new ideas.
You are willing to travel up to 30% of your time

Let's wow you with

A variety of inhouse trainings at our Barco University so you can continuously grow & learn as a professional.
A healthy working environment with interesting workshops, sport activities and many more options as we care about your wellbeing.
The opportunity to work for an international market leader where innovation matters.
 A competitive salary package.

  ️ We are committed to conducting our business activities with the highest standards of integrity, responsibility and compliance across all aspects of our operations. This includes adherence to applicable laws, regulations and internal policies related to ethical conduct, quality standards, cyber security, sustainability, data protection & confidentiality and safety.

D&I Statement
At Barco, innovation drives everything we do. We believe that diversity fuels creativity, bringing us closer to our colleagues and customers. Inclusion and equity aren't just values—they're core capabilities that propel us toward our shared goals and mission.

  • You have a customer experience mindset in all you do and you put customer success first. You enjoy spending time in the market to understand customer needs and translate them to new products, functionalities and solutions.
  • You are technically savvy, a team player and you have the ability to coordinate with product development, engineering and other areas throughout the organization. You are confident in prioritization tasks and are a clear communicator.
  • You like to present to an audience, are good at interacting with people and are curious for new ideas.
  • You are willing to travel up to 30% of your time


Let's wow you with

  • A variety of inhouse trainings at our Barco University so you can continuously grow & learn as a professional.
  • A healthy working environment with interesting workshops, sport activities and many more options as we care about your wellbeing.
  • The opportunity to work for an international market leader where innovation matters.
  • A competitive salary package.

️ We are committed to conducting our business activities with the highest standards of integrity, responsibility and compliance across all aspects of our operations. This includes adherence to applicable laws, regulations and internal policies related to ethical conduct, quality standards, cyber security, sustainability, data protection & confidentiality and safety.

D&I Statement
At Barco, innovation drives everything we do. We believe that diversity fuels creativity, bringing us closer to our colleagues and customers. Inclusion and equity aren't just values—they're core capabilities that propel us toward our shared goals and mission.

description:
Zoetis is currently looking for a Product Manager Companion Animals Benelux.

The Product Manager executes marketing tactics for the core brands of their portfolio and implements offline and digital marketing campaigns, information and activities that promote this portfolio towards customers and consumers and analyses the results for continuous improvement of the tactics.
They have financial responsibility for their allocated Marketing budget.
The Product Manager provides market analysis, competitor knowledge and supports the Business Unit, customers, external stakeholders.
They deliver value to our customers and consumers, giving Zoetis a major differentiator and creating significant competitive advantage.

CORE RESPONSIBILITIES
Strategy and Planning
- Develops annual omnichannel marketing execution plans for core products
- Builds tactical plan alongside the Business Unit Director
- Executes plans that support customer and consumer engagement both online and offline
- Monitors results and adapts when needed
- Accelerates the digital implementation for communication toward customers and consumers building a strong community and direct communication to make them supporters and advocates of Zoetis and our brands
- Creates effective cross functional relationships with the field force team to ensure continuous alignment of marketing programmes to commercial activities and account plans
- Maintains expertise with the evolving portfolio of products, services, pricing, competition, market and industry trends
- Gathers data and feedback from a range of sources – market data, customer visits, field force feedback, market research, publications, conferences and industry contacts. Analyse and interpret; using results of analysis to inform commercial decision making

Marketing Campaigns & Demand Creation
- Develops and delivers omnichannel marketing campaigns that achieve appropriate impact, product positioning, market growth and profitability, with consideration for both the short and long term and the evolution of the consumers expectations
- Participates in project management to create Account Based Marketing materials in a customer centric approach.
- Drives collaboration with sales teams to ensure all promotional materials, events, social media campaigns and PR support the marketing priorities and objectives for each product and campaign
- Delivers campaigns that allow marketing messages and product information to be easily translatable into the context of the Solution Selling model
- Works with commercial and technical team leadership to agree training priorities and development plans for field force teams that support marketing activities
- Conducts regular customer visits to gain customer insights. Use this knowledge to make the difference vs competition and aligned with customers and consumers needs
- Ensures all materials, training and other methods of support are made available for distributors in the Benelux while respecting the agreed deadlines
- Analyses the results of all their campaigns to ensure optimal ROI and adapts plans when needed

Relationships
- Develops partnerships with product stakeholders with a common goal of maximising commerciality of products and services
- Engages with the internal global marketing teams to share best practise activities and marketing campaigns through the vault system
- Uses links with external networks and key influencers to bring innovation to our business
- Creates networks of resources within the team around each product and marketing campaign, utilising all resources available
- Draws on the broad knowledge of colleagues and network to find business growth opportunities
- Seeks customer centric input from the commercial colleagues into marketing plans and programmes
- Contributes to the success of the business by sharing best practice with colleagues, proactively contributing ideas, and supporting others to do the same across the business

Financial Management & Compliance
- Manages allocated Direct Marketing Expenditure (DME) budget with tight control to avoid over/underspends in compliance with the Expenses Policy
- Responsible for Scientific approval and compliance.
- Maintains high standards of business conduct and compliance, adhering particularly to Pharmacovigilance Policy, Global vet Policy, Zoetis values, travel & expenses policy and local codes of practice
- Ensures the recording of accurate financial records and communicate effectively, sharing information with other stakeholders

KEY SKILLS
- An expert knowledge of all key marketing and digital marketing disciplines and techniques
- Commercially minded with financial acumen
- Analytical thinker, able to interpret data and information from multiple sources
- Good relationship management, interpersonal skills and influencing abilities
- Strong communication skills; written, verbal and presentation skills
- Effective stakeholder management
- Growth mindset with strong change management skills

TRAINING & QUALIFICATIONS
- At least Bachelor’s Degree in animal health, preferably a Veterinarian degree.
- IT literate. Able to use standard business software and communication tools
- Fluent in Dutch and English, French is a real asset

EXPERIENCE
- Experience in the animal health field
- Experience in a marketing/business development role (min 2 years)
- Experience or interest in science

TRAVEL REQUIREMENT
- Regular travel within the Benelux region

Full time

positionName: Product Manager CA Benelux Commerical Non-Sales Zaventem Belgium JR00020186

descriptionHTML:
GENERAL ROLE


The Department Manager, in partnership with the Store Manager and peers, successfully manages all boutique activities, leading and supporting the development of their team, focusing on business and customer experience with highest integrity, actively embodying Hermès culture and values.

MAIN RESPONSABILITIES


People management and development

  • Plan daily activities, setting objectives and assigning tasks to the team;
  • Observe the team on the floor and provide ongoing feedback and coaching, supporting their personal development;
  • Participate in recruitment activities in partnership with the leading team and in line with the HR strategy;
  • Provide induction for new arrivals and ensure their full integration within the team;
  • Define personal development objectives for team members, set expectations and targets, coaching them on improvement areas;
  • Conduct Annual Performance Appraisal with team members to support their development and discuss career ambition;
  • Propose people development plans to store management and HR;
    • Identify training needs and share them with the store management and the training manager.


Sales and Client experience

  • Drive the achievement of sales goal through their team members, with a specific responsibility on their departments;
  • Develop business strategy and action plan to enhance the growth of their departments;
  • Contribute to the business development through proposal of commercial actions leveraging experience on product knowledge, market trends, customer feedback and best practice and monitor business performance indicators;
  • Develop an action plan to meet targets based on performance indicators analysis;
  • Be responsible of buying for their departments, proposing to their manager a strategy based on analysis of past performance, observation, feedback from clients, market trends, etc;
  • Foster client culture within the team, supporting them on client discovery, increasing loyalty of existing ones and sharing best practice on clienteling activities;
  • Support the store team in difficult and complex sales and in managing complaints;
  • Plan morning briefings, ensuring involvement of all team members and support them in their preparation;
    • Coach team members to improve data accuracy and client reachability, monitoring data quality in line with privacy and company guidelines.

Operations & Visual Merchandising

  • Support store management in organizing, ensuring proper floor coverage and supervision;
  • Collaborate with operations team and store management to improve end to end processes in store;
    • Encourage continuous collaboration with visual merchandising, leveraging VM as a tool to drive business performance


PROFILE

  • Bachelor’s degree preferably with a hospitality or fashion management focus;
  • Fluency in Dutch and English. French will be considered an advantage;
  • Professional background: strong career in management, preferably with international and luxury fashion retail experience;
  • Proficient with Excel / IT tools;
  • Exemplarity (application of procedures, presence on the ground, attitude, presentation, etc.);
  • Driving and charismatic presence on the sales floor and with various interfaces;
  • Analytical skills and a particular appetite for defining strategies;
  • Excellent leadership attitude and ability to lead and motivate a team;
  • Professionalism, enthusiasm, dynamism, ease of integration and teamwork complete the profile.
    Hermès engages positive and passionate people who own the following requirements:
  • Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, with a customer service orientation;
  • Team player mentality to build meaningful relationships and ability to work autonomously;
  • Availability, flexibility and dynamism to function in a high-pace environment;
    • Determined to be part of a people centric retail project, for which is required vocation for human values, passion and a strong aesthetic sense.

In Hermès diversity of experience and perspectives create a better work environment, we value, ensure and believe in gender equality, welcoming individuals of all backgrounds. Join the human adventure of Hermès!

description:
As a QMS & Continuous Improvement Manager, you are responsible for steering and aligning the Integrated Quality Management System. You act as a conductor, ensuring that organizational processes are aligned so that they are robust and effectively applied throughout the company. You ensure the proper coordination between digital tools, processes, and various quality systems (GMP, ISO13485, etc.). You also play a key role in promoting a culture of continuous improvement focused on operational excellence, and ensure that Quality activities generate measurable added value for the company.
Responsibilities
You provide a comprehensive and systematic overview of the Integrated Quality Management System to ensure consistency between organizational processes in line with digital tools and specific business requirements.
You maintain an Integrated Quality Management System aligned with the company’s strategy, objectives, and values.
You are the business owner of the digital tools related to the Quality Management System (e-QMS, etc.) in coordination with the IS.
You are the ambassador for operational excellence methodologies (Lean, Six Sigma, Kaizen, etc.) and actively promote a culture of continuous improvement within the company.
You ensure the implementation of dashboards to monitor process efficiency and performance.
You turn quality tools (quality events, audits, management reviews) into real levers for improvement and organization, making compliance a driver of value.
You ensure that the team’s operational tasks are carried out properly and act as a backup to guarantee business continuity.
You are responsible for cross-functional certifications (e.g., ISO9001) based on specific quality systems (e.g., GMP/ISO13485/etc.).
You unite your entire team around the strategy and objectives.
You participate in identifying and recruiting members of your department.
You ensure the regular evaluation and development of your employees.
You bring the company’s vision and values to life and communicate them to team members.
Profile
You have a master’s degree in science or engineering.
You have proven experience (at least seven years) in managing organizational and/or digital projects.
You have a good knowledge of IT tools (eQMS, ERP, MES, collaborative platforms, etc.) and AI-related technologies.
You have a good knowledge of lean/six sigma/etc. approaches.
You have experience in team management and change management.
You have leadership skills, strategic vision, and a cross-functional approach.
You have the ability to unite people and support change.
You have an analytical mind, are pragmatic, and solution-oriented.
You have excellent oral and written communication skills.
You have an innovative spirit and are curious about technology.
Would you like to become a key player in the global fight against cancer?

At Trasis, we offer you the opportunity to work with cutting-edge technologies and contribute to improving cancer diagnosis and treatment techniques. Through your work, you will have the opportunity to make a positive impact on the services provided to users and patients.

The opportunity to participate in building and improving processes in a rapidly growing company.

We offer a young and friendly working atmosphere, a flexible and dynamic environment.

An attractive and flexible salary based on your experience and performance, with extra-legal benefits.

description:
Job Description

We are looking for a Manager Category Management – Drinks who will make a difference in our shops!

As Manager Category Management - Drinks, you take the commercial lead for the Drinks category, you manage a team of category managers and support management in strategic projects. You are the driving force behind a winning assortment, sharp pricing and promotional strategies, and flawless execution across Belgium and Luxembourg.

Your impact

Lead, coach, develop: You motivate and support your category colleagues, focusing on onboarding, mentoring, and building a high‑performing team.
End‑to‑end ownership of your Drinks category: from market analysis and assortment definition to planograms, pricing strategy, promotion planning and supply alignment — you steer performance on revenue, margin, volume, traffic, and market share.
Belux scope: You work cross‑functionally with local stakeholders and European counterparts, ensuring consistent and high‑quality execution in both Belgium and Luxembourg.

Your Responsibilities

Category leadership & team development
You manage a team of 5 Category Managers (drinks / coffee / impulse / tobacco), motivating, coaching and supporting them while strengthening team dynamics.
You help build an ambitious, high‑performing and cost‑conscious team with strong commercial impact, creating smooth, execution‑focused collaboration that makes life easier for our sites and customers.
You support management in key strategic projects and ensure professional and consistent execution of business plans.
You collaborate closely with colleagues from Category Management, Convenience Support and Marketing to maximize impact.
Managing & optimizing the Drinks category
You monitor market trends and competitors closely and build deep category expertise.
You define the optimal drinks assortment per segment and per country, inspired by market leaders and innovations.
You develop planograms and an effective pricing strategy for the category.
You are responsible for product launches within your category.
You drive category performance on revenue, margin, volume, traffic and market share.
You analyze and report category results, developing action plans to reinforce growth and profitability and to ensure budget targets are met.
You provide accurate and complete product information to keep the back‑office system fully up to date and ensure smooth communication to our sites.
Negotiations & promotion management for Drinks
You negotiate commercial and promotional activities and related budgets with beverage suppliers.
You develop the annual promotion plan for Drinks, tailored by segment and by country.
You maintain strong relationships with suppliers and distributors and ensure product availability.
You prepare and coordinate promotional plans with the relevant teams.

Your context

You operate across both Belgium and Luxembourg.
The rollout of Circle K shops and the renewed assortment brings significant innovation and commercial opportunities.
SFS revenues, driven by an increasingly strong shop offer, are essential for sustainable retail profitability.

Your Profile

Education: Higher relevant education (e.g., Business or related field); Category Management and Project Management training are a plus.
Experience: At least 5+ years in category management; 3+ years in FMCG/retail or a specialized sector. Experience with supplier negotiations, contracts and (private label) product or brand development.
People management: Solid experience in leading a team.
Skills: Strong analytical capabilities and proficiency with tools like Excel, PowerBI, etc.
Personality:
highly organized and a true team player,
customer‑focused, commercial and acting with integrity,
entrepreneurial, autonomous and driven to continuously improve.
Languages: You are trilingual — Dutch, French and English.

What we offer

An attractive salary, a performance‑based bonus, and extra‑legal benefits such as health insurance, pension savings, etc.
A company car with charging card for travel to our sites, our Brussels and Luxembourg offices, and our suppliers.
A positive working environment where we truly value our employees.
The opportunity to grow and develop in an international company: “As you grow, we grow together.”

Working at Circle K
You will join an international, multicultural environment where collaboration, innovation, and quality are central. You will have the opportunity to make an impact on the future of mobility in the Benelux and Europe.

Circle K Belgium is a joint venture with TotalEnergies and market leader with more than 550 service stations. Circle K Belgium is part of Alimentation Couche-Tard, a world leader in the convenience sector.

We strive to meet the needs of people on the move and make life easier for our customers. To achieve this, we offer fast and friendly service and provide convenience products, including food and hot and cold drinks, and mobility services, including road fuel and charging solutions for electric vehicles.

Our vision: to become the world’s favorite destination for convenience and mobility.
Our mission: to make our customers’ lives a little easier every day.

description:
Retail Talent Programma

Onder de vlag van Hubo lanceren wij een volledig nieuw DIY-concept in België: megawinkels van minstens 8.000 m² met een aparte drive-in service van ongeveer 10.000 m², gericht op zowel particuliere als professionele klanten.

Ons doel is helder: het referentiepunt worden voor iedereen die een groot project wil realiseren – van het renoveren van een zolder tot de aanleg van een complete tuin.

Onze eerste vestigingen openen in Machelen en Sint-Pieters-Leeuw. Voor deze opstart zoeken wij ambitieuze Trainees die willen meegroeien met dit nieuwe concept en zich willen ontwikkelen tot toekomstige leidinggevenden.

Jouw Talent Programma

Als Retail Talent volg je een intensief en praktijkgericht opleidingstraject van ongeveer 2 jaar, waarin je stap voor stap wordt klaargestoomd voor een sleutelrol binnen onze organisatie.

Je leert het reilen en zeilen van een DIY-megastore van binnenuit kennen en draait actief mee op de winkelvloer, in de drive-in en op het hoofdkantoor.
Wij bieden op termijn de mogelijkheid om door te groeien binnen één van de verschillende afdelingen van onze organisatie, zoals Inkoop, Verkoop, Finance of Marketing.
Je rapporteert rechtstreeks aan de CEO van dit nieuwe project.

Wat ga je doen?

• Actief meewerken aan de strategie van ons nieuwe concept met focus op:

Onze winkels (online & offline)
Operationele processen
Communicatie & marketing
Aankoop
Onze partners & diensten

• Je bouwt een sterk intern en extern netwerk uit en leidt concrete projecten in samenwerking met collega’s uit verschillende afdelingen.

• Je werkt met commerciële doelstellingen, omzet en KPI’s en neemt stapsgewijs meer verantwoordelijkheid en ownership op.

Profiel

Je beschikt over een masterdiploma in een economische richting, bent recent afgestudeerd of hebt minder dan 1 jaar werkervaring.
Je hebt een sterke interesse in retail, operations en people management.
Affiniteit met DIY, bouw, tuin of techniek is een grote plus.
Je bent leergierig, hands-on en neemt graag initiatief en durft verantwoordelijkheid op te nemen.
Je combineert een ondernemende mindset met ownership, initiatief en een sterke focus op resultaat en klant.
Je werkt graag samen en hebt een commerciële, resultaatgerichte aanpak.
Je spreekt vlot Nederlands en Frans.
Je bent flexibel inzetbaar.

Aanbod

Wij bieden je een uitdagend traject binnen een nieuw en innovatief retailconcept. Je komt terecht in een startup-omgeving, ondersteund door een financieel gezond en groeiend bedrijf, waar talentontwikkeling en doorgroei centraal staan.

Daarnaast mag je rekenen op:

Een marktconform salarispakket met extralegale voordelen
Een gestructureerd opleidingstraject met coaching on-the-job
Reële doorgroeimogelijkheden naar een managementfunctie
De kans om mee te bouwen aan een nieuw retailverhaal in België

Goesting om ons team te komen versterken? Solliciteer dan nu!

Onder de vlag van Hubo lanceren wij een volledig nieuw DIY-concept in België: megawinkels van minstens 8.000 m² met een aparte drive-in service van ongeveer 10.000 m², gericht op zowel particuliere als professionele klanten.

Ons doel is helder: het referentiepunt worden voor iedereen die een groot project wil realiseren – van het renoveren van een zolder tot de aanleg van een complete tuin.

Onze eerste vestigingen openen in Machelen en Sint-Pieters-Leeuw. Voor deze opstart zoeken wij ambitieuze Trainees die willen meegroeien met dit nieuwe concept en zich willen ontwikkelen tot toekomstige leidinggevenden.

Jouw Talent Programma

Als Retail Talent volg je een intensief en praktijkgericht opleidingstraject van ongeveer 2 jaar, waarin je stap voor stap wordt klaargestoomd voor een sleutelrol binnen onze organisatie.

Je leert het reilen en zeilen van een DIY-megastore van binnenuit kennen en draait actief mee op de winkelvloer, in de drive-in en op het hoofdkantoor.
Wij bieden op termijn de mogelijkheid om door te groeien binnen één van de verschillende afdelingen van onze organisatie, zoals Inkoop, Verkoop, Finance of Marketing.
Je rapporteert rechtstreeks aan de CEO van dit nieuwe project.

Wat ga je doen?


  • Actief meewerken aan de strategie van ons nieuwe concept met focus op:
  • Onze winkels (online & offline)
  • Operationele processen
  • Communicatie & marketing
  • Aankoop
  • Onze partners & diensten
  • Je bouwt een sterk intern en extern netwerk uit en leidt concrete projecten in samenwerking met collega’s uit verschillende afdelingen.
  • Je werkt met commerciële doelstellingen, omzet en KPI’s en neemt stapsgewijs meer verantwoordelijkheid en ownership op.


Profiel


  • Je beschikt over een masterdiploma in een economische richting, bent recent afgestudeerd of hebt minder dan 1 jaar werkervaring.
  • Je hebt een sterke interesse in retail, operations en people management.
  • Affiniteit met DIY, bouw, tuin of techniek is een grote plus.
  • Je bent leergierig, hands-on en neemt graag initiatief en durft verantwoordelijkheid op te nemen.
  • Je combineert een ondernemende mindset met ownership, initiatief en een sterke focus op resultaat en klant.
  • Je werkt graag samen en hebt een commerciële, resultaatgerichte aanpak.
  • Je spreekt vlot Nederlands en Frans.
  • Je bent flexibel inzetbaar.


Aanbod

Wij bieden je een uitdagend traject binnen een nieuw en innovatief retailconcept. Je komt terecht in een startup-omgeving, ondersteund door een financieel gezond en groeiend bedrijf, waar talentontwikkeling en doorgroei centraal staan.

Daarnaast mag je rekenen op:

  • Een marktconform salarispakket met extralegale voordelen
  • Een gestructureerd opleidingstraject met coaching on-the-job
  • Reële doorgroeimogelijkheden naar een managementfunctie
  • De kans om mee te bouwen aan een nieuw retailverhaal in België

Goesting om ons team te komen versterken? Solliciteer dan nu!

description:
The Corporate Tax department is included in the broader Corporate Finance department and is responsible for the worldwide tax strategy, tax risk management, and the transfer pricing policy.

We are hiring an experienced VAT Manager with deep technical VAT expertise and a proven track record in translating complex VAT requirements into robust SAP designs and configurations.

As VAT Manager you:

Act as the subject matter expert for European and International VAT, providing pragmatic, business-oriented advice on changing or new legislation and complex cross-border flows.
Lead the design and maintenance of the global VAT setup in SAP (legacy ECC and S/4 Hana), ensuring correct determination, coding and reporting.
Define VAT requirements and translate them into clear functional specifications for SAP and e-invoicing tools, guiding and challenging IT and implementation partners where needed.
Drive and validate SAP VAT configurations, including testing of IT /E-invoicing systems upon roll-out and implementation of new VAT rules, rates, goods and/or service flows.
Take ownership of indirect tax compliance processes, recommending and implementing structural improvements and leveraging digital reporting and e‑invoicing tools
Build strong partnerships with Finance, ICS/IT, Supply Chain and Business units to ensure VAT is embedded in end‑to‑end processes from design stage onwards.
Recommend and implement improvements to the indirect tax compliance process.
Actively participate in various projects like reorganizations, mergers… and manage external VAT audits.

Profile

Master of Laws, Economics or Finance complemented with an specialized education in VAT.
A minimum of 7-10 years of relevant (European) VAT experience, preferably in a Big Four company and/or a multinational firm, with clear exposure to complex, cross‑border business models.
Demonstrated in‑depth VAT technical knowledge, including hands‑on experience in designing or reviewing VAT treatments for new business and supply chain flows.
Proven experience with SAP VAT determination and configuration; prior involvement in an S/4HANA roll-out is a strong asset.
Comfortable drafting and validating functional specifications, test scripts and business requirements for VAT in SAP and related indirect tax tools.
Familiarity with e‑invoicing and digital reporting obligations and tools, and their impact on VAT processes and system setup.
Demonstrate ownership, able to manage deadlines and strong in prioritisation
Ability to work on projects independently as well as in team
Analytical and critical mindset.
Proactive, energetic and taking initiative.
Fluent in English.

Location: Mortsel, Belgium (hybrid working)

We offer:

We are a Belgian company with a sustainable and innovative mindset, offering high-tech solutions. We offer a rewarding career in an international and changing environment, the opportunity to work with a talented and committed team of individuals, training and career development programs, and a competitive compensation and benefits package. If you want to be part of the Agfa experience, we'll take you there!

description:
General InformationCompany
Deloitte
Business Unit
Technology & Transformation
Primary Location
Zaventem
Field of interest
Consulting & Strategy
Industry Focus
Industry Agnostic
Recruiter
Bulinckx, Julie - jbulinckx@deloitte.com
Description of the positionCan’t wait to make an impact on the world? You’re not alone. Join us in driving progress in the working world and beyond.

Your journey with us

You join our team of highly experienced Supply Chain Strategy consultants and advise our clients with their most challenging questions. You use your knowledge and experience to transform our local as well as international clients’ Supply Chain into a source of competitive advantage.

In your role, you will

Support the client in determining their ambition, defining the right set of initiatives to execute, shaping the business case and improvement roadmap
Designing future-proof supply chain capabilities and the supporting processes, organization, governance structure, technology landscape and data & insights
Perform qualitative & quantitative assessment of supply chain cost and performance
Model different supply chain (network) options and assess their impact
Have quality discussions with clients, demonstrating creativity combined with expertise on end to end Supply Chain
Contribute to business development activities and internal initiatives, supporting the growth of our Supply Chain strategy practice
Develop innovative solutions, transformation methodologies and assets, develop "thought ware" and "point-of-view" documents, public speaking and publication in industry periodicals
As a Supply Chain Strategy consultant and people person, you are also keen to share your knowledge and insights with your colleagues and to share your passion.
Work on the most challenging business questions our clients are facing today, teaming up with unique and complementary capabilities within our Commercial Strategy, Technology, Analytics, Human Capital, Financial Advisory, Tax& Regulatory Offerings.

Examples of projects are:

Supply Chain Strategy Review & Vision Alignment
Segmentation and Market Offering Alignment
Footprint Strategy & Network Design
Supply Chain Digitalization & Technology Transformation Strategy
Operating Model Redesign
Supply Chain Due Diligence and Post Merger Integration
Operations Restructuring & Turnaround

Let’s Talk About You

Passionate about Supply Chain Strategy in a global context
An enthusiastic, positive, 'can do' attitude and entrepreneurial mindset
Insightful thinker, confident with concepts, analysis and frameworks across the end to end supply chain
Demonstrating strong analytical, problem-solving and judgement abilities
Ability to plan, structure and prepare client ready-work
Strong communicator with the ability to articulate complex ideas to all levels of an organization, and effectively liaise with multi-disciplinary stakeholders
An exceptional track record in executing Supply Chain Strategy projects under multiple deadlines in a global context
Industry expertise in Life Science, Chemicals, Manufacturing or Consumer Products & Retail industry is a plus.
A Master's degree in Engineering or Economics and 3-5 years of consulting experience or relevant industry experience
Fluent in English, any other European language is a strong asset
You are eager to work in an international environment, and willing to travel on an ad-hoc basis.
Our story
Enterprise Performance is about achieving maximum impact and value from investments in finance, supply chain, and IT operations requires a holistic view of key business functions from strategy through process design and technology enablement

Deloitte is a globally recognized professional services firm committed to making an impact that matters. Our Supply Chain & Network Operations practice supports clients in addressing their most critical supply chain challenges through strategic, analytical, and technology-enabled projects. We deliver end-to-end, data-driven redesign and digitization to transform key areas such as planning, sourcing & procurement, manufacturing, and logistics & distribution. Join our team in Belgium and work with clients across diverse industries as we advise, implement, and operate solutions that drive sustainable growth and operational excellence.

Who is Deloitte?
We provide industry-leading audit and assurance, tax and legal, consulting and related services. We are committed to driving innovation across offerings to help our clients address their challenges, while giving our professionals opportunities to learn and grow in this era of transformation.
In Belgium, +5000 dedicated professionals active in +10 offices, take great pride in bringing multidisciplinary expertise to a wide variety of clients, from national and international companies, small, fast-growing and large organizations to public institutions and governmental authorities.
Why Deloitte?
Be the true you! We foster diversity and inclusion and encourage you to bring your authentic self to work. Explore, question and collaborate while building a career that inspires and energises you.
Never stop growing! Diversity of thought makes us stronger. At Deloitte, we tailor a personalized learning experience, offering you the opportunity to grow at your own pace and achieve maximum impact.
We practice what we preach! As a Purpose-led organisation, at the heart of everything we do is a set of timeless principles and unifying values.
Life looks different for each of us, so we created a varied benefits package that you can tap into:
My Benefits My Choice, a flexible rewards plan tailored to your lifestyle and priorities
Sustainable transport options offered by Mobility@Deloitte
Flexible work arrangements for all and initiatives supported by Parents & Caregivers @Deloitte
Wellbeing tips and activities powered by Energise@Deloitte
Topped off with other health benefits and insurance opportunities

Empowering our employees with flexible work arrangements remains essential in today's reality:
Hybrid workplace: combination of home office and on-site (+10 offices in Belgium or client's premises).
Part-time employment: all our jobs are open to full-time or part-time work under a 90% or 80% regime.

Join us to make an impact together! Apply now!

description:
John Cockerill, enablers of opportunities

Driven since 1817 by the entrepreneurial spirit and thirst for innovation of its founder, the John Cockerill Group develops large-scale technological solutions to meet the needs of its time: facilitating access to low carbon energies, enabling sustainable industrial production, preserving natural resources, contributing to greener mobility, enhancing security and installing essential infrastructures.

Its offer to businesses, governments and communities consists of services and associated equipment for the sectors of energy, defence, industry, the environment, transports, and infrastructures. With more than 8,000 employees, John Cockerill achieved a turnover of € 1.417 billion in 2024 in 28 countries, on 5 continents.

BD & Sales Manager – John Cockerill Energy

Are you ready to contribute to high-impact, international energy projects shaping the future of low-carbon industry?

Driven since 1817 by the entrepreneurial spirit and thirst for innovation of its founder, the John Cockerill Group develops large-scale technological solutions to meet the needs of its time: facilitating access to low-carbon energies, enabling sustainable industrial production, and installing critical infrastructures.

Its offer to companies, States and communities consists of services and associated equipment for the sectors of energy, defense, industry, the environment, transports, and infrastructures.

With over 8,000 employees, John Cockerill achieved a turnover of €1.417 billion in 2024, operating in 28 countries across 5 continents.

John Cockerill Energy is a global technology leader with over 200 years of expertise in steam generation and thermal engineering, specializing in the design and supply of heat recovery steam generators, cooling towers and air-cooled condensers under the Hamon® brand.

Committed to the energy transition, John Cockerill Energy develops integrated, engineer-driven solutions combining renewable generation, energy storage and advanced Energy Management Systems (EMS). John Cockerill Energy, The Power to change the World.

Why join John Cockerill Energy?

Meaningful impact: contribute to energy projects directly supporting decarbonization of industries & utilities and energy efficiency.
Global reach: collaborate with multicultural teams and work on complex projects worldwide.
 Discover our international talent: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CvUiEakGcsQ&t=72s
Supportive environment: benefit from a culture of flexibility, autonomy and work-life balance.
Engineering & decision centers on the same site: evolve in an agile, engineering-driven environment enabling fast and informed decisions.

Because the energy transition requires reliable, efficient and sustainable technologies, John Cockerill Energy continuously innovates to deliver solutions combining performance, safety and environmental responsibility.

Your role

As a BD & Sales Manager, you will play a key role in developing commercially energy projects and business activities, from early phases of prospection and origination up to tendering and contract negotiation. You will work closely with internal stakeholders to deliver solutions aligned with customer needs, technical requirements and project objectives.

This position combines technical understanding, coordination, and interaction with multiple teams, often in an international context.

Your key responsibilities

Sales Strategy:

Support the Head of Business Development & Sales in developing business plans, strategies, forecasts, and market intelligence.
Execute the sales plan on your market area, in line with approved budgets.
Identify new opportunities and propose product innovations.
Help implement efficient sales processes for strong interdepartmental collaboration.
Monitor market trends, industry shifts, and competition.

Sales Development:

Manage and grow key accounts.
Build strategic relationships within the industry.
Qualify leads and guide prospects through the sales funnel.
Present solutions through client meetings, qualification documents, and industry events.
Work with other John Cockerill entities to develop global sales opportunities.
Support Service teams on spare/replacement parts and customer relations.

Sales Execution:

Manage proposal generation with the Proposals team and ensure quality and timely delivery.
Evaluate risks and align proposals with company strategy.
Lead contract negotiations and closure.
Coordinate bid strategy with technical, financial, and legal teams.
Communicate regularly with clients to close deals effectively.
Transfer the contract inputs to the Execution team upon contract effectivness

Your team : Solid & Waste

You report directly to the Head of Business Development & Sales and collaborate closely with Engineering, Project Management, Legal, and Finance departments.

Your profile

Education & Experience:

Master’s degree in mechanical or electrical engineering.
10+ years’ experience in the thermal or industrial equipment industry.
At least 5 years in technical capital equipment sales.
Experience in international sales

Skills:

Experience in Energy sector is an asset.
Skilled in contract drafting and negotiation.
Excellent communication and presentation skills.
Strong organizational and time management abilities.
Willingness to travel frequently, including internationally.
English speak ; additional language skills are a plus.

What we offer

At John Cockerill, we deeply value your contribution:

Attractive salary package with many extra-legal benefits: company car, meal vouchers, flat-rate expenses, hospitalization/life/death/guaranteed income insurance, variable remuneration ranging from 0–25% of your gross annual salary, profit-sharing scheme based on progress and results
Flexible work arrangements, with 1–2 days of remote work per week after training
Comprehensive onboarding: a 6-month training with plenty of learning opportunities
Career development: regular reviews, large catalogue of training, and career progression
International opportunities: potential to evolve within your sector, across different sectors or businesses, and across different regions
31 days off

The recruitment process

Ready to take on this exciting challenge and contribute to the future of energy?

What are the next steps?

First interview with Julien Reijmen
On-site or virtual meeting with Olivier Vanlerenberghe
Final interview with management

Want to find out more about John Cockerill Energy’s exciting projects?
 https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rMTyXXW7C-U

This is not the opportunity you're looking for?
You can also join our talent pool and be contacted for other positions in the future:
 http://www.johncockerill.com/jobs

John Cockerill offers you career and development opportunities within its various sectors in a friendly working environment.
Do you want to work for an innovative company that will allow you to take up technical challenges on a daily basis?
We look forward to receiving your application and to meeting you!

Discover our job opportunities in details on Career - John Cockerill

description:
General InformationCompany
Deloitte
Business Unit
Tax & Legal
Primary Location
Zaventem
Field of interest
Tax
Industry Focus
Industry Agnostic
Recruiter
Ben Taher, Souhailla - sbentaher@deloitte.com
Description of the positionYour journey with us starts as Manager International Tax.

International Tax professionals offer services that assist multinational groups align their tax strategies to their business, through a wide variety of advisory services.

Role and responsibilities:

You will act as first contact person for clients, for all corporate international tax aspects. You will be working closely and building excellent relationships with them.
Leading a client service team, you are able to assure service delivery according to the high Deloitte quality standards.
You are involved in actively mentoring and counseling the international tax professionals playing an important role in the further development of the International Tax practice.
You are able to build a network within Deloitte, strengthen your international tax skills and working on business development, i.e. identifying new business opportunities and recommending appropriate solutions to your clients.
Develop high-performing people and teams through challenging and meaningful opportunities
Understand key objectives for clients and Deloitte, align people to objectives and set priorities and direction.

Let’s talk about you

You have differential knowledge about international tax topics such as OCED Pillar 1 & 2, the EU tax avoidance directives, the EU and OECD policy agenda, international tax reporting standards, etc.
You have relevant experience analyzing the international tax aspects of intercompany financing, intangibles planning, supply chain or business model optimization
You are able to communicate fluently in Dutch and/or French and English
You have gained 5 to 7 years of relevant experience in a similar position (in a consulting or a law firm, with the Tax Authorities, etc.), where you demonstrated technical abilities and business skills
You are a team player with strong communication skills and an entrepreneurial mindset
You have excellent commercial and networking skills
Our story
Deloitte Tax lies at the crossroads of tax, law, business and innovation, so it is subject to constant change. We get that. Unlike others, our young and dynamic team of tax and legal specialists thrive on this complexity and see the opportunities. It’s what keeps us sharp. We help our clients connect for impact by anticipating change, unlocking the full potential of their people, extracting strategic insights from data, and creating new value through digital technologies.

To assist our clients in dealing with the intricacies of tax, our Business Tax team proposes the services of a multi-disciplinary team of specialists (lawyers, economists, accountants, IT-specialist, project managers), who are highly experienced. This experience spans assisting companies with corporate tax compliance, dealing with the complexities of local regulations and procedures - such as communicating with local tax authorities, setting up new registrations and filing returns. Our team in Hyderabad consists of professionals dealing with Corporate Income Tax compliance, pan-European Indirect Tax compliance, Statutory Accounting and general Project Management (including Engagement Coordination and Business Development).

Who is Deloitte?
We provide industry-leading audit and assurance, tax and legal, consulting and related services. We are committed to driving innovation across offerings to help our clients address their challenges, while giving our professionals opportunities to learn and grow in this era of transformation.
In Belgium, +5000 dedicated professionals active in +10 offices, take great pride in bringing multidisciplinary expertise to a wide variety of clients, from national and international companies, small, fast-growing and large organizations to public institutions and governmental authorities.
Why Deloitte?
Be the true you! We foster diversity and inclusion and encourage you to bring your authentic self to work. Explore, question and collaborate while building a career that inspires and energises you.
Never stop growing! Diversity of thought makes us stronger. At Deloitte, we tailor a personalized learning experience, offering you the opportunity to grow at your own pace and achieve maximum impact.
We practice what we preach! As a Purpose-led organisation, at the heart of everything we do is a set of timeless principles and unifying values.
Life looks different for each of us, so we created a varied benefits package that you can tap into:
My Benefits My Choice, a flexible rewards plan tailored to your lifestyle and priorities
Sustainable transport options offered by Mobility@Deloitte
Flexible work arrangements for all and initiatives supported by Parents & Caregivers @Deloitte
Wellbeing tips and activities powered by Energise@Deloitte
Topped off with other health benefits and insurance opportunities

Empowering our employees with flexible work arrangements remains essential in today's reality:
Hybrid workplace: combination of home office and on-site (+10 offices in Belgium or client's premises).
Part-time employment: all our jobs are open to full-time or part-time work under a 90% or 80% regime.

Join us to make an impact together! Apply now!

description:
What will you do?
Manage a portfolio of diverse projects (small to medium scale), often urgent, cross-functional, and running in parallel.
Building, analyzing, and maintaining dashboards and performance metrics (KPIs) for various subject areas.Structure project requests from the outset: intake, scoping, prioritization, planning, and follow-up.Translate business needs into concrete, pragmatic, and efficient operational solutions.
Drive projects using relevant reporting tools, dashboards, and KPIs.
Analyze data to track progress, assess performance, and identify improvement levers.
Coordinate and engage a wide range of internal stakeholders with diverse profiles and objectives.
Maintain regular on-site presence to ensure alignment between strategy and operational reality.
Act as a proactive contributor in improving project management methods, processes, and tools.

Who are you?
Proven experience in project management within a complex and fast-changing environment.
Highly structured, organized, and analytical profile, with a strong affinity for numbers and data.
Strong expertise in reporting, dashboards, and performance indicators.
Ability to effectively manage multiple projects in parallel while respecting priorities.
Excellent communication skills: clear, pragmatic, proactive, and solution-oriented.
Ability to take end-to-end ownership and work with a high level of autonomy.
Resilient under pressure, patient, and able to arbitrate between sometimes competing interests.
Broad, transversal mindset with the ability to step back and avoid a siloed approach.
Fluency in French and Dutch.

What do we offer?

Like a long-awaited parcel, we want to make you feel welcome and valued. Our offer includes a competitive monthly salary, that goes without saying. On top of that, you can count on:

Meal vouchers of €8 per working day
Hospitalization-, group- and disability insurances
A phone subscription, including 25GB data
A flexible renumeration plan, which allows you to customize your own benefits. A company car, bike leasing, public transportation, extra days off,... the choice is yours
Possibility to enter the Federal Mobility plan
Work/life balance, thanks to flexible working hours and the possibility to work from home
20 days of statutory leave and 7 additional extralegal days off
An end-of-year and performance-based bonus and double holiday pay
Many benefits from more than 100 bpost-partners
#bpost #bnode #LI-BP6
Back to job list

description:
MISSION DU POSTE

Le/La responsable administration et comptabilité des fournisseurs joue un rôle clé dans la gestion des relations avec les fournisseurs (hors Groupe) ; avec un comptable fournisseur sous sa responsabilité, il/elle assure le bon fonctionnement du processus allant du support au démarrage des livraisons ou des prestations, au suivi et à la création de bons de commande, au rapprochement des factures et des bons de commande, la gestion de la contrathèque et la rationalisation des processus, transactions et délais de paiement sur la région.

Pour cela, il/elle collabore avec l’ensemble des départements du siège régional, les magasins et les fournisseurs.
Il s’agit d’une création de poste.

Ce poste comporte à la fois des tâches transactionnelles, de la gestion administrative de devis, contrats, etc…, du support projet d’appel d’offres ou implémentation de nouveaux processus, des travaux de consolidation et de la rationalisation de processus via une démarche d’amélioration continue, du suivi des balances âgées…

L’essentiel des tâches transactionnelles est réalisé par le comptable fournisseurs mais le/la responsable doit assurer la continuité du traitement en fonction du planning. Une grande polyvalence est donc intrinsèque à la mission.

RESPONSABILITES PRINCIPALES DU SERVICE ADMNISTRATION ET COMPTABILITE DES FOURNISSEURS

Gestion des bons commandes & rapprochement des factures

Gestion de bons de commande et réceptions dans le respect des échéances financières
Suivi et contrôle qualité des bons de commande et réception des autres utilisateurs
Rapprochement des factures
Mise en litige et suivi des litiges

Gestion des notes de frais

Contrôles des notes de frais dans les outils selon les procédures
Formation et assistance aux utilisateurs & voyageurs
Archivage des documents

Respect des règles internes, normes et conformité

Appliquer les règles de contrôle interne
Garantir la bonne application des règles par les différents utilisateurs
Former les parties prenantes

Gestion et suivi des fournisseurs

Support au processus de sélection et d’évaluation des fournisseurs en équipe avec les opérationnels et la Direction
Contrôles pré-contractualisation et support aux opérationnels pour la contractualisation
Administration des obligations contractuelles : contrôle des licences, assurances…
Gestion de la contrathèque de la filiale
Création des fournisseurs dans les systèmes et maintenance de la base de données
Maintenir et améliorer les interactions notamment sur les sujets d’intégration comptable, de rationalisation des factures, d’amélioration des délais de paiement…
Support administratif à l’arrêt des collaborations
Gestion des risques liés aux fournisseurs

Revue de processus, optimisation et déploiement de plans d’action

Amélioration continue des processus en vue d’accroitre leur efficacité, leur qualité et leur rentabilité
Cartographie et documentation
Etude d’automatisation en équipe avec l’équipe comptabilité générale, l’équipe IT et le Groupe
Mettre en place des plans d’action pour la résolution rapide des litiges et blocages, garantir la pérennité des relations

PROFIL RECHERCHE

Expérience

Expérience en département administratif et financier d’environ 7 ans dans un environnement multisite et international
Première expérience de management souhaitée

Compétences et savoir-être

Niveau Master Finance ou Comptabilité
Intérêt pour l’activité Retail et un environnement de travail multiculturel
Polyvalence et rigueur
Réflexion stratégique et compréhension détaillée des processus opérationnels
Capacité de priorisation et/ou délégation
Proactivité et réactivité, dans le respect des procédures et des échéances
Résilience, esprit d’équipe et sens du service
Négociation, Management & Leadership
Appétence pour le travail cross-fonctionnel
Excellentes capacités de communication à l’écrit comme à l’oral

Langues

Français & Anglais : courant écrit et parlé
Néerlandais ou une langue scandinave est un plus

RESPONSABILITES PRINCIPALES DU SERVICE ADMNISTRATION ET COMPTABILITE DES FOURNISSEURS

  • Création des fournisseurs dans les systèmes et maintenance de la base de données
  • Maintenir et améliorer les interactions notamment sur les sujets d’intégration comptable, de rationalisation des factures, d’amélioration des délais de paiement…

  • Première expérience de management souhaitée

Compétences et savoir-être

  • Niveau Master Finance ou Comptabilité
  • Intérêt pour l’activité Retail et un environnement de travail multiculturel
  • Polyvalence et rigueur
  • Réflexion stratégique et compréhension détaillée des processus opérationnels
  • Capacité de priorisation et/ou délégation
  • Proactivité et réactivité, dans le respect des procédures et des échéances
  • Résilience, esprit d’équipe et sens du service
  • Négociation, Management & Leadership
  • Appétence pour le travail cross-fonctionnel
    • Excellentes capacités de communication à l’écrit comme à l’oral

Langues

  • Français & Anglais : courant écrit et parlé
  • Néerlandais ou une langue scandinave est un plus

Société

Seras-tu notre prochain(e) Team Leader Administration dans notre Résidence Le Thines située à Nivelles?

Bienvenue chez emeis! Avec l'ensemble de notre personnel, de nos experts et de nos professionnels, nous fournissons des soins et un soutien personnalisé aux résidents de nos résidences et résidences-services.

Notre nom, dérivé du grec ancien « nous », symbolise le profond lien avec nos résidents, leurs familles et la société dans son ensemble. C’est en collaborant avec toutes les personnes impliquées dans les soins, de manière ouverte et durable, que nous remplissons notre mission.

Nos quatre valeurs communes - Un engagement pour l’humain, le goût pour la vie, la soif d'apprendre et l’esprit d’entraide - guident nos actions quotidiennes. Elles ont été sélectionnées par nos 76 000 employés à travers le monde.

Dans une résidence emeis, chaque membre d’équipe est inestimable pour les résidents. Chaque jour, vos efforts sont récompensés par de précieux échanges : un sourire chaleureux, une histoire de vie, peut-être même une amitié naissante.

Ensemble, soyons force de vie des plus fragiles.

Fonction

En tant que Team Leader Administration chez emeis, tu es le point de contact interne et externe : tu es en contact étroit avec les résidents, leurs familles et tu t’assures de toujours leur réserver un accompagnement et un accueil chaleureux. Tu es responsable de la gestion administrative de la résidence.

Tes tâches et responsabilités

  • La politique d'admission et la procédure d'accueil des résidents ;
  • L'administration et la facturation des résidents ;
  • Le suivi de la gestion administrative des dossiers résidents ;
  • Le soutien dans la gestion administration du personnel ;
  • Le point de contact pour toutes les informations concernant la législation sociale, les droits et obligations.

Profil

Ton profil

Nous recherchons une personne motivée, qui est orientée vers les autres et qui a soif d’apprendre.

Et tu possèdes également les atouts suivants :

  • Tu es titulaire d’un diplôme de graduat ou bachelier en bureautique, dans le domaine de la finance, en office management ou en assistante social ;
  • Tu parles couramment la langue de la région pour laquelle tu postules ;
  • Tu as au moins deux ans d’expérience dans une fonction similaire ;
  • Tu es orienté résultats, tu as l'âme commerciale et le réseautage dans le secteur de la santé n’a pas de secret pour toi ;
  • Tu as une bonne maitrise des outils informatiques les plus courants (Suite Office) ;
  • Tu es multitâche et tu sais fixer les priorités ;
  • Tu as l’esprit d’analyse, un attrait pour les chiffres et une très bonne capacité d’adaptation ;
  • Ton dynamisme, ton professionnalisme et ton intégrité sont tes atouts majeurs ;
  • Tu as un réel esprit d'équipe et tu t'épanouis dans les collaborations multidisciplinaires.

Si tu te reconnais dans les compétences ci-dessus, tu pourrais certainement être notre nouveau ou notre nouvelle collègue ?

Offre

Prêt(e) à embarquer dans une aventure passionnante, nous te proposons :

  • Un contrat de remplacement à temps plein, avec un horaire flexible ;
  • Une rémunération compétitive en fonction de ton expérience ;
  • Des avantages extralégaux attractifs ;
  • Un environnement de travail stimulant, propice à l'évolution professionnelle dans un groupe de soins international.

Tu aimerais rejoindre notre équipe dévouée et contribuer au bien-être de nos résidents ?

Postule dès maintenant et participons ensemble à l'amélioration de la qualité de vie dans notre centre de soins accueillant !

Ton expertise est attendue pour façonner l'avenir.
positionName: Team Leader Administration - Le Thines - Nivelles

description:
General InformationCompany
Deloitte
Business Unit
Technology & Transformation
Primary Location
Zaventem
Field of interest
Technology
Industry Focus
Industry Agnostic
Recruiter
Houimli, Leila - lhouimli@deloitte.com
Description of the positionCan’t wait to make an impact on the world? You’re not alone. Join us in driving progress in the working world and beyond.
Your journey with us

You will lead the implementation of SAP GTS solutions at the client. More specifically you will also be responsible for delivering compliance and customs solutions.
Tasks include project management, change management, solution design, solution implementation and end-user support & training;
In your role, you will lead and/or facilitate business process definition and modeling, check the feasibility of this business model regarding the SAP products and the legal requirements. You will guide a team to implement and configure the software to replicate the required business processes and analytical/reporting needs;
You will contribute to the development and growth of the SAP GTS practice globally.
Let's talk about you

You are fluent in English, any other language, especially Chinese and German, is an asset. You have a university degree or the equivalent by experience;
You are open to work in an international multicultural environment and to work abroad if needed; You are a team player with strong communication skills;
You have good analytical and modeling skills; Technical knowledge (e.g. ABAP, SAP PI…) is an asset; Experience in other SAP modules than SAP GTS is an asset;
You have a good understanding of the supply chain management processes;
You have at least 5+ years of experience in SAP GTS project implementation, and thus have solid knowledge of the SAP GTS Solution, in one of the following domains :
 -Compliance Management
 -Customs Management
 -Trade Preference
Our story
Enterprise Performance is about achieving maximum impact and value from investments in finance, supply chain, and IT operations requires a holistic view of key business functions from strategy through process design and technology enablement

With decades of SAP experience, we help clients in transforming their organization and take it to new levels of performance with a suite of solutions centred on the leading-edge SAP S/4 HANA platform, in areas such as enterprise transformation, finance and supply chain, incorporating advanced technology applications such as artificial intelligence, blockchain, and IoT

Who is Deloitte?
We provide industry-leading audit and assurance, tax and legal, consulting and related services. We are committed to driving innovation across offerings to help our clients address their challenges, while giving our professionals opportunities to learn and grow in this era of transformation.
In Belgium, +5000 dedicated professionals active in +10 offices, take great pride in bringing multidisciplinary expertise to a wide variety of clients, from national and international companies, small, fast-growing and large organizations to public institutions and governmental authorities.
Why Deloitte?
Be the true you! We foster diversity and inclusion and encourage you to bring your authentic self to work. Explore, question and collaborate while building a career that inspires and energises you.
Never stop growing! Diversity of thought makes us stronger. At Deloitte, we tailor a personalized learning experience, offering you the opportunity to grow at your own pace and achieve maximum impact.
We practice what we preach! As a Purpose-led organisation, at the heart of everything we do is a set of timeless principles and unifying values.
Life looks different for each of us, so we created a varied benefits package that you can tap into:
My Benefits My Choice, a flexible rewards plan tailored to your lifestyle and priorities
Sustainable transport options offered by Mobility@Deloitte
Flexible work arrangements for all and initiatives supported by Parents & Caregivers @Deloitte
Wellbeing tips and activities powered by Energise@Deloitte
Topped off with other health benefits and insurance opportunities

Empowering our employees with flexible work arrangements remains essential in today's reality:
Hybrid workplace: combination of home office and on-site (+10 offices in Belgium or client's premises).
Part-time employment: all our jobs are open to full-time or part-time work under a 90% or 80% regime.

Join us to make an impact together! Apply now!

Let's talk about you

  • You are fluent in English, any other language, especially Chinese and German, is an asset. You have a university degree or the equivalent by experience;
  • You are open to work in an international multicultural environment and to work abroad if needed; You are a team player with strong communication skills;
  • You have good analytical and modeling skills; Technical knowledge (e.g. ABAP, SAP PI…) is an asset; Experience in other SAP modules than SAP GTS is an asset;
  • You have a good understanding of the supply chain management processes;
  • You have at least 5+ years of experience in SAP GTS project implementation, and thus have solid knowledge of the SAP GTS Solution, in one of the following domains :
  • Compliance Management
  • Customs Management
  • Trade Preference
Our story
Enterprise Performance is about achieving maximum impact and value from investments in finance, supply chain, and IT operations requires a holistic view of key business functions from strategy through process design and technology enablement
With decades of SAP experience, we help clients in transforming their organization and take it to new levels of performance with a suite of solutions centred on the leading-edge SAP S/4 HANA platform, in areas such as enterprise transformation, finance and supply chain, incorporating advanced technology applications such as artificial intelligence, blockchain, and IoT

Who is Deloitte?
We provide industry-leading audit and assurance, tax and legal, consulting and related services. We are committed to driving innovation across offerings to help our clients address their challenges, while giving our professionals opportunities to learn and grow in this era of transformation.
In Belgium, +5000 dedicated professionals active in +10 offices, take great pride in bringing multidisciplinary expertise to a wide variety of clients, from national and international companies, small, fast-growing and large organizations to public institutions and governmental authorities.
Why Deloitte?
Be the true you! We foster diversity and inclusion and encourage you to bring your authentic self to work. Explore, question and collaborate while building a career that inspires and energises you.
Never stop growing! Diversity of thought makes us stronger. At Deloitte, we tailor a personalized learning experience, offering you the opportunity to grow at your own pace and achieve maximum impact.
We practice what we preach! As a Purpose-led organisation, at the heart of everything we do is a set of timeless principles and unifying values.
Life looks different for each of us, so we created a varied benefits package that you can tap into:
  • My Benefits My Choice, a flexible rewards plan tailored to your lifestyle and priorities
  • Sustainable transport options offered by Mobility@Deloitte
  • Flexible work arrangements for all and initiatives supported by Parents & Caregivers @Deloitte
  • Wellbeing tips and activities powered by Energise@Deloitte
  • Topped off with other health benefits and insurance opportunities

Empowering our employees with flexible work arrangements remains essential in today's reality:
  • Hybrid workplace: combination of home office and on-site (+10 offices in Belgium or client's premises).
  • Part-time employment: all our jobs are open to full-time or part-time work under a 90% or 80% regime.

Join us to make an impact together! Apply now!
