description:
Head of Acquisition
Location: Avenue du Bourget, 3, 1140 Evere

Mission:

Lead the planning, execution, and optimization of go-to-market campaigns across all products and services, including devices, ensuring alignment with commercial timelines and market trends, to ensure that all customer acquisition efforts are maximized through effective positioning, timely product launches, and seamless coordination across teams, driving growth and competitive advantage for the company.

Key responsibilities:

Management of the Commercial Timeline and Go-To-Market Campaigns:
Manages the commercial timeline for all brands and products (including devices), integrating major market events (e.g., Black Friday, Valentine's Day, seasonal promotions)
Defines and coordinates commercial periods, ensuring alignment with business objectives and market trends
Structures the global commercial timeline for all acquisition-related services, offers, and devices
Coordinates and adjusts the commercial timeline based on product launches, supplier activities, and market trends, ensuring seamless synchronization
Leads cross-functional briefings with marketing, communication, digital, and sales teams to align messaging and execution across all channels
Ensures the proper dissemination of information to all relevant teams for the smooth execution of campaigns

2. Execution and Monitoring of Acquisition Campaigns:

Implements and coordinates acquisition campaigns across all services, offers, and devices, ensuring consistency across all touchpoints (digital, retail, advertising, etc.).
Translates acquisition campaigns into concrete actions adapted to different sales and communication channels.
Supervises the creation of communication materials and commercial content in collaboration with marketing and communication teams.
Verifies the execution of acquisition campaigns in stores and online, ensuring compliance with deadlines and guidelines.
Continuously monitors the market and competitors to detect emerging trends and competitive actions.
Adjusts campaigns and promotional activities in real-time when relevant to maintain competitive positioning

3. Performance Analysis and Continuous Improvement:

Works closely with data and analytics teams to assess acquisition campaign efficiency and identify opportunities for optimization
Collects and analyzes campaign performance using key KPIs (traffic, conversion, sales, ROI), in collaboration with Business Performance Analytics team, and proposes optimizations for future campaigns
Conducts post-campaign reviews to extract insights, improve future activations, and refine acquisition strategies
Contributes to company-wide strategic reviews by providing data-driven recommendations to enhance go-to-market performance

4. Team management:

Oversee the daily and long-term management of the team, coordinating efforts and allocating responsibilities and resources according to priorities
Inspire, motivate, and support team members
Track objectives, evaluate progress and results
Identify training needs and support talent development
Oversee the recruitment of key talents and ensure effective integration into the team

Your profile:

Master's degree or equivalent by experience
Minimum 5 years of experience in a management role and in roles related to Go-To-Market and Acquisition Management
Experience in managing teams and project management
Experience and knowledge of the telecommunications industry would be a plus
Ability to communicate clearly and concisely, effectively reporting on team results and delivering necessary feedback
Leadership skills: motivate and inspire teams, set priorities, and resolve conflicts
Collaboration skills: collaborate directly with other teams across departments, ensure alignment through continuous communication and actively engage with cross-functional teams ensuring the smooth integration of initiatives across the organization
Fluent French and/or Dutch and English

We offer:

You will make the difference in this highly innovative vibe. As a result, you will develop your full potential by working with highly skilled colleagues and through continuous training. Moreover, you can count on a highly competitive and versatile compensation (market competitive salary, company car or legal mobility budget, homeworking and net allowance, performance bonus, meal vouchers) and benefits package.

Inspired? Please send us your resume and we will rapidly get back to you to invite you for further interviews.

Apply

description:
Site Name: UK – London – New Oxford Street, Belgium-Wavre
Posted Date: Feb 13 2026

Head of Risk, Governance and Global Legislation

Business Introduction

We manufacture and supply reliable, high-quality medicines and vaccines to meet patients’ needs and drive our performance. Our network of 37 medicines and vaccines manufacturing sites delivered 1.7 billion packs of medicines and 409 million vaccine doses in 2024 to help make a positive impact on the health of millions of people. Our supply chain is not just core to our operations; it’s vital to bringing our innovations to patients as quickly, efficiently and effectively as possible. Technology is transforming how we manufacture medicines and vaccines, enabling us to increase the speed, quality and scale of product supply. We need the very best minds and capability to help us on our journey to make more complex products, harnessing the power of smart manufacturing technologies including robotics, digital solutions and artificial intelligence to deliver for patients.

Position Summary

The Head of GSC Risk Management and Global Legislation is responsible for the deployment and continuous improvement of the GSC Risk Management & Global Legislation Frameworks across Global Supply Chain manufacturing sites and global functions. The role includes accountability for risk processes and tools and standard best practices for governance across Global Supply Chain.

This is a global role within the Global Supply Chain (GSC) Strategy Team, with management of a small team.

Responsibilities

Together with GSC Strategy Risk Management Team members:

Global Process Owner of GSC Risk Management

Define and maintain the GSC Risk Management Written Standard and risk documents, for GSC manufacturing sites and functions, to ensure risk management is integrated into normal business practices and the internal control framework including e.g.:

Risk Treatment

Risk Performance Metrics

Risk Governance and support to ensure appropriate escalation of risks.

Acting as a global process owner and SPOC on risk management in GSC, interacting also with other GSK Risk Teams.

Deploy and embed the GSC Risk Management culture & processes throughout the network, drive standardization and continuous improvement across GSC sites and functions, with e.g.

Process Confirmation

Effectiveness Reviews

Benchmarking with best practices from outside GSC / GSK.

GSC Risk Capabilities

Define the training strategy and improve user training materials & guidance to increase GSC Risk process and tool capabilities.

Lead the Risk Management Community of Practice of GSC Risk Management Experts to build and enhance risk management capabilities across GSC sites and functions.

Provide operational support for process and tools to ensure GSC risk users are supported in their daily risk management activities.

Global Business Owner for GSC Risk Tools (VQMS & Reporting Dashboard)

Maintain and drive continuous improvement of the Veeva QMS Risk Module as GSC representative, in partnership with Quality QMS and representatives from other GSK business units (e.g. R&D, Global Support Functions).

Maintain and drive continuous improvement of the global Risk Management Dashboard, in line with GSC business requirements.

GSC Strategy Risk Management

Lead the Strategy Risk Management Experts community to ensure risk management processes are aligned across GSC Strategy Teams and facilitate the Strategy LT RMCB.

Define and continuously improve the Strategy Product & Programs risk management processes.

Lead or support risk projects as required by the GSC Strategy organization.

Global Legislation

Define and own the process to impact assess and execute new legislations potentially impacting GSK.

Co-ordinate and agree approach for gathering intelligence related to Global Legislation across GSC.

Determine appropriate assignment of owner to enterprise risks ensuring effective impact assessment.

Manage escalations of risks as required.

Governance

Drive continuous improvement of the GSC Governance Standards and Best Practices, by maintaining the GSC Governance Handbook for main GSC Governance Forums involving GSC LT members.

People Management and development

Lead, train, coach and motivate team members towards the pursuit of operational excellence

Manage the team through effective performance management

Ensure the retention, engagement and development of key talents

Qualifications/Skills
Basic Qualifications:

Bachelor degree in General Management or Sciences.

Strong experience in Biologics or Pharmaceutical industry; in depth knowledge of operations and supply network to have adequate level of influence.

Proven experience in risk management principles and reporting tools.

Ability to inspire and motivate people to the benefits of effective risk management, so that they take up a proactive role in Risk Management.

Strategic Thinker able to inspire and motivate the risk management community

Passion for continuous improvement with the ability to adapt, work under uncertainty, and accommodate flexible work demands.

Reliable individual -a change agent-, with strong experience in senior stakeholder management in order to influence at all levels of the organization.

Ability to influence, communicate and provide consistent RMCB metrics & reporting to GSC Leadership Teams (GSC LT and GSC LT-1) to support Continuous Improvement in Risk Mgt.

Demonstrated project and / or programme management skills including Agile methodology, with the ability to translate strategic objectives into concrete action plans and prioritise project-team related activities.

Demonstrated effective communication skills and presentation skills (both written and oral) in English coupled with the ability to tailor these to a variety of audiences.

Customer-focused and Cultural Sensibility with strong ability to manage global communities and build relationships across the organization and the ability to understand requirements of local sites / functions.

Preferred Qualifications:

Experience working in highly regulated sectors such as healthcare, life sciences or pharmaceuticals.

Experience of managing enterprise-level policy, regulatory change or global legislative programmes.

Team Management

Agile, result-oriented, proactive

Familiarity with risk topics impacting supply chains, including data privacy, AI or cyber risk considerations.

Strong track record of coaching and developing high-performing teams.

Experience working across multiple regions and managing complex regulatory interactions.

Work Location:

This role is based in the United Kingdom (GSK HQ, London) or Wavre, Belgium and offers a hybrid working model, combining on-site and remote work.

Closing Date for Applications: 27th February 2026

Please take a copy of the Job Description, as this will not be available post closure of the advert. When applying for this role, please use the ‘cover letter’ of the online application or your CV to describe how you meet the competencies for this role, as outlined in the job requirements above. The information that you have provided in your cover letter and CV will be used to assess your application.

#LI-Hybrid

Why GSK?

Uniting science, technology and talent to get ahead of disease together.

GSK is a global biopharma company with a purpose to unite science, technology and talent to get ahead of disease together. We aim to positively impact the health of 2.5 billion people by the end of the decade, as a successful, growing company where people can thrive. We get ahead of disease by preventing and treating it with innovation in specialty medicines and vaccines. We focus on four therapeutic areas: respiratory, immunology and inflammation; oncology; HIV; and infectious diseases – to impact health at scale.

People and patients around the world count on the medicines and vaccines we make, so we’re committed to creating an environment where our people can thrive and focus on what matters most. Our culture of being ambitious for patients, accountable for impact and doing the right thing is the foundation for how, together, we deliver for patients, shareholders and our people.

GSK is an Equal Opportunity Employer. This ensures that all qualified applicants will receive equal consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, gender identity, and sexual orientation), parental status, national origin, age, disability, genetic information (including family medical history), military service or any basis prohibited under federal, state or local law.

We believe in an agile working culture for all our roles. If flexibility is important to you, we encourage you to explore with our hiring team what the opportunities are.

Should you require any adjustments to our process to assist you in demonstrating your strengths and capabilities contact us at UKRecruitment.Adjustments@gsk.com where you can also request a call.

Please note should your enquiry not relate to adjustments, we will not be able to support you through these channels. However, we have created a Recruitment FAQ guide. Click the link where you will find answers to multiple questions we receive

Important notice to Employment businesses/ Agencies

GSK does not accept referrals from employment businesses and/or employment agencies in respect of the vacancies posted on this site. All employment businesses/agencies are required to contact GSK's commercial and general procurement/human resources department to obtain prior written authorization before referring any candidates to GSK. The obtaining of prior written authorization is a condition precedent to any agreement (verbal or written) between the employment business/ agency and GSK. In the absence of such written authorization being obtained any actions undertaken by the employment business/agency shall be deemed to have been performed without the consent or contractual agreement of GSK. GSK shall therefore not be liable for any fees arising from such actions or any fees arising from any referrals by employment businesses/agencies in respect of the vacancies posted on this site.

Please note that if you are a US Licensed Healthcare Professional or Healthcare Professional as defined by the laws of the state issuing your license, GSK may be required to capture and report expenses GSK incurs, on your behalf, in the event you are afforded an interview for employment. This capture of applicable transfers of value is necessary to ensure GSK’s compliance to all federal and state US Transparency requirements. For more information, please visit the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services (CMS) website at https://openpaymentsdata.cms.gov/

description:
General InformationCompany
Deloitte
Business Unit
Audit & Assurance
Primary Location
Zaventem
Field of interest
Technology
Industry Focus
Industry Agnostic
Recruiter
Vandiest, Jasper - jvandiest@deloitte.com
Description of the positionCan’t wait to make an impact on the world? You’re not alone. Join us in driving progress in the working world and beyond.

Your journey with us

Part of a diverse team, you contribute to the growth of our third party assurance & advisory practice using your strategic insight and account management skills.
Lead challenging and diversified assurance & advisory projects at large (e.g. Bel20) companies, as well as SME’s. Next to that, you will be working in different industries such as financial services, technology, telecom and others.
Manage a team and perform in-depth assessments and related advisory to provide ISAE, SOC reports or similar, covering business processes, applications and technology infrastructure for our clients together with your team.
Evaluate and report on controls over the security, availability, processing integrity, confidentiality, or privacy over information and systems across an entire entity or its subsidiaries.
Providing strategic advice to senior client staff (CxO, Senior Risk/Security officers, …) on topics such as risk, audit, continuity, governance, quality, sourcing, analytics, etc. to enhance our client’s business value and effectiveness
Influence clients, teams and individuals positively, leading by example and establishing confident relationships with increasingly senior people
Understand key objectives for clients and Deloitte, align people to objectives and set priorities and direction

Let’s talk about you

Between 2 and 6 years of experience in risk and advisory projects.
Strong academic background and interpersonal skills
Highly developed project and people management skills including experience with managing millennials.
Proven skills in on-the-job coaching.
Experience with managing projects end-to-end (sales to invoice).
Strategic vision for the long-term growth and development of the team and firm, able to apply profitability management and sales fundamentals to support projects and pursuits
Fluent in English and either Dutch or French.
Experience in financial services industry (banking, insurance, payments, fintechs, etc) is a plus.
Certifications such as COBIT, ITIL, CISA, Prince2, CIA, etc. are a plus.
Our story
Assurance is about much more than just the numbers. It’s about attesting to accomplishments and challenges, and helping to assure strong foundations for future aspirations. Deloitte illuminates the what, how, and why of change so you’re always ready to act ahead. We do this by performing audits of financial figures and other data, reviewing the efficiency and effectiveness of processes, procedures, systems, and organizations as well as solving problems and offering expert insights. We provide services using an approach designed to provide the flexibility to serve the unique circumstances and complexities of our clients.
Controls Assurance is part of Audit & Assurance.

Who is Deloitte?
We provide industry-leading audit and assurance, tax and legal, consulting and related services. We are committed to driving innovation across offerings to help our clients address their challenges, while giving our professionals opportunities to learn and grow in this era of transformation.
In Belgium, +5000 dedicated professionals active in +10 offices, take great pride in bringing multidisciplinary expertise to a wide variety of clients, from national and international companies, small, fast-growing and large organizations to public institutions and governmental authorities.
Why Deloitte?
Be the true you! We foster diversity and inclusion and encourage you to bring your authentic self to work. Explore, question and collaborate while building a career that inspires and energises you.
Never stop growing! Diversity of thought makes us stronger. At Deloitte, we tailor a personalized learning experience, offering you the opportunity to grow at your own pace and achieve maximum impact.
We practice what we preach! As a Purpose-led organisation, at the heart of everything we do is a set of timeless principles and unifying values.
Life looks different for each of us, so we created a varied benefits package that you can tap into:
My Benefits My Choice, a flexible rewards plan tailored to your lifestyle and priorities
Sustainable transport options offered by Mobility@Deloitte
Flexible work arrangements for all and initiatives supported by Parents & Caregivers @Deloitte
Wellbeing tips and activities powered by Energise@Deloitte
Topped off with other health benefits and insurance opportunities

Empowering our employees with flexible work arrangements remains essential in today's reality:
Hybrid workplace: combination of home office and on-site (+10 offices in Belgium or client's premises).
Part-time employment: all our jobs are open to full-time or part-time work under a 90% or 80% regime.

Join us to make an impact together! Apply now!

Why Join Our Internship Program?
Real-World Experience: Work alongside seasoned professionals and contribute to meaningful projects that impact our organization.

Career Growth: Build a strong foundation for your future career within our company and the wider industry.

Explore Our Internship Areas
Human Resources: Gain valuable experience supporting a wide range of HR functions, including recruitment, employee relations, learning and development, performance management, and HR administration.
Marketing: Get involved in brand strategy, digital campaigns, and market research. Develop creative solutions that resonate with our customers and elevate our brand presence.
Finance: Gain insight into financial planning, budgeting, and analysis. Support decision-making processes that ensure the company’s financial health and growth.
Project Management: Assist in planning, executing, and closing projects efficiently. Learn to manage resources, timelines, and stakeholder communication to deliver successful outcomes.
Let's talk about you

To thrive in this enriching internship opportunity, we are looking for candidates who possess the following profile requirements:

Go-getter attitude with a proactive mindset.
Eager to learn and adapt in a fast-paced environment.
Excellent communication skills in Dutch or French, and English (both written and verbal).
You are familiar with the MS Office applications
The internship needs to form a compulsory element of your course: the period can be flexible.
Hands-on approach with a willingness to tackle challenges.

Team player.

description:
General InformationCompany
Deloitte
Business Unit
Tax & Legal
Primary Location
Zaventem
Field of interest
Tax
Industry Focus
Industry Agnostic
Recruiter
Ben Taher, Souhailla - sbentaher@deloitte.com
Description of the positionCan’t wait to make an impact on the world? You’re not alone. Join us in driving progress in the working world and beyond.
At Deloitte Transfer Pricing, we help companies manage risks by aligning transfer pricing strategies with their global operations and objectives. Our work spans audits, advanced pricing agreements, documentation, and planning projects, ensuring clients have strategic, compliant, and effective transfer pricing solutions.

We are expanding our Transfer Pricing team and looking for new talent to join us! You’ll have the opportunity to work from our offices in Ghent, Antwerp, Zaventem or Liège.

As part of our team, you will:

Advise clients on transfer pricing matters and risk management.
Manage diverse projects across industries—from proposal development to final deliverables.
Ensure timely delivery of reports, analyses, and project management.
Develop tailored transfer pricing strategies using financial and statistical analysis.
Engage in client meetings and maintain strong relationships.
Support business development and project pursuits.
Mentor junior team members, assess their performance, and help shape their career growth.
Join Deloitte’s worldwide community of Transfer Pricing professionals, collaborating on cross-border challenges and innovative solutions.
Have Global Mobility opportunities available at all levels, allowing you to gain international experience and broaden your expertise.
Have the opportunity to spend three months in India, working closely with our Global Transfer Pricing Compliance team and gaining hands-on international experience.
Be part of a practice that is at the forefront of innovation, leveraging cutting-edge technology, including TP solutions GenAI. You’ll have the opportunity to contribute to these advancements and play an active role in shaping what’s next.

Let’s talk about you!

You have a university degree in economics, law, econometrics, mathematics, or physics.
5 to 8 years of experience in consulting or an international business environment.
Eager to learn and grow in the fields of tax or economics.
Strong written, interpersonal, and presentation skills.
A team player who can juggle multiple projects and assignments.
Fluent in English and Dutch or French.

#LI-SB1
Our story
Deloitte Tax lies at the crossroads of tax, law, business and innovation, so it is subject to constant change. We get that. Unlike others, our young and dynamic team of tax and legal specialists thrive on this complexity and see the opportunities. It’s what keeps us sharp. We help our clients connect for impact by anticipating change, unlocking the full potential of their people, extracting strategic insights from data, and creating new value through digital technologies.

To assist our clients in dealing with the intricacies of tax, our Business Tax team proposes the services of a multi-disciplinary team of specialists (lawyers, economists, accountants, IT-specialist, project managers), who are highly experienced. This experience spans assisting companies with corporate tax compliance, dealing with the complexities of local regulations and procedures - such as communicating with local tax authorities, setting up new registrations and filing returns. Our team in Hyderabad consists of professionals dealing with Corporate Income Tax compliance, pan-European Indirect Tax compliance, Statutory Accounting and general Project Management (including Engagement Coordination and Business Development).

Who is Deloitte?
We provide industry-leading audit and assurance, tax and legal, consulting and related services. We are committed to driving innovation across offerings to help our clients address their challenges, while giving our professionals opportunities to learn and grow in this era of transformation.
In Belgium, +5000 dedicated professionals active in +10 offices, take great pride in bringing multidisciplinary expertise to a wide variety of clients, from national and international companies, small, fast-growing and large organizations to public institutions and governmental authorities.
Why Deloitte?
Be the true you! We foster diversity and inclusion and encourage you to bring your authentic self to work. Explore, question and collaborate while building a career that inspires and energises you.
Never stop growing! Diversity of thought makes us stronger. At Deloitte, we tailor a personalized learning experience, offering you the opportunity to grow at your own pace and achieve maximum impact.
We practice what we preach! As a Purpose-led organisation, at the heart of everything we do is a set of timeless principles and unifying values.
Life looks different for each of us, so we created a varied benefits package that you can tap into:
My Benefits My Choice, a flexible rewards plan tailored to your lifestyle and priorities
Sustainable transport options offered by Mobility@Deloitte
Flexible work arrangements for all and initiatives supported by Parents & Caregivers @Deloitte
Wellbeing tips and activities powered by Energise@Deloitte
Topped off with other health benefits and insurance opportunities

Empowering our employees with flexible work arrangements remains essential in today's reality:
Hybrid workplace: combination of home office and on-site (+10 offices in Belgium or client's premises).
Part-time employment: all our jobs are open to full-time or part-time work under a 90% or 80% regime.

Join us to make an impact together! Apply now!

description:
Title: R2843463 R&D Operations Lead

Location: Belgium / Gent

Work Arrangements: Hybrid (3 days on site, 2 days home office)

About the Job

As R&D Operations Lead within our R&D Operations Scientific Services team, you'll help define the future of Scientific Services Delivery Support, explore innovative collaboration tools, optimize equipment fleet management, and shape our Purpose-driven culture.

We're seeking a self-motivated, collaborative change agent with a passion for technology and strong knowledge of scientific equipment fleet management. This highly visible role connects you with stakeholders across R&D, offering opportunities to influence processes and exercise change management strategies.

You'll implement and optimize equipment management processes locally while aligning with global strategies, driving operational excellence, and continuous improvement. Working with the Head of Equipment Fleet Management and Site Leadership, you'll translate global strategies into local actions tailored to site-specific needs.

Main responsibilities

Act as local Single Point of Contact for R&D Operations scientific services;

organize User Board meetings and coordinate action plans

Manage Lab Asset Maintenance Management (LAMM) programs and fleet optimization strategies

Coordinate equipment traceability, utilization monitoring, and periodic inventory control

Develop and report on KPIs for service delivery, financial performance, compliance, and sustainability

Manage strategic vendor partnerships and coordinate metrology/lab emergency response needs

Support business case development, risk assessment, and equipment lifecycle management

 About you

Experience:

3-5 years in laboratory operations or equipment management

Biopharmaceutical R&D experience preferred

Familiarity with lab asset management systems, GxP requirements, and equipment validation

Experience with data analytics and equipment lifecycle management

Skills:

Strong project management, organizational, and change management abilities

Excellent communication and stakeholder management across all levels

Analytical mindset with process improvement experience (Lean, Six Sigma a plus)

Ability to work in a global, matrix organization

undefined

Education: Master's degree in Life Sciences, Engineering, or related field, PM certification a plus

Languages: Dutch & English languages are a must to have, French language is a plus

Why choose us?

Shape the future of scientific services supporting R&D activities

Work at the forefront of drug discovery using AI, data, and digital platforms

Collaborate across science, clinical, and digital fields to drive breakthroughs

Help improve millions of lives globally

Pursue Progress. Discover Extraordinary.

Join Sanofi and step into a new era of science - where your growth can be just as transformative as the work we do. We invest in you to reach further, think faster, and do what’s never-been-done-before. You’ll help push boundaries, challenge convention, and build smarter solutions that reach the communities we serve. Ready to chase the miracles of science and improve people’s lives? Let’s Pursue Progress and Discover Extraordinary – together.

#LI-EUR

#LI-HYBRID

description:
Groupe Atlantic est une entreprise familiale d’origine française, présente dans 70 pays, avec 13 000 collaborateurs et un chiffre d’affaires de 3,2 milliards d’euros.
L’entreprise fabrique tous types de systèmes de chauffage et d’appareils pour le confort domestique. En tant que spécialiste des systèmes de chauffage et des équipements de confort thermique, Groupe Atlantic allie constamment design de pointe, innovation et haute technologie.

Afin de renforcer notre organisation financière en Belgique, nous recherchons un(e) Responsable Comptable et Fiscalité prêt(e) à jouer un rôle clé dans la fiabilité de notre information financière et dans l’accompagnement de la performance de l’entreprise.

Votre mission

En tant que Responsable Comptable et Fiscalité, vous garantissez la fiabilité, la conformité et la transparence des informations comptables, fiscales et financières de la société, dans le respect des obligations légales, fiscales et des procédures du Groupe. Vous êtes un véritable partenaire interne pour les équipes financières et la direction.

Vos responsabilités

Comptabilité & fiscalité

Vous garantissez la tenue complète et correcte de la comptabilité jusqu’à l’établissement des comptes annuels.
Vous supervisez la comptabilité clients : facturation, suivi des encaissements, gestion des litiges et du risque clients.
Vous veillez à la fiabilité des comptes et au respect strict des procédures Groupe.
Vous sécurisez l’ensemble des déclarations fiscales et TVA.
Vous assurez la production des arrêtés comptables trimestriels.
Vous établissez les balances de consolidation dans l’outil Groupe (Oracle / HFM).
Vous coordonnez et animez les relations avec les conseillers externes locaux.

Gestion financière

Vous garantissez une gestion rigoureuse des stocks.
Vous assurez le suivi et l’optimisation de la trésorerie : prévisions, positions quotidiennes et flux financiers.
Vous calculez et documentez les prix de transfert.
Vous produisez les indicateurs de gestion nécessaires à l’activité, en étroite collaboration avec le contrôle de gestion.

Management & coordination

Vous encadrez et développez l’équipe comptable : organisation du travail, priorisation des tâches et suivi de la performance.
Vous accompagnez le développement et la montée en compétences des collaborateurs.

Autres responsabilités

Vous préparez les informations économiques, financières et sociales destinées aux instances représentatives (CE).
Vous assurez le suivi du secrétariat juridique en collaboration avec BDO.
Vous suivez les assurances spécifiques à la Belgique (assurance loi, incendie, etc.) en coordination avec le service assurances du Groupe.
Vous participez aux décisions d’évolution salariale des membres de votre équipe, en concertation avec la hiérarchie et la direction de filiale.
Votre profil – Qui êtes-vous ?

Vous êtes rigoureux(se), fiable et doté(e) d’un excellent sens de l’analyse. Vous disposez de :

Une maîtrise complète de la comptabilité générale jusqu’au bilan et compte de résultats.
De solides connaissances en fiscalité.
Une bonne aisance avec les outils informatiques (la connaissance de SAP est un atout).
Une excellente maîtrise de la suite Microsoft Office.
Une parfaite maîtrise du français et du néerlandais (l’anglais est un plus).
Une expérience confirmée en management d’équipe.
Un sens aigu de l’organisation, des priorités et des délais.
Discrétion, intégrité et respect de la confidentialité.

Que pouvez-vous attendre de nous ?

Nous vous offrons bien plus qu’un poste : un rôle au cœur de l’organisation financière, avec un réel impact.

Un environnement de travail professionnel, stable et stimulant.
Une fonction à responsabilités, avec de l’autonomie.
Une collaboration étroite avec des interlocuteurs internes et externes.
Des opportunités de développement personnel et professionnel au sein d’un Groupe international.
Une culture d’entreprise basée sur la confiance, le respect et la collaboration.
Un package salarial attractif, en lien avec votre expérience et vos compétences.
Un bon équilibre entre vie professionnelle et vie privée.

Votre profil – Qui êtes-vous ?

Vous êtes rigoureux(se), fiable et doté(e) d’un excellent sens de l’analyse. Vous disposez de :

  • Une maîtrise complète de la comptabilité générale jusqu’au bilan et compte de résultats.
  • De solides connaissances en fiscalité.
  • Une bonne aisance avec les outils informatiques (la connaissance de SAP est un atout).
  • Une excellente maîtrise de la suite Microsoft Office.
  • Une parfaite maîtrise du français et du néerlandais (l’anglais est un plus).
  • Une expérience confirmée en management d’équipe.
  • Un sens aigu de l’organisation, des priorités et des délais.
  • Discrétion, intégrité et respect de la confidentialité.

Que pouvez-vous attendre de nous ?

Nous vous offrons bien plus qu’un poste : un rôle au cœur de l’organisation financière, avec un réel impact.

  • Un environnement de travail professionnel, stable et stimulant.
  • Une fonction à responsabilités, avec de l’autonomie.
  • Une collaboration étroite avec des interlocuteurs internes et externes.
  • Des opportunités de développement personnel et professionnel au sein d’un Groupe international.
  • Une culture d’entreprise basée sur la confiance, le respect et la collaboration.
  • Un package salarial attractif, en lien avec votre expérience et vos compétences.
  • Un bon équilibre entre vie professionnelle et vie privée.

description:
Votre mission
Introduction

« Sans nous, faire les courses serait un véritable enfer. »

Bonjour, nous sommes des collaborateurs de chez Lidl, ce magasin où tout le monde fait ses courses au quotidien. Soyons honnêtes, travailler ici n’est pas toujours facile. Cela dit, nous ne changerions de boulot pour rien au monde.

Travailler chez Lidl n’est pas qu’un simple job. Vous pourriez penser le contraire, comme tout le monde. Cela dit, ce sont quand même les collaborateurs eux-mêmes qui vous dévoilent ici la réalité du terrain. Qui de mieux que nous pour vous raconter ce qui vous attend, pas vrai ? Lidl est un endroit où vous bossez dur, certes, mais où vous recevez énormément en retour. Ici, le chiffre d’affaires et les bénéfices ne sont pas les principales préoccupations, ce sont surtout les individus.« Chez Lidl, vous êtes tout sauf un numéro, car tout le monde se connaît et s’entraide. » L’ambiance de travail et l’esprit d’équipe nous motivent chaque jour à aller de l’avant. Ça vaut le coup.

Ta mission

Assistant store manager, vous êtes non seulement le bras droit du store manager, mais aussi celui de toute votre équipe. « Je gère le magasin comme si c’était ma propre affaire. », confie un collègue. Organiser le planning du jour, réassortir les rayons, motiver les troupes… Vous remarquerez très vite qu’aucune journée ne se ressemble.
Contrairement à ce que beaucoup de gens pensent, assurer le bon fonctionnement d’un magasin n’est pas aussi évident qu’il n’y paraît. « Si nous ne faisons pas notre job comme il faut, nos clients le remarquent tout de suite. Sans nous, faire les courses serait un véritable enfer. Voir des clients entrer dans le magasin et ressortir avec le sourire nous procure énormément de satisfaction. »

Ton profil

« Ici, l’égo n’a pas sa place. Nous bossons dur, tous ensemble. »Cela signifie aussi que vous devez être prêt(e) à vous retrousser les manches et faire preuve de persévérance. Donner le meilleur de vous-même pour votre équipe… Voilà en quelques mots votre fonction. Pas mal, hein ?

Notre offre
Un CDI à temps plein 36h/sem, car nous voulons que vous fassiez partie de l’équipe pour un bon bout de temps !
Un salaire mensuel fixe attractif qui en vaut évidemment le coup.
La possibilité d’avoir du temps libre pour vos enfants ou pour vous. Une aubaine pour les nombreux collègues qui aiment être aux petits soins avec leurs proches.
Mais ce n’est pas tout ! En plus de votre salaire brut, vous bénéficiez d’une foule de primes et d’avantages extra-légaux.
Vous avez droit à 20 jours de congés légaux en plus des RTT. Eh oui ! Il n’y a pas que le travail qui compte dans la vie ! Pour couronner le tout, vous bénéficiez de jours de congé d’ancienneté supplémentaires.
Vous recevez notre planning trois semaines à l’avance afin de mieux organiser votre vie privée.
L’occasion de faire la différence auprès d’un détaillant durable. Ça vaut le coup.
La cerise sur le gâteau ? Nous vous proposons de nombreuses formations et la possibilité d’évoluer : Lidl investit dans votre avenir, et ce n’est pas une promesse en l’air ! « Quand j’ai commencé ici, je n’avais jamais imaginé que j’évoluerais vers un poste de responsable, mais Lidl m’en a donné l’occasion. », raconte une collègue.

Nous sommes convaincus que la diversité renforce notre organisation et nous accueillons tout le monde. Indépendamment de l'âge, de l'origine, de l'identité de genre, de l'orientation sexuelle, de la religion ou du handicap. L'égalité des chances et une rémunération équitable sont au cœur de nos préoccupations.

Nous vous proposons de nombreuses formations et la possibilité d’évoluer : Lidl investit dans votre avenir, et ce n’est pas une promesse en l’air ! « Quand j’ai commencé ici, je n’avais jamais imaginé que j’évoluerais vers un poste de responsable, mais Lidl m’en a donné l’occasion. », raconte une collègue.


Nous sommes convaincus que la diversité renforce notre organisation et nous accueillons tout le monde. Indépendamment de l'âge, de l'origine, de l'identité de genre, de l'orientation sexuelle, de la religion ou du handicap. L'égalité des chances et une rémunération équitable sont au cœur de nos préoccupations.

description:
What will you do?

As a Hard Facilities Manager, you are part of the CoC FM Building (Center of Competence) team. As a center of competence, we support the operational teams of Facility Services who maintain and keep more than 800 bpost buildings fully operational. In addition, through service contracts, we provide a framework in which external parties, responsible for both technical services and reception services, can deliver the expected level of service. As a CoC, we also serve as the point of contact for operational compliance and guide transformation processes within our department.

We also ensure that the efficiency and effectiveness of operational processes are visible through performance indicators and data analyses. In other words, we dive into operational data to provide insights into current performance and implement optimization proposals for the future.

Ensure the proper functioning of technical facilities: electrical systems, HVAC (heating, ventilation, air conditioning), lighting, plumbing, doors/gates, infrastructure, and regulatory compliance.
Define the overall vision for technical maintenance and the building roadmap, including associated technical specifications.
Guarantee compliance, quality, and continuous improvement of technical facilities.
Act as the owner of Hard Facilities contracts and ensure their operational deployment.
Lead tenders, public procurement, and technical contracts in collaboration with the purchasing department.
Monitor and evaluate the performance of external service providers, manage communications, escalations, and contract adjustments, and maintain long-term partnerships.
Provide technical support to local teams (building experts, team leaders).
Contribute to the drafting of technical specifications and the structuring of technical projects.
Participate in and contribute to major technical programs (e.g., HVAC programs, lighting upgrade projects, electrical compliance).
Analyze and report Hard Facilities data to identify opportunities for improvement.
Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) and budgets, and ensure cost control.
Manage at least one technical profile in a direct reporting line (e.g., Electrical Compliance Project Manager).
Work closely with Facility Services teams and internal and external stakeholders.

Who are you?

· Higher technical education or engineering degree (industrial, electromechanical, electrical engineering, or equivalent), or equivalent experience in building management.

· Strong expertise in building technical systems, with a solid background in electrical systems and good knowledge of HVAC.

· Proven experience in a complex, multi-site environment or within a large organization.

· Ability to work autonomously in a structured, results-oriented manner.

· Experience in project management and working within a contractual environment.

· Excellent communication, stakeholder coordination, and leadership skills, with a manager/support mindset.

· Ability to structure complex technical topics and proactively find solutions.

· Proficiency in French and Dutch.

· Flexibility, proactivity, and motivation to work in a transforming environment.

· Technical certifications (BA4/BA5), VCA are an asset.

What do we offer?

Like a long-awaited parcel, we want to make you feel welcome and valued. Our offer includes a competitive monthly salary, that goes without saying. On top of that, you can count on:

Meal vouchers of €8 per working day
Hospitalization-, group- and disability insurances
A phone subscription, including 25GB data
A flexible renumeration plan, which allows you to customize your own benefits. A company car, bike leasing, public transportation, extra days off,... the choice is yours
Possibility to enter the Federal Mobility plan
Work/life balance, thanks to flexible working hours and the possibility to work from home
20 days of statutory leave and 7 additional extralegal days off
An end-of-year and performance-based bonus and double holiday pay
Many benefits from more than 100 bpost-partners
#bpost #bnode #LI-BP6
Back to job list

description:
General InformationCompany
Deloitte
Business Unit
Technology & Transformation
Primary Location
Zaventem
Field of interest
Technology
Industry Focus
Industry Agnostic
Recruiter
Barreal, Renee - mbarrealzapata@deloitte.com
Description of the positionCan’t wait to make an impact on the world? You’re not alone. Join us in driving progress in the working world and beyond.
Your journey with us
Our Consulting practice within Deloitte has a strong reputation and track record as Business Performance Consultants. We are a recognized leader in helping clients solve complex business problems, differentiated by our ability to execute on the advice we provide. Our multi-disciplinary competencies allow us to address CXO issues from every angle.
As a Senior Manager, you are part of a team of highly experienced consultants in the SAP Digital Transformation team delivering business transformation programs and specialized in the Sales and Distribution, BRIM or Service domains.
You advise and participate in the implementation of SAP solutions using a multidisciplinary approach to design, implement and integrate SAP S/4HANA Sales. Tasks include solution design, solution implementation, change management and end-user support & training.
In your role, you create and articulate a compelling vision and goals for multiple teams and help people at all levels to understand the impact of their contributions. You build broad networks and deep professional relationships, which span across businesses and borders, and include a diverse range of internal and external stakeholders. You lead and/or contribute to development of innovative methods and tools that increase the quality and impact of Deloitte’s service offerings. You participate to conversations with client CXOs and/or sub C-suite executives on their strategic agenda to deliver latest business specific SAP modules that creates a high impact in alignment with client's business strategy.
You will contribute to the development and growth of the SAP SD practice globally by coaching and empowering team members to grow to their full potential and ensures they have access to the right resources, within and across businesses and borders.
You will be joining an integrated offering of SD functional consultants and architects that are providing services to leading firms in different industries.
You will have the opportunity to build a strong local and across boarders’ network, build your reputation and become the clients go-to-contact for your recommendations on latest and/or innovative SAP solutions in rigorous, fact-based analysis, supported by deep expertise.
Deloitte is dedicated to the well-being of its employees, reason why, already at your first interview and during your whole career, you will be encouraged to share your personal needs in terms of flexibility and work-life balance.

Let's talk about you

To be part of our team as a Senior Manager, you must

Have at least 8 years of relevant experience within S/4HANA Sales implementation in consulting firm or similar experience

Have experience in leading the SAP transformation plan integrated with all relevant & applicable business processes/functions and advises on cost-benefit/prioritization of various product packages that are most relevant to the client and best address their agenda

Have experience in managing medium/large-sized teams

Be fluent in Dutch and/or French with very good level of English

Have a EU citizenship with valid driving license in Belgium

In order to excel at your job, you will develop the following skills and having previous experience is considered a plus

S/4HANA Sales Certification

Experience in building, mentoring and coaching a team of talents from different horizons and levels of knowledge

Specific business sector knowledge

Experience in multinational environment

Good knowledge on emerging technologies, updates, standards and applications

Experience in collaborating with near-shore/off-shore capabilities

Our story
Enterprise Performance is about achieving maximum impact and value from investments in finance, supply chain, and IT operations requires a holistic view of key business functions from strategy through process design and technology enablement

With decades of SAP experience, we help clients in transforming their organization and take it to new levels of performance with a suite of solutions centred on the leading-edge SAP S/4 HANA platform, in areas such as enterprise transformation, finance and supply chain, incorporating advanced technology applications such as artificial intelligence, blockchain, and IoT

Who is Deloitte?
We provide industry-leading audit and assurance, tax and legal, consulting and related services. We are committed to driving innovation across offerings to help our clients address their challenges, while giving our professionals opportunities to learn and grow in this era of transformation.
In Belgium, +5000 dedicated professionals active in +10 offices, take great pride in bringing multidisciplinary expertise to a wide variety of clients, from national and international companies, small, fast-growing and large organizations to public institutions and governmental authorities.
Why Deloitte?
Be the true you! We foster diversity and inclusion and encourage you to bring your authentic self to work. Explore, question and collaborate while building a career that inspires and energises you.
Never stop growing!Diversity of thought makes us stronger. At Deloitte, we tailor a personalized learning experience, offering you the opportunity to grow at your own pace and achieve maximum impact.
We practice what we preach! As a Purpose-led organisation, at the heart of everything we do is a set of timeless principles and unifying values.
Life looks different for each of us, so we created a varied benefits package that you can tap into:
My Benefits My Choice, a flexible rewards plan tailored to your lifestyle and priorities
Sustainable transport options offered by Mobility@Deloitte
Flexible work arrangements for all and initiatives supported by Parents@Deloitte
Wellbeing tips and activities powered by Energise@Deloitte
Topped off with other health benefits and insurance opportunities

Empowering our employees with flexible work arrangementsremains essential in today's reality:
Hybrid workplace:combination of home office and on-site (+10 offices in Belgium or client's premises).
Part-time employment: all our jobs are open to part-time work under a 90% or 80% regime.

Join us to make an impact together! Apply now!

description:
General InformationCompany
Deloitte
Business Unit
Technology & Transformation
Primary Location
Zaventem
Field of interest
Finance & Risk
Industry Focus
Industry Agnostic
Recruiter
Vromman, Freya - fvromman@deloitte.com
Description of the positionCan’t wait to make an impact on the world? You’re not alone. Join us in driving progress in the working world and beyond.
Your journey with us

Within the Operational Transformation team of Deloitte in Zaventem we are currently looking for a Senior Manager Internal Audit to further develop our Internal audit practice with a focus on risk and technology in the private sector.

We need you in our business as a leader…

Lead business development, focusing on technology-enabled (risk) controls, and identify new business opportunities
Evaluate and execute go-to-market strategies and network
Act as a go-to leader for clients and teams on industry practices and regulatory requirements in internal audit, process, and control design
Build and guide your internal team with business insights during operational reviews/internal audits, and lead internal audit, internal control assignments, and process/control optimization projects to enhance client efficiency and effectiveness

What do we expect from you (Skills)?

Use strong commercial skills to drive business growth, expand market opportunities, and make business development decisions
Present/report insights, audit results, or action plans to stakeholders, including C-level management and Audit Committees
Drive the use of technology and data analytics within Deloitte’s Internal Audit activities, and manage the team, including serving as a career counsellor and handling people management decisions

Let’s talk about you:

Master’s degree in economics, engineering, or equivalent qualification; Certified Internal Audit (CIA) is a plus
10+ years of experience and a strong network in internal audit, risk management, internal control transformation, or business process optimization
Affinity for and willingness to explore IT tools
Go-to leader for clients and teams on process/control design issues based on industry practices and regulations
Team-minded, client and result-oriented with excellent social, communication, and presentation skills
Fluent in Dutch and English
Critical and analytical mindset, eager to learn new business insights and explore different company cultures
Who is Deloitte?
We provide industry-leading audit and assurance, tax and legal, consulting and related services. We are committed to driving innovation across offerings to help our clients address their challenges, while giving our professionals opportunities to learn and grow in this era of transformation.
In Belgium, +5000 dedicated professionals active in +10 offices, take great pride in bringing multidisciplinary expertise to a wide variety of clients, from national and international companies, small, fast-growing and large organizations to public institutions and governmental authorities.

Vromman, Freya - fvromman@deloitte.com

Description of the position

Can’t wait to make an impact on the world? You’re not alone. Join us in driving progress in the working world and beyond.
Your journey with us

Within the Operational Transformation team of Deloitte in Zaventem we are currently looking for a Senior Manager Internal Audit to further develop our Internal audit practice with a focus on risk and technology in the private sector.

We need you in our business as a leader…

  • Lead business development, focusing on technology-enabled (risk) controls, and identify new business opportunities
  • Evaluate and execute go-to-market strategies and network
  • Act as a go-to leader for clients and teams on industry practices and regulatory requirements in internal audit, process, and control design
  • Build and guide your internal team with business insights during operational reviews/internal audits, and lead internal audit, internal control assignments, and process/control optimization projects to enhance client efficiency and effectiveness

What do we expect from you (Skills)?

  • Use strong commercial skills to drive business growth, expand market opportunities, and make business development decisions
  • Present/report insights, audit results, or action plans to stakeholders, including C-level management and Audit Committees
  • Drive the use of technology and data analytics within Deloitte’s Internal Audit activities, and manage the team, including serving as a career counsellor and handling people management decisions

Let’s talk about you:

  • Master’s degree in economics, engineering, or equivalent qualification; Certified Internal Audit (CIA) is a plus
  • 10+ years of experience and a strong network in internal audit, risk management, internal control transformation, or business process optimization
  • Affinity for and willingness to explore IT tools
  • Go-to leader for clients and teams on process/control design issues based on industry practices and regulations
  • Team-minded, client and result-oriented with excellent social, communication, and presentation skills
  • Fluent in Dutch and English
  • Critical and analytical mindset, eager to learn new business insights and explore different company cultures

Who is Deloitte?
We provide industry-leading audit and assurance, tax and legal, consulting and related services. We are committed to driving innovation across offerings to help our clients address their challenges, while giving our professionals opportunities to learn and grow in this era of transformation.

Houimli, Leila - lhouimli@deloitte.com
Description of the positionCan’t wait to make an impact on the world?
You’re not alone. Join us in driving progress in the working world and beyond.

What's in it for you:
Join a Center of Excellence leading SAP EWM innovation since its inception. You'll drive transformational warehouse redesigns for Europe's leading enterprises while developing into a recognized industry authority.

High-impact work – Lead warehouse transformations for major enterprises; your solutions directly shape competitive advantage
Deep domain expertise – Access decades of collective EWM knowledge rarely available in the market; become a recognized authority in your field
Multidisciplinary collaboration – Work with change management, automation, and design specialists to deliver comprehensive solutions beyond EWM implementation
Innovation at the frontier – Contribute to cutting-edge work in intelligent automation, advanced analytics, and next-generation technologies that define industry standards
Exceptional team culture – Join highly skilled consultants passionate about excellence, innovation, and continuous learning in a collaborative, supportive environment
Accelerated career growth – Benefit from mentorship by thought leaders, exposure to transformational projects, clear pathways to manager level, and investment in advanced

Your journey with us

We are seeking an experienced Senior Consultant specializing in SAP Extended Warehouse Management (EWM) to join our EWM Center of Excellence and become a trusted advisor to our industry-leading clients undergoing major transformational supply chain modernization across the globe and in Belgium. In this client-facing role, you will lead complex SAP EWM transformations by designing, implementing and optimizing intelligent warehouse solutions that that drive operational excellence and competitive advantage. This is a high-impact consulting position that combines strategic thinking, deep technical expertise, and change leadership. You will work on critical engagements across diverse industries and geographies, partnering with cross-functional teams to deliver transformational supply chain solutions that reshape how leading enterprises manage their warehouse operations

Identify and compare the global requirements versus the local requirements and advise on appropriate design and organizational changes to be made.
To participate in/or facilitate business process definition and modelling, check the feasibility of this business model against the capabilities of the used packages and configuration of the software to replicate the required business processes and analytical/reporting needs.
project management, business process analysis, defining to-be processes, tool selection, change management, implementation support & training.
Specifically you will be responsible for delivering Warehouse Management (EWM) solutions.
To participate in the implementation of SCM solutions at the client.
Let's talk about you
Minimum 5-7 years of hands-on project experience leading multiple complex, multi-phases SAP EWM implementations
Deep knowledge of Warehouse management processes including:
 - Inbound/outbound logistics
 - Inventory management and optimization
 - Picking, Packing and shipping operations
 - Goods receipt and putaway strategies
 - Returns and quality management
Strong understanding of supply chain management processes and how warehouse operations integrate with broad SCM functions (demand planning, procurement, production, distribution)
SAP EWM Certification
Proven ability to translate business requirements into system configurations and process designs
Experience leading or supporting multiple phases of implementation projects
University degree in Supply Chain, Logistics, Computer Science, Business Administration, Engineering or related field.
Fluent in English, Dutch and/or French is an asset
Comfortable collaborating in international settings and traveling to clients when needed (around 20% of the time)

Our story
Enterprise Performance is about achieving maximum impact and value from investments in finance, supply chain, and IT operations requires a holistic view of key business functions from strategy through process design and technology enablement

With decades of SAP experience, we help clients in transforming their organization and take it to new levels of performance with a suite of solutions centred on the leading-edge SAP S/4 HANA platform, in areas such as enterprise transformation, finance and supply chain, incorporating advanced technology applications such as artificial intelligence, blockchain, and IoT

Who is Deloitte?
We provide industry-leading audit and assurance, tax and legal, consulting and related services. We are committed to driving innovation across offerings to help our clients address their challenges, while giving our professionals opportunities to learn and grow in this era of transformation.
In Belgium, +5000 dedicated professionals active in +10 offices, take great pride in bringing multidisciplinary expertise to a wide variety of clients, from national and international companies, small, fast-growing and large organizations to public institutions and governmental authorities.
Why Deloitte?
Be the true you! We foster diversity and inclusion and encourage you to bring your authentic self to work. Explore, question and collaborate while building a career that inspires and energises you.
Never stop growing! Diversity of thought makes us stronger. At Deloitte, we tailor a personalized learning experience, offering you the opportunity to grow at your own pace and achieve maximum impact.
We practice what we preach! As a Purpose-led organisation, at the heart of everything we do is a set of timeless principles and unifying values.
Life looks different for each of us, so we created a varied benefits package that you can tap into:
My Benefits My Choice, a flexible rewards plan tailored to your lifestyle and priorities
Sustainable transport options offered by Mobility@Deloitte
Flexible work arrangements for all and initiatives supported by Parents & Caregivers @Deloitte
Wellbeing tips and activities powered by Energise@Deloitte
Topped off with other health benefits and insurance opportunities

Empowering our employees with flexible work arrangements remains essential in today's reality:
Hybrid workplace: combination of home office and on-site (+10 offices in Belgium or client's premises).
Part-time employment: all our jobs are open to full-time or part-time work under a 90% or 80% regime.

description:
General InformationCompany
Deloitte
Business Unit
Strategy, Risk & Transactions Advisory
Primary Location
Zaventem
Field of interest
Finance & Risk
Industry Focus
Industry Agnostic
Recruiter
Labbe, Sidonie - slabbe@deloitte.com
Description of the positionCan’t wait to make an impact on the world? You’re not alone. Join us in driving progress in the working world and beyond.

Do you want to combine a business mindset with financials skills? Do you want to work in a highly dynamic M&A environment? Do you want support companies in their goal to create value through M&A? You’re not alone. Join us in the M&A Strategy team.
Your journey with us
Deloitte has been involved in most of the key Mergers & Acquisitions transactions in Belgium in recent years, assisting both private equity and corporate investors in making well-founded investment decisions.

In order to support companies, the M&A Strategy team provides quantitative and qualitative insights on business operations which link directly to transaction financials in multiple areas, from pre- or post- deal optimization opportunities, synergy gains, streamlined business plans with insights on growth potential, to understanding how a business will operate outside of the group after separation.

Our team works side by side with the Transactions Services team in order to help investors make well-informed decisions based on the full financial and operational potential of their target.

As a Manager in M&A Strategy, you - together with your team - will support our clients in their M&A endeavors. You advise medium to large corporations and investors at C-Level with the development and implementation of their growth or value creation strategy. You will make sure that you keep a holistic view on the end goal and cooperate together with the client to define where deal value can be created.

You will work on topics such as: financial and operational due diligence, synergy and business plan reviews ; carve-outs and post-merger integrations ; cost reduction and performance improvement programs.

What will you do:
Although each client and each engagement will be unique, your activities will entail the following:
Steering discussions and interviews with management, and collaborating with industry experts to gain deeper insights to support clients;
Deep-diving on complex financial, operational and market data in order to come to key conclusions which can be presented to the client in a simple way;
Manage a team to make use of data and diagnostics to build (financial) factbooks to facilitate meaningful and fact driven discussions;
Keeping a holistic view on the deliverables and how a story line should be communicated in a visual and straightforward way towards stakeholders;
Managing and coordinating project’s deliverable towards a client;
Proactively build client relationships, spotting business opportunities and engaging with the client with the support of the team;
Building and shaping the M&A Strategy team by developing new service offerings, coaching and recruiting team members and collaborating with (international) service lines leaders.

Let's talk about you
MBA or a Master's degree in business, economics or finance;
Minimum 6 years of experience within financial/strategy consulting, performance improvement/cost reduction or corporate finance management within a consulting company or in the industry;
Experience in M&A strategy design, or working on post-merger integration;
Proven record of team and project management; and aspiration to be part of and proactively develop a growing team aiming for excellence;
Highly developed financial and business as well as commercial skills;
Ability to manage and communicate clearly to multiple stakeholders;
Fluent in English and Dutch or French.

Our story
Our Strategy & Transactions offering portfolio combines the following teams: Strategy & Business Design, Infrastructure & Real Estate, Sustainability and M&A Valuation & Business Modelling.

This is your opportunity to join our Deloitte M&A team. We are the global leader in integrated M&A Services. By cooperation between various specialists in M&A, Deloitte provides integrated solutions for every transaction process. We define and execute growth strategies for our clients and guide them through every stage of a transaction, so they achieve their aspirations.

Who is Deloitte?
We provide industry-leading audit and assurance, tax and legal, consulting and related services. We are committed to driving innovation across offerings to help our clients address their challenges, while giving our professionals opportunities to learn and grow in this era of transformation.
In Belgium, +5000 dedicated professionals active in +10 offices, take great pride in bringing multidisciplinary expertise to a wide variety of clients, from national and international companies, small, fast-growing and large organizations to public institutions and governmental authorities.
Why Deloitte?
Be the true you! We foster diversity and inclusion and encourage you to bring your authentic self to work. Explore, question and collaborate while building a career that inspires and energises you.
Never stop growing! Diversity of thought makes us stronger. At Deloitte, we tailor a personalized learning experience, offering you the opportunity to grow at your own pace and achieve maximum impact.
We practice what we preach! As a Purpose-led organisation, at the heart of everything we do is a set of timeless principles and unifying values.
Life looks different for each of us, so we created a varied benefits package that you can tap into:
My Benefits My Choice, a flexible rewards plan tailored to your lifestyle and priorities
Sustainable transport options offered by Mobility@Deloitte
Flexible work arrangements for all and initiatives supported by Parents & Caregivers @Deloitte
Wellbeing tips and activities powered by Energise@Deloitte
Topped off with other health benefits and insurance opportunities

Empowering our employees with flexible work arrangements remains essential in today's reality:
Hybrid workplace: combination of home office and on-site (+10 offices in Belgium or client's premises).
Part-time employment: all our jobs are open to full-time or part-time work under a 90% or 80% regime.

Join us to make an impact together! Apply now!

description:
General InformationCompany
Deloitte
Business Unit
Tax & Legal
Primary Location
Zaventem
Field of interest
Audit, Accounting & Controlling
Industry Focus
Industry Agnostic
Recruiter
van Oost, Alexandra - avanoost@deloitte.com
Description of the positionCan’t wait to make an impact on the world? You’re not alone. Join us in driving progress in the working world and beyond.

Our International Accounting & Corporate Income Tax Services (IACTS) team is the recognized Center of Excellence for pan-European statutory accounting compliance and corporate tax work. The team is part of the Global Tax Centre Europe and assists businesses in navigating complex financial and tax challenges across more than 30 countries, ensuring full compliance with local and international regulations. Our experts provide tailored solutions, to deliver efficient, accurate and strategic financial reporting and taxation support.

Your journey with us

As Assistant Manager your daily work will include:

• Working on challenging, evolving and varied international clients

• Manage your own client portfolio aiming for very high client satisfaction

• Participate to corporate tax compliance production cycle and oversight for various jurisdictions (tax computations, reconciliations , group tax provisioning, obligations monitoring etc.)

• Organize PMO (Project Management Officer) support needed to deliver international client engagements specializing on corporate tax deliverables and tasks.

• Interacting with other Deloitte teams in Belgium and abroad on tax technical, compliance and status reporting matters

• Build a strong knowledge of tax compliance and statutory accounting processes in an international context;

• Coaching, mentoring and developing senior & junior team members

• Supporting go-to-markets activities

Let’s talk about you

You have a Master/Bachelor’s degree in taxes or accounting or equivalent practical experience
Experience in international tax, tax provisioning and/or statutory accounting compliance are an asset
You have in-depth Excel skills and are technology minded (ERPs, Tax provisioning tools OTP etc.)
You have a proven record for service excellence, are deadline focused and a team player
You have excellent communication skills and are committed to efficient and effective performance.
You have excellent technical and analytical skills
You can think critically and provide practical solutions

If you believe that you have the ability and experience to make an immediate contribution, are committed to efficient and effective performance and have the motivation to seize opportunities as they are presented, then please apply online to join our team.

Our story
Business Process Solutions is so much more than hard numbers. Think analysis, critical insights, problem-solving and strategic planning. The magic happens when analysis and insight meld. It’s what turns our professionals into trusted advisors who use regulatory compliance and reporting to create opportunities and manage risk for our clients. At Deloitte, we advise a wide range of companies across multidisciplinary services ranging from accounting, tax, legal, HR, mergers and acquisitions to services such as “business control & technology” and “strategy & growth” tailor-made solutions. At the same time, our team of advisors handles cases with a satellite vision, enthusiasm and know-how.
As a member of this dynamic team of professionals, you are in regular contact with business leaders and their teams. You have a great deal of autonomy and responsibilities as well as the possibility of building different relationships of trust, during long-term collaboration. In this way, you become the client’s point of contact for advice on all kinds of financial and economic matters, working with a multidisciplinary team of colleagues.

Who is Deloitte?
We provide industry-leading audit and assurance, tax and legal, consulting and related services. We are committed to driving innovation across offerings to help our clients address their challenges, while giving our professionals opportunities to learn and grow in this era of transformation.
In Belgium, +5000 dedicated professionals active in +10 offices, take great pride in bringing multidisciplinary expertise to a wide variety of clients, from national and international companies, small, fast-growing and large organizations to public institutions and governmental authorities.
Why Deloitte?
Be the true you! We foster diversity and inclusion and encourage you to bring your authentic self to work. Explore, question and collaborate while building a career that inspires and energises you.
Never stop growing! Diversity of thought makes us stronger. At Deloitte, we tailor a personalized learning experience, offering you the opportunity to grow at your own pace and achieve maximum impact.
We practice what we preach! As a Purpose-led organisation, at the heart of everything we do is a set of timeless principles and unifying values.
Life looks different for each of us, so we created a varied benefits package that you can tap into:
My Benefits My Choice, a flexible rewards plan tailored to your lifestyle and priorities
Sustainable transport options offered by Mobility@Deloitte
Flexible work arrangements for all and initiatives supported by Parents & Caregivers @Deloitte
Wellbeing tips and activities powered by Energise@Deloitte
Topped off with other health benefits and insurance opportunities

  • Organize PMO (Project Management Officer) support needed to deliver international client engagements specializing on corporate tax deliverables and tasks.
  • Interacting with other Deloitte teams in Belgium and abroad on tax technical, compliance and status reporting matters
  • Build a strong knowledge of tax compliance and statutory accounting processes in an international context;
  • Coaching, mentoring and developing senior & junior team members
  • Supporting go-to-markets activities


Let’s talk about you

  • You have a Master/Bachelor’s degree in taxes or accounting or equivalent practical experience
  • Experience in international tax, tax provisioning and/or statutory accounting compliance are an asset
  • You have in-depth Excel skills and are technology minded (ERPs, Tax provisioning tools OTP etc.)
  • You have a proven record for service excellence, are deadline focused and a team player
  • You have excellent communication skills and are committed to efficient and effective performance.
  • You have excellent technical and analytical skills
  • You can think critically and provide practical solutions

If you believe that you have the ability and experience to make an immediate contribution, are committed to efficient and effective performance and have the motivation to seize opportunities as they are presented, then please apply online to join our team.

Our story

Business Process Solutions is so much more than hard numbers. Think analysis, critical insights, problem-solving and strategic planning. The magic happens when analysis and insight meld. It’s what turns our professionals into trusted advisors who use regulatory compliance and reporting to create opportunities and manage risk for our clients. At Deloitte, we advise a wide range of companies across multidisciplinary services ranging from accounting, tax, legal, HR, mergers and acquisitions to services such as “business control & technology” and “strategy & growth” tailor-made solutions. At the same time, our team of advisors handles cases with a satellite vision, enthusiasm and know-how.

As a member of this dynamic team of professionals, you are in regular contact with business leaders and their teams. You have a great deal of autonomy and responsibilities as well as the possibility of building different relationships of trust, during long-term collaboration. In this way, you become the client’s point of contact for advice on all kinds of financial and economic matters, working with a multidisciplinary team of colleagues.

Who is Deloitte?
We provide industry-leading audit and assurance, tax and legal, consulting and related services. We are committed to driving innovation across offerings to help our clients address their challenges, while giving our professionals opportunities to learn and grow in this era of transformation.
In Belgium, +5000 dedicated professionals active in +10 offices, take great pride in bringing multidisciplinary expertise to a wide variety of clients, from national and international companies, small, fast-growing and large organizations to public institutions and governmental authorities.
Why Deloitte?
Be the true you! We foster diversity and inclusion and encourage you to bring your authentic self to work. Explore, question and collaborate while building a career that inspires and energises you.
Never stop growing! Diversity of thought makes us stronger. At Deloitte, we tailor a personalized learning experience, offering you the opportunity to grow at your own pace and achieve maximum impact.
We practice what we preach! As a Purpose-led organisation, at the heart of everything we do is a set of timeless principles and unifying values.
Life looks different for each of us, so we created a varied benefits package that you can tap into:
  • My Benefits My Choice, a flexible rewards plan tailored to your lifestyle and priorities
  • Sustainable transport options offered by Mobility@Deloitte
  • Flexible work arrangements for all and initiatives supported by Parents & Caregivers @Deloitte
  • Wellbeing tips and activities powered by Energise@Deloitte
  • Topped off with other health benefits and insurance opportunities

Empowering our employees with flexible work arrangements remains essential in today's reality:
  • Hybrid workplace: combination of home office and on-site (+10 offices in Belgium or client's premises).
  • Part-time employment: all our jobs are open to full-time or part-time work under a 90% or 80% regime.

Join us to make an impact together! Apply now!
