Recruiter
Ben Taher, Souhailla - sbentaher@deloitte.com
Description of the positionAs a member of the Global Trade Advisory team, the Export Control and Sanctions Manager provides expert guidance to clients on managing and mitigating risks related to international trade. This includes monitoring, analyzing, and implementing policies and procedures to ensure compliance with export control laws and sanction regulations. The role requires close collaboration with clients to strengthen their compliance programs, covering areas such as product classification, license determination strategies, screening against sanctioned party lists and embargoes, and conducting transactional due diligence

Key Responsibilities:
Develop, implement, and maintain export control and sanctions compliance programmes.
Monitor and interpret relevant export control laws, regulations, and sanctions, including those from the EU, US, and other relevant jurisdictions.
Conduct risk assessments and audits to identify potential compliance issues and recommend corrective actions.
Provide guidance and training on export control and sanctions regulations.
Perform transactional due diligence and screening assignments.
Liaise with government agencies and regulatory bodies as necessary.
Collaborate with other departments and stakeholders to build a network to enhance comprehensive compliance business models.
Stay up-to-date with changes in export control and sanctions regulations and update company policies accordingly.
You will be involved in coaching and supervising junior team members, playing an important role in the further development of the practice.

Let's talk about you:
Do you have a degree in International Trade, Law, Business, or a related field.
Minimum of 5 years of experience in export control, sanctions compliance, or a related area.
In-depth knowledge of regional and national export control laws and sanctions regulations (e.g., Belgian arms trade law, EU dual use and military, EAR, ITAR, OFAC).
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Fluent in English, Dutch and/or French
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
Ability to work independently and as part of a team
Attention to detail and strong organizational skills

With Indirect Tax becoming many governments' preferred method of revenue raising, and evermore-complicated regulations focused on combatting fraud, it is more critical than ever to manage indirect tax compliance and cash flows. Our Belgium Indirect Tax Practice has over 90 indirect tax experts who are well informed and understand the nuances of regulations, the importance of deep industry knowledge and the growing role of technology experience.

Who is Deloitte?
We provide industry-leading audit and assurance, tax and legal, consulting and related services. We are committed to driving innovation across offerings to help our clients address their challenges, while giving our professionals opportunities to learn and grow in this era of transformation.
In Belgium, +5000 dedicated professionals active in +10 offices, take great pride in bringing multidisciplinary expertise to a wide variety of clients, from national and international companies, small, fast-growing and large organizations to public institutions and governmental authorities.
Why Deloitte?
Be the true you! We foster diversity and inclusion and encourage you to bring your authentic self to work. Explore, question and collaborate while building a career that inspires and energises you.
Never stop growing!Diversity of thought makes us stronger. At Deloitte, we tailor a personalized learning experience, offering you the opportunity to grow at your own pace and achieve maximum impact.
We practice what we preach! As a Purpose-led organisation, at the heart of everything we do is a set of timeless principles and unifying values.
Life looks different for each of us, so we created a varied benefits package that you can tap into:
My Benefits My Choice, a flexible rewards plan tailored to your lifestyle and priorities

Ben Taher, Souhailla - sbentaher@deloitte.com
Description of the positionAs an E-Invoicing Manager, you will be the primary advisor to clients on all aspects of e-invoicing, e-reporting, and VAT obligations, both in Belgium and internationally. You will play a key role in building strong client relationships, ensuring high-quality service delivery, and leading a team of professionals.

Act as the primary advisor to clients on all aspects and ensuring they remain compliant with evolving VAT, e-invoicing, and e-reporting regulations.
Overseeing service delivery in line with Deloitte’s high-quality standards and ensuring an exceptional client experience.
Assist and advise clients on e-invoicing regulations, digital reporting frameworks, and VAT compliance strategies, analyzing VAT processes, assessing risks, and providing practical solutions to enhance compliance and efficiency.
Collaborate with colleagues across Tax, Legal, and Technology teams to provide a holistic approach to VAT, e-invoicing, and e-reporting obligations.
Stay up to date with legislative changes in e-invoicing, and e-reporting, translating developments into actionable insights for clients. Contribute to thought leadership by sharing knowledge on best practices and regulatory trends.
Mentor and support professionals, guiding team members in strengthening their expertise and playing a key role in their professional development.
Engage in business development by identifying new opportunities, expanding client relationships, and recommending tailored solutions
This role offers the opportunity to lead and shape VAT advisory services while working in a dynamic, collaborative, and innovative environment.

Let's Talk About You:
You have an university degree in a relevant field such as business economics, law, accounting, or tax. A specialisation in indirect tax and/or technology affiliation is a plus.
5–8 years of relevant experience in indirect tax compliance, e-invoicing, e-reporting, or indirect tax advisory.
Strong knowledge of VAT legislation and reporting obligations at both national and EU levels.
Excellent communication skills and the ability to build strong relationships with clients.
Fluency in English and Dutch or French.
Experience with delivering e-invoicing projects is an asset.
A recognised tax consultant qualification (ITAA) is a plus.
If you're eager to help businesses navigate the challenges of indirect tax and digital compliance, we’d love to hear from you!

Our story
Deloitte Tax lies at the crossroads of tax, law, business and innovation, so it is subject to constant change. We get that. Unlike others, our young and dynamic team of tax and legal specialists thrive on this complexity and see the opportunities. It’s what keeps us sharp. We help our clients connect for impact by anticipating change, unlocking the full potential of their people, extracting strategic insights from data, and creating new value through digital technologies.

With Indirect Tax becoming many governments' preferred method of revenue raising, and evermore-complicated regulations focused on combatting fraud, it is more critical than ever to manage indirect tax compliance and cash flows. Our Belgium Indirect Tax Practice has over 90 indirect tax experts who are well informed and understand the nuances of regulations, the importance of deep industry knowledge and the growing role of technology experience.

Who is Deloitte?
We provide industry-leading audit and assurance, tax and legal, consulting and related services. We are committed to driving innovation across offerings to help our clients address their challenges, while giving our professionals opportunities to learn and grow in this era of transformation.
In Belgium, +5000 dedicated professionals active in +10 offices, take great pride in bringing multidisciplinary expertise to a wide variety of clients, from national and international companies, small, fast-growing and large organizations to public institutions and governmental authorities.

Vromman, Freya - fvromman@deloitte.com
Description of the positionCan’t wait to make an impact on the world? You’re not alone. Join us in driving progress in the working world and beyond.
Your journey with us:
As part of our growth and ambitious vision, we are seeking a dynamic and experienced Manager to join our Finance Transformation team. Your primary focus will be on delivering advisory services aimed at optimizing financial processes to accelerate and enhance the production of financial insights. These insights empower CFOs and business leaders to make informed decisions aligned with their strategic objectives.

Your Role:
Act as a trusted advisor, ensuring finance functions operate efficiently. Build and expand client relationships while driving new business through collaboration.
On the Client Side:
Lead and coordinate projects, including responding to tenders and managing delivery, while redesigning clients’ financial organizations to regain control over operational financial processes.
Advise and bring innovative solutions to the CFOs and Finance departments on every issue they might face including data modeling, financial processes improvement, financial close and consolidation, efficiency gains, planning, budgeting and forecasting, etc.
Enhance management reporting by improving processes, people, and technology.
Within the Team:
Facilitate collaboration & motivation to manage projects, meet deadlines.
Coach and develop team members by transparent feed-back & improvement points.
Contribute to management meetings, generate initiative for business development in the French-speaking market.
Deliver exceptional service, foster collaboration, develop teams, and build trusted relationships to make an impact that matters.
Let’s talk about you:
6 to 8 years of professional experience in consulting or the public sector.
Strong expertise in finance organization, controlling, processes, operating models, and finance tools.
High project management skills & experience in managing projects.
Excellent communication skills, able to articulate complex ideas to diverse stakeholders.
Proven competencies in business development, proposal writing, pitching, and tailoring project approaches to client needs.
Fluent in French and English.

description:
General InformationCompany
Deloitte
Business Unit
Technology & Transformation
Primary Location
Zaventem
Field of interest
HR
Industry Focus
Industry Agnostic
Recruiter
Vromman, Freya - fvromman@deloitte.com
Description of the positionCan’t wait to make an impact on the world? You’re not alone. Join us in driving progress in the working world and beyond.
Your journey with us

At Deloitte Human Capital, we sit at the intersection of people, business, and technology—helping organizations transform not just how they operate, but how they thrive. In today’s digital-first world, transformation isn’t just a project—it’s a mindset. And we’re leading that shift.

Our Transformational Change team partners with leading companies and public institutions to shape human-centered, technology-powered change. We don’t just manage change—we co-create it, embed it, and measure its impact. We believe every successful digital transformation is powered by aligned leadership, engaged employees, and data-driven insights.

As a Manager/Senior Manager, You will:

Shape people strategies that align seamlessly with digital and business transformation goals—so the strategy doesn’t just look good, it delivers.
Align leadership around a common vision, building the commitment and capability to lead transformation from the top.
Serve as a trusted advisor to your clients, offering insight into emerging change trends, digital enablers, and bold new ways of working.
Deign and execute innovative change strategies —combining creativity and structure to design impactful communications, immersive workshops, fit-for-purpose training, and engaging experiences.
Use system and behavioral insights and data to measure what matters, track adoption, adjust the course where needed, and ensure sustainable adoption at every level of the organization.
Build deep client relationships and offer trusted guidance on trends, best practices, and what it truly takes to shift mindsets and behaviours in light of a digital transformation.
Lead strategic bids and client relationships, identifying new opportunities to bring Deloitte’s Transformational Change perspective to market.
Drive thought leadership, share your voice in the market, and play a key role in growing our team and our impact.

Let's talk about you

You bring 6–8 years of experience in organizational and digital transformation—helping clients move from change initiatives to lasting impact.
You’ve operated in complex, fast-paced environments, ideally within management consulting
You’re fluent in the language of technology (SAP, Salesforce, Microsoft etc.) and excited by how digital tools and data can unlock new ways of working.
You’re not just delivering projects—you’re building long-term client relationships and driving growth.
You have a proven track record in leading complex change efforts—including leadership engagement and complex stakeholder management.
You think beyond the standard playbook. You’re a creative problem-solver, eager to bring innovation and bold ideas to every engagement.
You have hands-on experience with key change activities— stakeholder analysis and change impact analysis, communications, training, workshop design, .. —and you know how to elevate them.
You build trust easily—with executives, teams, and your own colleagues.
You’re commercially savvy, with a strong sense of account management, and ready to help grow our business with purpose and impact.
You communicate with confidence in English, French, and Dutch.
Our story
When reimagined, work can be much more than just a process. It can be an outcome that drives productivity, value and impact by unlocking human potential and creating an organization that is resilient to risk, fit for the future and grounded in meaning for workers whose identity will drive sustained results. Human Capital is a leading and trusted advisor and implementation partner, working with companies and governments around the world. For three decades now, our teams have focused exclusively on HR and are continuously investigating and steering the future of HR.

Business is being disrupted. New business models, exponential technology, agile ways of working, and regulation are constantly changing the way organizations work. Organization & Workforce Transformation grounded in human experience principles can drive sustainable change on a behavioral, cultural, and organizational level.

Who is Deloitte?
We provide industry-leading audit and assurance, tax and legal, consulting and related services. We are committed to driving innovation across offerings to help our clients address their challenges, while giving our professionals opportunities to learn and grow in this era of transformation.
In Belgium, +5000 dedicated professionals active in +10 offices, take great pride in bringing multidisciplinary expertise to a wide variety of clients, from national and international companies, small, fast-growing and large organizations to public institutions and governmental authorities.
Why Deloitte?
Be the true you! We foster diversity and inclusion and encourage you to bring your authentic self to work. Explore, question and collaborate while building a career that inspires and energises you.
Never stop growing! Diversity of thought makes us stronger. At Deloitte, we tailor a personalized learning experience, offering you the opportunity to grow at your own pace and achieve maximum impact.
We practice what we preach! As a Purpose-led organisation, at the heart of everything we do is a set of timeless principles and unifying values.
Life looks different for each of us, so we created a varied benefits package that you can tap into:
My Benefits My Choice, a flexible rewards plan tailored to your lifestyle and priorities
Sustainable transport options offered by Mobility@Deloitte
Flexible work arrangements for all and initiatives supported by Parents & Caregivers @Deloitte
Wellbeing tips and activities powered by Energise@Deloitte
Topped off with other health benefits and insurance opportunities

Empowering our employees with flexible work arrangements remains essential in today's reality:
Hybrid workplace: combination of home office and on-site (+10 offices in Belgium or client's premises).
Part-time employment: all our jobs are open to full-time or part-time work under a 90% or 80% regime.

Join us to make an impact together! Apply now!

Vromman, Freya - fvromman@deloitte.com

Description of the position

Can’t wait to make an impact on the world? You’re not alone. Join us in driving progress in the working world and beyond.
Your journey with us

At Deloitte Human Capital, we sit at the intersection of people, business, and technology—helping organizations transform not just how they operate, but how they thrive. In today’s digital-first world, transformation isn’t just a project—it’s a mindset. And we’re leading that shift.

Our Transformational Change team partners with leading companies and public institutions to shape human-centered, technology-powered change. We don’t just manage change—we co-create it, embed it, and measure its impact. We believe every successful digital transformation is powered by aligned leadership, engaged employees, and data-driven insights.

As a Manager/Senior Manager, You will:

  • Shape people strategies that align seamlessly with digital and business transformation goals—so the strategy doesn’t just look good, it delivers.
  • Align leadership around a common vision, building the commitment and capability to lead transformation from the top.
  • Serve as a trusted advisor to your clients, offering insight into emerging change trends, digital enablers, and bold new ways of working.
  • Deign and execute innovative change strategies —combining creativity and structure to design impactful communications, immersive workshops, fit-for-purpose training, and engaging experiences.
  • Use system and behavioral insights and data to measure what matters, track adoption, adjust the course where needed, and ensure sustainable adoption at every level of the organization.
  • Build deep client relationships and offer trusted guidance on trends, best practices, and what it truly takes to shift mindsets and behaviours in light of a digital transformation.
  • Lead strategic bids and client relationships, identifying new opportunities to bring Deloitte’s Transformational Change perspective to market.
  • Drive thought leadership, share your voice in the market, and play a key role in growing our team and our impact.

Let's talk about you

  • You bring 6–8 years of experience in organizational and digital transformation—helping clients move from change initiatives to lasting impact.
  • You’ve operated in complex, fast-paced environments, ideally within management consulting
  • You’re fluent in the language of technology (SAP, Salesforce, Microsoft etc.) and excited by how digital tools and data can unlock new ways of working.
  • You’re not just delivering projects—you’re building long-term client relationships and driving growth.
  • You have a proven track record in leading complex change efforts—including leadership engagement and complex stakeholder management.
  • You think beyond the standard playbook. You’re a creative problem-solver, eager to bring innovation and bold ideas to every engagement.
  • You have hands-on experience with key change activities— stakeholder analysis and change impact analysis, communications, training, workshop design, .. —and you know how to elevate them.
  • You build trust easily—with executives, teams, and your own colleagues.
  • You’re commercially savvy, with a strong sense of account management, and ready to help grow our business with purpose and impact.
  • You communicate with confidence in English, French, and Dutch.
Our story
When reimagined, work can be much more than just a process. General InformationCompany
Deloitte
Business Unit

Primary Location
Zaventem
Field of interest
Finance & Risk
Industry Focus
Industry Agnostic
Recruiter
Labbe, Sidonie - slabbe@deloitte.com
Description of the positionCan’t wait to make an impact on the world? You’re not alone. Join us in driving progress in the working world and beyond.

Deloitte’s Infrastructure & Real Estate (I&RE) practice is a leading independent, multidisciplinary real estate advisory firm serving large private and public sector organizations in Belgium.

We offer four integrated service pillars:
Infrastructure & Real Estate Advisory: Comprehensive, multidisciplinary advisory across the full real estate spectrum
Valuation, Real Estate Insights & Development Advisory: Market analysis, RICS-registered valuations, and AI-powered analytics
Sustainable Portfolio Transformation, HQ, Building & Workplace Advisory: Strategic real estate optimization with ESG and decarbonization focus
Real Estate Transactions & Capital Markets: End-to-end transaction support, deal structuring, and corporate finance modeling

Our competitive advantage is our ability to integrate these capabilities into seamless, strategic solutions. We don’t just advise on real estate, we help clients transform their real estate strategy into a business advantage.
Our Clients: Leading corporations, financial institutions, government agencies, and public sector organizations across Belgium and Europe.

Your journey with us

Join Deloitte Belgium’s Infrastructure & Real Estate (I&RE) practice as a Manager Corporate Real Estate, where you’ll be a strategic advisor to leading organizations navigating complex real estate challenges. You’ll leverage the power of Deloitte’s multidisciplinary expertise to help clients optimize their real estate portfolios, accelerate sustainable transformation, and unlock value through strategic financing and capital markets solutions. This is not a transactional role—it’s a strategic partnership opportunity where you’ll shape how organizations think about real estate as a competitive advantage.

Your responsibilities:
Lead strategic advisory engagements for corporate real estate clients across portfolio, building/HQ, and workplace levels, working with both private and public sector organizations.
Develop and implement integrated solutions addressing portfolio data/technology/reporting, sustainable transformation, and financing/prioritization of transformation initiatives.
Collaborate with multidisciplinary teams (valuers, sustainability experts, transaction advisors, workplace strategists) to deliver comprehensive solutions that go beyond traditional real estate advisory.
Build and maintain long-term client relationships based on trust and strategic impact; identify and pursue new business opportunities aligned with client needs.
Manage project delivery, quality, risks, and financials to ensure client satisfaction, engagement profitability, and adherence to Deloitte’s quality standards.
Mentor and develop team members, fostering a culture of excellence and continuous learning; contribute to practice growth and thought leadership initiatives.
Stay ahead of market trends in real estate, sustainability, technology, and financing; contribute insights to practice strategy and client advisory.

Let's talk about you
Bachelor’s degree in Real Estate, Business, Finance, Economics, or related field (Master’s degree preferred)
6 to 8 years of relevant experience in:
Corporate real estate strategy advisory or consulting (note that a pure transactional brokerage experience is not sufficient) or related consulting or advisory role
Real estate strategy and portfolio optimization
Experience advising corporate clients on their strategy at portfolio, building/HQ, or workplace levels
Familiarity with sustainability/ESG considerations in real estate (CRREM, net-zero strategies, decarbonization)
Strong understanding of real estate market dynamics and valuation principles
Understanding of real estate financing and capital markets
Proven ability to think strategically and advise senior client stakeholders, problem solvers and solution oriented
Client relationship management and commercial acumen
Multidisciplinary collaboration: demonstrated ability to work across disciplines and leverage diverse expertise
Experience in project management, and ideally team management
Adaptability and resilience.
Innovation and continuous improvement
Fluent in English and Dutch, French is a plus

Our story
Our Strategy & Transactions offering portfolio combines the following teams: Strategy & Business Design, Infrastructure & Real Estate, Sustainability and M&A Valuation & Business Modelling.

Our leading Infrastructure & Real Estate team offers a breadth of capability and an innovative approach unequalled in the market. We combine property services with financial and business advisory expertise to deliver integrated solutions, we apply a depth of insight drawn from our understanding of all industries, sectors and asset classes.
We work in teams that cherish dedication and highly competent colleagues. You can expect leadership across all levels of seniority, while informality, inclusion, and sharing laughs at the office come naturally to us.
Who is Deloitte?
We provide industry-leading audit and assurance, tax and legal, consulting and related services. We are committed to driving innovation across offerings to help our clients address their challenges, while giving our professionals opportunities to learn and grow in this era of transformation.
In Belgium, +5000 dedicated professionals active in +10 offices, take great pride in bringing multidisciplinary expertise to a wide variety of clients, from national and international companies, small, fast-growing and large organizations to public institutions and governmental authorities.
Why Deloitte?
Be the true you! We foster diversity and inclusion and encourage you to bring your authentic self to work. Explore, question and collaborate while building a career that inspires and energises you.
Never stop growing! Diversity of thought makes us stronger. At Deloitte, we tailor a personalized learning experience, offering you the opportunity to grow at your own pace and achieve maximum impact.
We practice what we preach! As a Purpose-led organisation, at the heart of everything we do is a set of timeless principles and unifying values.
Life looks different for each of us, so we created a varied benefits package that you can tap into:
My Benefits My Choice, a flexible rewards plan tailored to your lifestyle and priorities
Sustainable transport options offered by Mobility@Deloitte
Flexible work arrangements for all and initiatives supported by Parents & Caregivers @Deloitte
Wellbeing tips and activities powered by Energise@Deloitte
Topped off with other health benefits and insurance opportunities

Empowering our employees with flexible work arrangements remains essential in today's reality:
Hybrid workplace: combination of home office and on-site (+10 offices in Belgium or client's premises).
Part-time employment: all our jobs are open to full-time or part-time work under a 90% or 80% regime.

Join us to make an impact together! Apply now!

Having quality discussions with clients at C-suite level, demonstrating creativity combined with strong industry knowledge;
Proving our clients a forward-looking view of the most important strategic finance topics affecting them and define the right set of initiatives and projects to execute upon this strategy;

Playing an active role in business development activities in order to grow our Financial Services industry offering based on your knowledge of the Belgian Market;
Shaping the ‘Finance Transformation FSI team’, leveraging skills and capabilities from across Deloitte Consulting;
Leverage your superb skills and remarkable business sense to assist the wider team in business development and sales activities in Finance across FSI accounts.

Let’s Talk About You

Minimum 6 years relevant professional experience in a consulting firm or a blend of consulting and Financial Services industry experience;
Strong knowledge of the Belgian Financial Services Industry, experienced in Banking or Insurance, and an understanding of the key factors to address within the Finance Function;
Network within the Finance Services industry;
Expertise in processes, technologies (e.g. SAP) and operating models focusing on the Finance Function. Expertise in Accounting systems and/or the overall closing process is seen as a plus.

Fostering Finance efficiency and effectiveness through your organization & operations excellence.
“Core” Global Business Services: We help Finance and Business leaders improve their organization and processes efficiency by setting up shared services centres. From strategy & design phases to implementation & benefits realization follow-up, we support all phases of a SSC implementation.

Finance Operations Excellence: We help Finance leaders rethink the way O2C and P2P are delivered, making the most out of cutting-edge automation technologies to boost efficiency and user & customer experience.

Industry Focus
Financial Services
Recruiter
Pliatsika, Evgenia - epliatsika@deloitte.gr

Description of the position

Can’t wait to make an impact on the world? You’re not alone. Join us in driving progress in the working world and beyond.

Your journey with us

You apply your experiences in finance and industry foresight on critical client issues with CFOs and business executives.

You support our client in a wide range of various projects in the Financial Services Industry from strategy definition to implementation by:

  • Having quality discussions with clients at C-suite level, demonstrating creativity combined with strong industry knowledge;
  • Proving our clients a forward-looking view of the most important strategic finance topics affecting them and define the right set of initiatives and projects to execute upon this strategy;
  • Delivery of engagements, liaising with stakeholders, and directing activities of people on the project team. Key areas may include Finance strategy, Operating models, Finance processes and ERP implementations;
  • Playing an active role in business development activities in order to grow our Financial Services industry offering based on your knowledge of the Belgian Market;
  • Shaping the ‘Finance Transformation FSI team’, leveraging skills and capabilities from across Deloitte Consulting;
  • Leverage your superb skills and remarkable business sense to assist the wider team in business development and sales activities in Finance across FSI accounts.

Let’s Talk About You

  • Minimum 6 years relevant professional experience in a consulting firm or a blend of consulting and Financial Services industry experience;
  • Strong knowledge of the Belgian Financial Services Industry, experienced in Banking or Insurance, and an understanding of the key factors to address within the Finance Function;
  • Network within the Finance Services industry;
  • Expertise in processes, technologies (e.g. SAP) and operating models focusing on the Finance Function. Expertise in Accounting systems and/or the overall closing process is seen as a plus.


Fostering Finance efficiency and effectiveness through your organization & operations excellence.
“Core” Global Business Services: We help Finance and Business leaders improve their organization and processes efficiency by setting up shared services centres. From strategy & design phases to implementation & benefits realization follow-up, we support all phases of a SSC implementation.
Finance Target Operating Models: We help Finance leaders reflect on how to best upgrade their operating models to efficiently and effectively anticipate the evolution of their business and stay ahead of competition.
Finance Operations Excellence: We help Finance leaders rethink the way O2C and P2P are delivered, making the most out of cutting-edge automation technologies to boost efficiency and user & customer experience.
ERP enabled transformation: We accompany Finance teams through the managerial & functional aspects of ERP implementations, ensuring that those are effectively done with you and for you.

Who is Deloitte?
We provide industry-leading audit and assurance, tax and legal, consulting and related services. We are committed to driving innovation across offerings to help our clients address their challenges, while giving our professionals opportunities to learn and grow in this era of transformation.
In Belgium, +5000 dedicated professionals active in +10 offices, take great pride in bringing multidisciplinary expertise to a wide variety of clients, from national and international companies, small, fast-growing and large organizations to public institutions and governmental authorities.
Why Deloitte?
Be the true you! We foster diversity and inclusion and encourage you to bring your authentic self to work. Explore, question and collaborate while building a career that inspires and energises you.
Never stop growing! Diversity of thought makes us stronger. At Deloitte, we tailor a personalized learning experience, offering you the opportunity to grow at your own pace and achieve maximum impact.
We practice what we preach! As a Purpose-led organisation, at the heart of everything we do is a set of timeless principles and unifying values.
Life looks different for each of us, so we created a varied benefits package that you can tap into:
  • My Benefits My Choice, a flexible rewards plan tailored to your lifestyle and priorities
  • Sustainable transport options offered by Mobility@Deloitte
  • Flexible work arrangements for all and initiatives supported by Parents & Caregivers @Deloitte
  • Wellbeing tips and activities powered by Energise@Deloitte
  • Topped off with other health benefits and insurance opportunities

Empowering our employees with flexible work arrangements remains essential in today's reality:
  • Hybrid workplace: combination of home office and on-site (+10 offices in Belgium or client's premises).
  • Part-time employment: all our jobs are open to full-time or part-time work under a 90% or 80% regime.

Join us to make an impact together! Apply now!

description:
General InformationCompany
Deloitte
Business Unit
Strategy, Risk & Transactions Advisory
Primary Location
Zaventem
Field of interest
Finance & Risk
Industry Focus
Industry Agnostic
Recruiter
Ouaret, Chaïmae - couaret@deloitte.com
Description of the positionCan’t wait to make an impact on the world? You’re not alone. Join us in driving progress in the working world and beyond.

Your journey with us
As (Senior) Manager in our M&A Transaction Services group you support clients with financial advice during M&A or transformation projects, including financial due diligence assignments, carve-out preparation, business plan reviews, valuations & business modeling, SPA advice, M&A strategy as well as financial support in other corporate finance matters. Your primary focus will be to provide M&A support to our clients, working closely with a team of experienced M&A professionals with exposure to a wide range of clients. In addition, you have an important role to play in our business development opportunities.

You are in charge of projects to advise and support clients in complex M&A transactions with services ranging from financial due diligence, sell side vendor assistance & due diligence, business plan reviews, carve-out support, SPA advice and negotiations, synergy identification, and other M&A support services.
You are the first contact towards the client, manage your team of M&A professionals and coordinate the work streams of other Deloitte expert teams.
You will be active on large cross border deals as well as mid-market transactions.
You play an important role in our business development opportunities.
You work closely together with a team of experienced M&A professionals and gain exposure to a wide range of clients both corporate as well as private equity.

Let’s talk about you

You have at least 5 years of experience as an auditor, a financial analyst or a specialist in M&A and/or financial due diligence.
You are passionate about M&A and eager to make an impact that matters for our clients on the deals that shape our market.
In this role as a Manager keywords are autonomy, ownership and entrepreneurship.
You have a Master’s degree in finance or economics. Being enrolled in or having completed the CFA program is an asset.
You are fluent in Dutch, French and English and have solid writing and presentation skills.
You have excellent interpersonal skills and the ability to build effective relationships between individuals, teams and lines of business.
You have the ability to communicate clearly, persuade and influence.
You have a proactive approach and flexible attitude with the ability to demonstrate initiative and reliability.
You have the ability to work well under pressure and meet tight deadlines.
You have excellent coaching skills and experience in managing people.
You have strong Excel and PowerPoint skills.
Our story
Our Strategy & Transactions offering portfolio combines the following teams: Strategy & Business Design, Infrastructure & Real Estate, Sustainability and M&A Valuation & Business Modelling.

This is your opportunity to join our Deloitte M&A team. We are the global leader in integrated M&A Services. By cooperation between various specialists in M&A, Deloitte provides integrated solutions for every transaction process. We define and execute growth strategies for our clients and guide them through every stage of a transaction, so they achieve their aspirations.

Who is Deloitte?
We provide industry-leading audit and assurance, tax and legal, consulting and related services. We are committed to driving innovation across offerings to help our clients address their challenges, while giving our professionals opportunities to learn and grow in this era of transformation.
In Belgium, +5000 dedicated professionals active in +10 offices, take great pride in bringing multidisciplinary expertise to a wide variety of clients, from national and international companies, small, fast-growing and large organizations to public institutions and governmental authorities.
Why Deloitte?
Be the true you! We foster diversity and inclusion and encourage you to bring your authentic self to work. Explore, question and collaborate while building a career that inspires and energises you.
Never stop growing! Diversity of thought makes us stronger. At Deloitte, we tailor a personalized learning experience, offering you the opportunity to grow at your own pace and achieve maximum impact.
We practice what we preach! As a Purpose-led organisation, at the heart of everything we do is a set of timeless principles and unifying values.
Life looks different for each of us, so we created a varied benefits package that you can tap into:
My Benefits My Choice, a flexible rewards plan tailored to your lifestyle and priorities
Sustainable transport options offered by Mobility@Deloitte
Flexible work arrangements for all and initiatives supported by Parents & Caregivers @Deloitte
Wellbeing tips and activities powered by Energise@Deloitte
Topped off with other health benefits and insurance opportunities

Empowering our employees with flexible work arrangements remains essential in today's reality:
Hybrid workplace: combination of home office and on-site (+10 offices in Belgium or client's premises).
Part-time employment: all our jobs are open to full-time or part-time work under a 90% or 80% regime.

Your journey with us

We are looking for an innovative SAP Architect to design, develop and implement systems architecture that meet business needs, along with ensuring that our clients’ can keep pace with the changing landscape.
Evaluate the client’s business requirements to build the optimal SAP design and/ or supplement with the right mix of alternative technology solutions
Design, build and integrate requirements and processes into SAP systems architecture (or wider technology solutions) to meet clients’ requirements
Let’s talk about you
Proven experience in SAP solution architecture design
Previous project management experience is advantageous
In-depth understanding on SAP especially in its integration of other modules (knowledge of S/4Hana is advantageous)
Experience with Public Sector industry is a plus
Efficient communication and stakeholder management skills
Strong organisation and leadership skills
You have the right to work in Belgium
You are fluent in French or Dutch
Our story
Enterprise Performance is about achieving maximum impact and value from investments in finance, supply chain, and IT operations requires a holistic view of key business functions from strategy through process design and technology enablement

With decades of SAP experience, we help clients in transforming their organization and take it to new levels of performance with a suite of solutions centred on the leading-edge SAP S/4 HANA platform, in areas such as enterprise transformation, finance and supply chain, incorporating advanced technology applications such as artificial intelligence, blockchain, and IoT

description:
General InformationCompany
Deloitte
Business Unit
Technology & Transformation
Primary Location
Zaventem
Field of interest
Technology
Industry Focus
Industry Agnostic
Recruiter
Houimli, Leila - lhouimli@deloitte.com
Description of the positionCan’t wait to make an impact on the world? You’re not alone. Join us in driving progress in the working world and beyond.
Your journey with us
Our SAP Plan to Make team is looking for a Manager to join our fast-growing team. As a member of this team, you will be responsible for the implementation of SAP Environment, Health & Safety module to help our clients manage their processes and ensure compliance with regulatory requirements, reduce risks, and improve overall safety performance.

You will drive integration with other SAP modules such as Materials Management, Production Planning, and Quality Management to provide a comprehensive solution for managing EHS processes for our clients.

Based on your expertise and ambition, you focus on end-to-end implementation with a future-proof vision towards sustainability reporting and integration of manufacturing processes. Tasks include (agile) project management, exploration, implementation, training & improvement projects.

Within our Deloitte community you play an important role in extending our common knowledge by participating in initiatives in which we explore how the newest functionalities can bring added values to our customers.

You will have the chance to coach and train junior colleagues, client staff and users.
Based on your drive and performance, you will gain more strategic tasks and you will grow an ambitious career to its full potential.

Let's talk about you
- You have at least 4 years of in-depth experience implementing SAP EH&S module, including its sub-components like Product Safety, Dangerous Goods Management, Industrial Hygiene and Safety, Waste Management, Occupational Health, and Environmental Compliance.

- You have a good understanding how SAP EH&S integrates with other SAP modules such as Materials Management (MM), Production Planning (PP), Quality Management (QM), and Human Resources (HR).

- You have experience managing and migrating data related to EH&S, including hazardous substance data, safety data sheets, and compliance documentation.
- You have skills in creating and managing reports and dashboards to monitor EH&S performance and compliance.

- You are a skilled project manager or are interested in becoming one. With coaching, you will be able to plan, execute, and manage SAP EH&S implementation projects, including resource allocation, timeline management, and stakeholder communication.

- You have an interest in leading by example, you have an interest in coaching and developing others while growing your own leadership skills.

- You are open to work in an international environment and must be willing to work abroad if needed.

- You have a university degree or the equivalent by experience.

- You have strong English written and oral communication skills (Dutch and/or French knowledge is a plus).

- You have EU Citizenship or you have an open permit that allows you to live and work in Belgium.
Our story
Enterprise Performance is about achieving maximum impact and value from investments in finance, supply chain, and IT operations requires a holistic view of key business functions from strategy through process design and technology enablement

With decades of SAP experience, we help clients in transforming their organization and take it to new levels of performance with a suite of solutions centred on the leading-edge SAP S/4 HANA platform, in areas such as enterprise transformation, finance and supply chain, incorporating advanced technology applications such as artificial intelligence, blockchain, and IoT

Houimli, Leila - lhouimli@deloitte.com

Description of the position

Can’t wait to make an impact on the world? You’re not alone. Join us in driving progress in the working world and beyond.
Your journey with us
Our SAP Plan to Make team is looking for a Manager to join our fast-growing team. As a member of this team, you will be responsible for the implementation of SAP Environment, Health & Safety module to help our clients manage their processes and ensure compliance with regulatory requirements, reduce risks, and improve overall safety performance.

You will drive integration with other SAP modules such as Materials Management, Production Planning, and Quality Management to provide a comprehensive solution for managing EHS processes for our clients.

Based on your expertise and ambition, you focus on end-to-end implementation with a future-proof vision towards sustainability reporting and integration of manufacturing processes. Tasks include (agile) project management, exploration, implementation, training & improvement projects.

Within our Deloitte community you play an important role in extending our common knowledge by participating in initiatives in which we explore how the newest functionalities can bring added values to our customers.

You will have the chance to coach and train junior colleagues, client staff and users.
Based on your drive and performance, you will gain more strategic tasks and you will grow an ambitious career to its full potential.

Let's talk about you
  • You have at least 4 years of in-depth experience implementing SAP EH&S module, including its sub-components like Product Safety, Dangerous Goods Management, Industrial Hygiene and Safety, Waste Management, Occupational Health, and Environmental Compliance.

  • You have a good understanding how SAP EH&S integrates with other SAP modules such as Materials Management (MM), Production Planning (PP), Quality Management (QM), and Human Resources (HR).

  • You have experience managing and migrating data related to EH&S, including hazardous substance data, safety data sheets, and compliance documentation.
  • You have skills in creating and managing reports and dashboards to monitor EH&S performance and compliance.

  • You are a skilled project manager or are interested in becoming one. With coaching, you will be able to plan, execute, and manage SAP EH&S implementation projects, including resource allocation, timeline management, and stakeholder communication.

  • You have an interest in leading by example, you have an interest in coaching and developing others while growing your own leadership skills.

  • You are open to work in an international environment and must be willing to work abroad if needed.

  • You have a university degree or the equivalent by experience.

  • You have strong English written and oral communication skills (Dutch and/or French knowledge is a plus).

  • You have EU Citizenship or you have an open permit that allows you to live and work in Belgium.
Our story
Enterprise Performance is about achieving maximum impact and value from investments in finance, supply chain, and IT operations requires a holistic view of key business functions from strategy through process design and technology enablement
With decades of SAP experience, we help clients in transforming their organization and take it to new levels of performance with a suite of solutions centred on the leading-edge SAP S/4 HANA platform, in areas such as enterprise transformation, finance and supply chain, incorporating advanced technology applications such as artificial intelligence, blockchain, and IoT

Who is Deloitte?
We provide industry-leading audit and assurance, tax and legal, consulting and related services. We are committed to driving innovation across offerings to help our clients address their challenges, while giving our professionals opportunities to learn and grow in this era of transformation.
In Belgium, +5000 dedicated professionals active in +10 offices, take great pride in bringing multidisciplinary expertise to a wide variety of clients, from national and international companies, small, fast-growing and large organizations to public institutions and governmental authorities.
Why Deloitte?
Be the true you! We foster diversity and inclusion and encourage you to bring your authentic self to work. Explore, question and collaborate while building a career that inspires and energises you.
Never stop growing! Diversity of thought makes us stronger. At Deloitte, we tailor a personalized learning experience, offering you the opportunity to grow at your own pace and achieve maximum impact.
We practice what we preach! As a Purpose-led organisation, at the heart of everything we do is a set of timeless principles and unifying values.
Life looks different for each of us, so we created a varied benefits package that you can tap into:

Description of the positionCan’t wait to make an impact on the world? You’re not alone. Join us in driving progress in the working world and beyond.
Your journey with us
At Deloitte’s Organization and Workforce Transformation (OWT) practice, we help our clients respond to complex and fast-changing environments by rethinking how work is done, how organizations are structured, and how capabilities are built. Within OWT, our Future Organization team focuses on shaping organizations of the future, from organization design to workforce strategy, skills, work redesign, and talent mix optimization. We work at the intersection of analytics, technology, and leadership to deliver future-proof solutions.

As a (Senior) Manager, you will play a key role in delivering impactful client engagements while developing trusted relationships and growing our market presence. You’ll guide project teams, contribute to business development, and support the development of our Future Organization capabilities. You will help clients answer key questions such as:
What organizational structures best enable performance and agility?
How can we become more adaptive and future ready as an organization?
How should work and roles be designed?
What skills and capabilities are needed to deliver on strategy?
How will AI impact the organizational structure and related roles?

As a (Senior) Manager in Future Organization, you will:
Lead client projects across topics such as:
Organization design
Strategic workforce planning and workforce strategy
Skills-based organization and work redesign
Talent mix and leadership model evolution
Build and manage relationships with key client stakeholders, becoming a trusted advisor to middle and senior management
Contribute to proactive business development by identifying opportunities, developing proposals, and supporting go-to-market activities
Coach and guide junior team members, enabling high-quality delivery and supporting professional growth
Collaborate across Deloitte teams (e.g. Data, M&A, Strategy, HR,...) to co-create integrated transformation solutions
Help evolve our Future Organization capabilities by developing methodologies, assets, and points of view

Let's talk about you

An experienced consultant with 6 to 8+ years of experience relevant domains, ideally with a focus on Future Organization topics such as org design, workforce strategy, or work redesign
Skilled in project management and client delivery, able to lead engagements from planning to execution
Experience in Business Development, both reactive (writing proposals) and proactive (leveraging your network)
Able to connect strategic goals to operating and organizational models, with strong structuring and analytical skills
Curious and passionate about innovation and the future of work, with a generalist mindset and comfort working across topics
A team player who builds trust, fosters collaboration, and supports junior talent
Fluent in English, Dutch and/or French
Our story
When reimagined, work can be much more than just a process. It can be an outcome that drives productivity, value and impact by unlocking human potential and creating an organization that is resilient to risk, fit for the future and grounded in meaning for workers whose identity will drive sustained results. Human Capital is a leading and trusted advisor and implementation partner, working with companies and governments around the world. For three decades now, our teams have focused exclusively on HR and are continuously investigating and steering the future of HR.

Business is being disrupted. New business models, exponential technology, agile ways of working, and regulation are constantly changing the way organizations work. Organization & Workforce Transformation grounded in human experience principles can drive sustainable change on a behavioral, cultural, and organizational level.

Who is Deloitte?
We provide industry-leading audit and assurance, tax and legal, consulting and related services. We are committed to driving innovation across offerings to help our clients address their challenges, while giving our professionals opportunities to learn and grow in this era of transformation.
In Belgium, +5000 dedicated professionals active in +10 offices, take great pride in bringing multidisciplinary expertise to a wide variety of clients, from national and international companies, small, fast-growing and large organizations to public institutions and governmental authorities.
Why Deloitte?
Be the true you! We foster diversity and inclusion and encourage you to bring your authentic self to work. Explore, question and collaborate while building a career that inspires and energises you.
Never stop growing! Diversity of thought makes us stronger. At Deloitte, we tailor a personalized learning experience, offering you the opportunity to grow at your own pace and achieve maximum impact.
We practice what we preach! As a Purpose-led organisation, at the heart of everything we do is a set of timeless principles and unifying values.
Life looks different for each of us, so we created a varied benefits package that you can tap into:
My Benefits My Choice, a flexible rewards plan tailored to your lifestyle and priorities
Sustainable transport options offered by Mobility@Deloitte
Flexible work arrangements for all and initiatives supported by Parents & Caregivers @Deloitte
Wellbeing tips and activities powered by Energise@Deloitte
Topped off with other health benefits and insurance opportunities

Empowering our employees with flexible work arrangements remains essential in today's reality:
Hybrid workplace: combination of home office and on-site (+10 offices in Belgium or client's premises).
Part-time employment: all our jobs are open to full-time or part-time work under a 90% or 80% regime.

Description of the positionCan’t wait to make an impact on the world? You’re not alone. Join us in driving progress in the working world and beyond.

Your Journey With Us

As (Sr.) Supply Chain Manager, you join our team of highly experienced supply chain consultants and advise our clients with their most challenging questions. You use your knowledge and experience to transform or optimize our clients’ supply chain activities and processes into a source of competitive advantage.

You aspire to become a leader in our firm, not only looking after successful project delivery but as well driving business development and creating eminence in the marketplace.

Examples of projects are:

End-to-end (technology-enabled) Supply Chain transformations, covering Plan-Source-Make-Deliver areas, from visioning to business requirements definition, tool selection if needed, process, organization and technology solution design, and all aspects of implementation
Strategic Supply Chain diagnostics to define a vision, a business case and an improvement roadmap for the next 0,5 to 5 years
Supply Network Planning study highlighting improvements and recommendations in order to best leverage the distribution network while decreasing working capital investment and increasing service levels
Sales and Operations Planning (S&OP) assessment and / or implementation
Demand planning and forecasting improvement initiatives
(Multi-echelon) inventory optimization studies and target calculations
Warehousing and logistics vision and strategy but also improving operations
(Smart) Manufacturing: from vision and strategy to OEE improvements
Analysis and improvements identification over SC processes and beyond (order-to-cash, procure-to-pay, ..)
…

In your role, you will:

Support actively business development activities and sales pursuits in Walloon region leveraging your actual network
Support further development of existing propositions and (co-)create new value propositions fit for this market
Lead and deliver client engagements in all its facets shaping supply chain excellence with multidisciplinary teams
Ensure buy-in from client top management, and manage senior client and partner stakeholders to ensure project success
As a Supply Chain expert and people-minded person, you are keen to share your passion, knowledge and insights with your team and coach junior colleagues to support them in their professional careers.

Our Supply Chain & Network Operations team helps clients to manage and optimize supply-chain performance, at a time of digital disruption that adds complexity, while offering a unique opportunity for transformational productivity gains. Our services and solutions empower end-to-end, data-driven redesign and digitization—revitalizing manufacturing, logistics, distribution, product lifecycle management and related supply-network functions across a wide range of industries.

Let's talk about you
Passionate about Supply Chain with a proven track record of helping clients in this domain in mid-market or at global companies
Entrepreneurial mindset, with strong business development capabilities to make an impact in the Walloon region
Proven experience in leading Supply Chain engagements for clients as part of a high-talent team
An adept in identifying practical but also innovative ideas & solutions and, guiding a team to articulate and realize them under challenging deadlines with diverse and senior stakeholders
Established leadership skills demonstrating strong judgment, problem-solving, and decision-making abilities
Experience in building, mentoring and coaching a team of highly talented and motivated supply chain consultants
A Master's degree in Business/Civil Engineering or Economics and at least 7 years of consulting experience or relevant industry experience
Having an APICS or other Supply Chain / Operations certificate is a plus
Native in French and fluent in English
Our story
Enterprise Performance is about achieving maximum impact and value from investments in finance, supply chain, and IT operations requires a holistic view of key business functions from strategy through process design and technology enablement

Deloitte is a globally recognized professional services firm committed to making an impact that matters. Our Supply Chain & Network Operations practice supports clients in addressing their most critical supply chain challenges through strategic, analytical, and technology-enabled projects. We deliver end-to-end, data-driven redesign and digitization to transform key areas such as planning, sourcing & procurement, manufacturing, and logistics & distribution. Join our team in Belgium and work with clients across diverse industries as we advise, implement, and operate solutions that drive sustainable growth and operational excellence.

Who is Deloitte?
We provide industry-leading audit and assurance, tax and legal, consulting and related services. We are committed to driving innovation across offerings to help our clients address their challenges, while giving our professionals opportunities to learn and grow in this era of transformation.
In Belgium, +5000 dedicated professionals active in +10 offices, take great pride in bringing multidisciplinary expertise to a wide variety of clients, from national and international companies, small, fast-growing and large organizations to public institutions and governmental authorities.
Why Deloitte?
Be the true you! We foster diversity and inclusion and encourage you to bring your authentic self to work. Explore, question and collaborate while building a career that inspires and energises you.
Never stop growing! Diversity of thought makes us stronger. At Deloitte, we tailor a personalized learning experience, offering you the opportunity to grow at your own pace and achieve maximum impact.
We practice what we preach! As a Purpose-led organisation, at the heart of everything we do is a set of timeless principles and unifying values.

an OMS expert.

Skills and experience required:

Technical Proficiency: you have expertise in implementing (best of breed) Order Management Solutions and integration with other systems (like ERP, CRM, SCM solutions,..). You can translate business requirements into technical specifications, guide development teams, and ensure the solution is scalable & reliable, meets business needs and is aligned to overall IT strategy.
Business Proficiency: You understand best practices for efficient order processing, inventory management, and customer service. You have experience in collaborating with business stakeholders to understand business requirements and analyse & design E2E business processes.
Project Management skills: you have experience in leading implementation projects across different project lifecycles (from discovery to hyper care). You have excellent verbal and written communication skills for interacting with stakeholders and customers.
Team Management skills: you are able to train and guide people on relevant topics such as OMS platforms, e-commerce technologies, integration patterns, how to use OMS effectively etc. You have experience in leading teams and are able to scale internal capabilities in the team and network
Let's talk about you

We are looking for candidates with following qualifications:
* Preferably, you have a Master's degree in Engineering or Economics with a specialization in the field of Supply Chain / Logistics. Having a certification for specific OMS software solutions is a plus
* You have a minimum of 7 years of relevant experience in supply chain related functions including prior experience in implementing order management systems

* You have strong analytical skills and a digital acumen

* You are a team player, and you have an intellectual curiosity and drive to continuously learn
* You are open to work in an international environment, abroad if needed
* You have strong communication skills and you are fluent in English. Good knowledge of an additional language is an advantage

Consulting & Strategy
Industry Focus
Industry Agnostic
Recruiter
Bulinckx, Julie - jbulinckx@deloitte.com

Description of the position

Can’t wait to make an impact on the world? You’re not alone. Join us in driving progress in the working world and beyond.
Your journey with us

At Deloitte we work alongside our clients to help them navigate today’s complex and continuously changing environment to get the right product, to the right place, at the right time. We have a passionate and dedicated team of Logistics and Distribution experts which we are looking to grow with

an OMS expert.

Skills and experience required:

  • Technical Proficiency: you have expertise in implementing (best of breed) Order Management Solutions and integration with other systems (like ERP, CRM, SCM solutions,..). You can translate business requirements into technical specifications, guide development teams, and ensure the solution is scalable & reliable, meets business needs and is aligned to overall IT strategy.
  • Business Proficiency: You understand best practices for efficient order processing, inventory management, and customer service. You have experience in collaborating with business stakeholders to understand business requirements and analyse & design E2E business processes.
  • Project Management skills: you have experience in leading implementation projects across different project lifecycles (from discovery to hyper care). You have excellent verbal and written communication skills for interacting with stakeholders and customers.
  • Team Management skills: you are able to train and guide people on relevant topics such as OMS platforms, e-commerce technologies, integration patterns, how to use OMS effectively etc. You have experience in leading teams and are able to scale internal capabilities in the team and network
Let's talk about you
We are looking for candidates with following qualifications:
  • Preferably, you have a Master's degree in Engineering or Economics with a specialization in the field of Supply Chain / Logistics. Having a certification for specific OMS software solutions is a plus
  • You have a minimum of 7 years of relevant experience in supply chain related functions including prior experience in implementing order management systems
  • You have strong analytical skills and a digital acumen
  • You are a team player, and you have an intellectual curiosity and drive to continuously learn
  • You are open to work in an international environment, abroad if needed
  • You have strong communication skills and you are fluent in English. Good knowledge of an additional language is an advantage
Our story
Enterprise Performance is about achieving maximum impact and value from investments in finance, supply chain, and IT operations requires a holistic view of key business functions from strategy through process design and technology enablement
Deloitte is a globally recognized professional services firm committed to making an impact that matters. Our Supply Chain & Network Operations practice supports clients in addressing their most critical supply chain challenges through strategic, analytical, and technology-enabled projects. We deliver end-to-end, data-driven redesign and digitization to transform key areas such as planning, sourcing & procurement, manufacturing, and logistics & distribution. Join our team in Belgium and work with clients across diverse industries as we advise, implement, and operate solutions that drive sustainable growth and operational excellence.

Who is Deloitte?
We provide industry-leading audit and assurance, tax and legal, consulting and related services. We are committed to driving innovation across offerings to help our clients address their challenges, while giving our professionals opportunities to learn and grow in this era of transformation.
In Belgium, +5000 dedicated professionals active in +10 offices, take great pride in bringing multidisciplinary expertise to a wide variety of clients, from national and international companies, small, fast-growing and large organizations to public institutions and governmental authorities.
Why Deloitte?
Be the true you! We foster diversity and inclusion and encourage you to bring your authentic self to work. Explore, question and collaborate while building a career that inspires and energises you.
Never stop growing! Diversity of thought makes us stronger. At Deloitte, we tailor a personalized learning experience, offering you the opportunity to grow at your own pace and achieve maximum impact.
We practice what we preach! As a Purpose-led organisation, at the heart of everything we do is a set of timeless principles and unifying values.
Life looks different for each of us, so we created a varied benefits package that you can tap into:
  • My Benefits My Choice, a flexible rewards plan tailored to your lifestyle and priorities
  • Sustainable transport options offered by Mobility@Deloitte
  • Flexible work arrangements for all and initiatives supported by Parents & Caregivers @Deloitte
  • Wellbeing tips and activities powered by Energise@Deloitte
  • Topped off with other health benefits and insurance opportunities

Empowering our employees with flexible work arrangements remains essential in today's reality:
  • Hybrid workplace: combination of home office and on-site (+10 offices in Belgium or client's premises).
  • Part-time employment: all our jobs are open to full-time or part-time work under a 90% or 80% regime.

Join us to make an impact together! Apply now!

General InformationCompany
Deloitte

Primary Location
Zaventem
Field of interest
Consulting & Strategy
Industry Focus
Energy, Resources & Industrial
Recruiter
Labbe, Sidonie - slabbe@deloitte.com
Description of the positionCan’t wait to make an impact on the world? You’re not alone. Join us in driving progress in the working world and beyond.
Your journey with us

We are looking for an experienced Pricing Manager to join our expanding and dynamic Commercial Excellence (CE) team at Monitor Deloitte. This role focuses on helping clients enhance their profitability and revenue through data-driven insights and strategic pricing initiatives.

Our CE team covers a wide variety of topics, but all very closely connected. Going from segmentation and channel strategy to pricing and commercial value proposition to Salesforce effectiveness and value selling.

Your Challenge
As a Pricing Manager, you will combine your strategic expertise with advanced analytical techniques to provide impactful solutions to complex business challenges:
Lead pricing strategy engagements for top-tier clients, working closely with senior executives.
Provide insights and recommendations that directly impact clients' profitability and revenue generation.
Independently manage projects, including approach development, stakeholder engagement, and project team direction.
Coach and mentor junior team members on projects and business development activities.
Support business development efforts, including preparing client proposals and contributing to growth initiatives.
Drive the development of internal propositions and client-facing materials.
Participate in sales and business development activities to expand the reach of our Commercial Excellence practice.
Let's talk about you
Master’s or MBA degree from a top-tier university.
Over 6 years of relevant experience in consultancy or pricing/commercial functions.
Expertise in pricing methodologies (e.g., conjoint, MCDA, regression models) and handling various pricing challenges, including strategy, setting, and execution.
Familiarity with innovative pricing schemes, contracting agreements, and pricing software/data analytics tools.
Strong analytical skills, translating data into actionable insights, paired with excellent communication to present complex ideas clearly to all stakeholders.
Proven leadership in managing teams and projects with a solution-oriented mindset.
Fluency in English; proficiency in Dutch and/or French is a plus, with strong commercial acumen and market awareness.

Our story
Our Strategy & Transactions offering portfolio combines the following teams: Strategy & Business Design, Infrastructure & Real Estate, Sustainability and M&A Valuation & Business Modelling.

Joining our Strategy & Business Design team will give you the opportunity to benefit from early client exposure and learning from some of the top practitioners in the field. You will work on the intersection between finance, strategy and operations and will be involved throughout the lifecycle of some of the largest, most complex and high-profile business questions in Belgium and internationally. This is our strategy consulting practice, working with the world’s leading and most ambitious corporations and public organizations to drive growth on the issues that are most important to them.

Who is Deloitte?
We provide industry-leading audit and assurance, tax and legal, consulting and related services. We are committed to driving innovation across offerings to help our clients address their challenges, while giving our professionals opportunities to learn and grow in this era of transformation.
In Belgium, +5000 dedicated professionals active in +10 offices, take great pride in bringing multidisciplinary expertise to a wide variety of clients, from national and international companies, small, fast-growing and large organizations to public institutions and governmental authorities.
Why Deloitte?
Be the true you! We foster diversity and inclusion and encourage you to bring your authentic self to work. Explore, question and collaborate while building a career that inspires and energises you.
Never stop growing! Diversity of thought makes us stronger. At Deloitte, we tailor a personalized learning experience, offering you the opportunity to grow at your own pace and achieve maximum impact.
We practice what we preach! As a Purpose-led organisation, at the heart of everything we do is a set of timeless principles and unifying values.
Life looks different for each of us, so we created a varied benefits package that you can tap into:
My Benefits My Choice, a flexible rewards plan tailored to your lifestyle and priorities
Sustainable transport options offered by Mobility@Deloitte
Flexible work arrangements for all and initiatives supported by Parents & Caregivers @Deloitte
Wellbeing tips and activities powered by Energise@Deloitte
Topped off with other health benefits and insurance opportunities

Empowering our employees with flexible work arrangements remains essential in today's reality:
Hybrid workplace: combination of home office and on-site (+10 offices in Belgium or client's premises).
Part-time employment: all our jobs are open to full-time or part-time work under a 90% or 80% regime.

Join us to make an impact together! Apply now!

Description of the positionCan’t wait to make an impact on the world? You’re not alone. Join us in driving progress in the working world and beyond.

Deloitte is looking for people to grow the Center of Excellence in Treasury Advisory Services as Expert Consultant. Find out if you are ready to make an impact and grow together with us.
You will get the opportunity to
Advise on global treasury policies, procedures, and governance frameworks to ensure alignment with corporate objectives and regulatory requirements of our international client.
Conduct comprehensive assessments of clients’ treasury functions, including cash management, liquidity planning, funding, and risk management. And develop strategies to optimize working capital, cash flow forecasting, and liquidity management.
Support clients in identifying and mitigating financial risks, including interest rate, foreign exchange, and counterparty risks.
Prepare clear and concise reports, presentations, and recommendations for stakeholders.
Design and implement the new treasury organizational structures and operational processes.
Stay abreast of market trends, regulatory changes, and emerging best practices in treasury management.
While
Be part of a fun, energizing team while elevating your soft skills and content knowledge through training programs.
Understand diverse international clients, sectors, and industries to develop market opportunities and service offerings in EMEA with occasional travel.
Train and mentor team members.
We are looking for someone with
A master’s degree or equivalent in economics or finance.
5 to 7 years of experience in Treasury Consulting, and corporate treasury.
Strong understanding of treasury management principles (cash & liquidity management, risk management, & funding strategies).
Experience in advising on treasury policies, controls, and governance frameworks.
Ability to analyse complex data and translate findings into actionable recommendations.
Solution oriented and attention to detail.
Excellent communication skills to engage effectively with clients and team, in English and Dutch or French.

and assist our client in a wide range of various projects in the Financial Services industry from strategy definition to implementation by:
Having quality discussions with clients at C-suite level, demonstrating creativity combined with industry knowledge
Proving our clients a forward-looking view of the most important strategic topics affecting them and define the right set of initiatives and projects to execute upon this strategy
